Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: Caedon15
Reviews.Content: Great views of the city and water. I really enjoyed staying here Room service - good food and service Rooms - our room was large with a small couch and wet bar area. The windows opened just a bit to allow fresh air to come in which was wonderful. Views - beautiful Pool - includes hot tube and sauna. The pool itself is not very large, but didn't seem busy while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicfrac95
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times on business. I have only stayed in the north tower as I've been told it's much nicer. I always book the delux king room as it give you great views of the city. The delux king rooms are on the corner and you get two sides of floor to ceiling views. The rooms are modern and up to date. The beds are extremely comfortable. The gym is pretty good. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful. Both the bar and restaurant are average at best and nowhere to waste your time in such a wonderful location. The hotel is located right in middle of downtown with plenty of great bars and restaurants with in close proximity. This is a solid destination for business or an adult vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel rooms nice, but stay away from the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Laura_in_Victoria
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. Always appreciate the cleanliness of rooms, the bright natural lighting, and the convenience. Reception staff were friendly and helpful, as always. This time I had breakfast in the hotel and was quite angry about the poor quality of service and mediocre array of food which made me feel ripped off. Where to start. I was dining alone, and the hostess/ server, a middle-aged woman with white-blonde hair looked me up and down in an unfriendly appraisal before seating me. Not a great start, so I thought I'd play it safe and minimize my interactions with serving staff by ordering the buffet continental breakfast. My de-caf coffee came right away (but without any cream or sugar). As for the buffet itself -poor selection compared with the Sutton Place down the street, which puts on a beautiful spread for the same price of $22.00 (give or take a dollar). I asked for the highly picked-over cheese plate to be refilled (different server this time) who told me angrily to wait. When I got up to get a second helping (the plates were literally the size of saucers), upon my return, the linens had been stripped off the table and my beverages gone. The initial server had assumed that I had left (without paying? didn't she care about the restaurant getting the money owed by a client?). I think this is more than just one problem employee -it speaks to an overall management issue here. My overall impression: haste and the appearance of business is stressed over quality and thoughtful service. I have a lot of respect for many aspects of the Wall Centre, so it pains me to be so negative, but the restaurant really needs to step up its game. The whole experience left such a bad overall impression -if I hadn't stayed at the hotel before I might vow never to return to the hotel at all.. As it stands, it will be years before I ever try their restaurant again. Hopefully by then the management will have changed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: Nice staff. clean rooms and great location....Very sanitary and pleasant. I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Love Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Tom D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at the Wall Centre. It is well located within walking distancwe of most things that you might want to see. To walk down the hill to Granville Island and hop on one the the small ferries that traffic Vancouver to Granville Island is a must. Stop for lunch at the waterside restaurant just where the Ferry docks. Sit in the sun and enjoy a light lunch with preferable the local brew Kokanee Beer. Just enjoy. Stroll along all the stores located on the Island and visit the absolutely great market. It is absolutely amazing what you can buy there concerning fruits and other offerings. The hotel even though it is very nice is divided up into a North and South Tower. I beleive the Swimming pool is in the North Tower and it is quite a walk to get there. The rooms are nice and clean and if you are on one of the top floors you should ask for a mountain view. The Club lounge where you can have a snack and a contiinental breakfast coluld be a lot better. In fact it is bordering on a low class lounge except for the view from the balcony. The staff is very friendly and helpful and do their best to make you belong. All in all it is a nice hotel but I would prefer The Westin Bayshore of the same gruop of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Towers”
Reviews.Author: kevboom
Reviews.Content: April 2012 was my second stay at the Sheraton Wall Centre. On my first visit, I was fortunate to be placed in the swanky north tower with its modern boutique hotel design. This is the reason I rebooked at this Sheraton for a conference--the north tower was REALLY nice and we had an incredible view of the mountains and bay. On my more recent visit, however, we got bumped over to the south tower. I could be wrong, but the branding on the south tower (Wall Centre Hotel) seemed to indicate Sheraton acquired it from another company and expanded their operation? Regardless, the difference between the two towers was pretty drastic, with the south tower showing considerably more signs of wear. For one, our mattress was horrible--completely worn out with springs poking through the cloth. For $199 per night, I'm sorry, but you deserve a decent mattress. The manager should be ashamed to book rooms with mattresses that bad (room 3308 if interested). I will give the hotel credit for a central location near popular Davie and Robson Streets, but not at all near Canada Place or the convention center--a LONG walk. Certainly plenty of restaurants in the immediate area and a movie theatre and grocery as well right on Burrard Street. The hotel also deserves kudos for free Internet--most Sheratons in big cities would NOT give you free Internet, so this was appreciated. I think they made their money back in parking fees though at $40 per night. Ouch! At least it was easy to park and go without valet, and with in and out privileges. Our south tower room also had a refrigerator for drinks, which was nice. Unfortunately, the fridge in our room (3308) did not cool at all, but I suppose it might in other rooms? The room safe was also nice to have. Overall, not a bad hotel (friendly staff, detailed housekeeping), but make sure to confirm a room in the north tower if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel option for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: nymet4life
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Sheraton Vancouver and thought it met all my expectations of a good business hotel. It is centrally located in the city and is in walking distance to several good restaurant options. The rooms were typical Sheraton quality and I had a room with decent views of the city. The staff was also attentive when I required there help. It is also close by to the Robson street shopping district and the Granville entertainment district so it provides several decent options to distract yourself in the evening and during the day. In addition, if you are a Starwood Preferred Guest member you can book a special rate on the hotels website which provides free parking and complimentary continental breakfast. Also the hotel has free Wi-Fi in hotel rooms. These three additional add-ons make this a great value compared to other hotels in the neighborhood. I wouldnt hesitate to book a room at this hotel the next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get it”
Reviews.Author: Jay G
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed here in a while and now remember why. Not there is anything wrong per say but in my opinion a lot of other places in Vancouver are much nicer an updated. The kicker was $40 for parking per night!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel with luxe appeal”
Reviews.Author: Sarasingh
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times, both with kids and without. Only hotel in the area that can accomodate a large family in one room. The family suites with a king plus two double beds. Nice rooms, kids channels on TV, a great indoor pool with two hot tubs, nice food. A nice two-level club lounge with the usual happy-hour food and some AWESOME espresso. Service is great. Really beautiful grounds connecting the two towers. Great bar with nice entertainment on weekends. Rad pillows and reliable, luxe quality beds.

Reviews.Title: “They listen to their customers”
Reviews.Author: Minty_Fresh_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel years ago before I decided to move to Vancouver. We chose this location because it was centrally located downtown. Close to shops, seawall, trains and seabus. Everywhere we wanted to visit was just of walking distance. On our arrival we noticed we were not greeted like everyone else was. We looked like a very young couple, perhaps they thought we were a bunch of kids touring with our parents. We thought everyone working there was being rude and ignoring us. Our trip was short, and the second day we ate out for lunch and came back with leftovers which we thought would be nice to stick into the fridge and eat later on. Turns out our fridge was not working and there was something wrong with the wiring. We called the front desk to have it fixed and they said that they will have someone up within 20 mins. We agreed to this knowing that it would only take 30 mins tops but instead that person took a few hours to come up. This was a waste of a whole afternoon and since we were only there for a few days we were furious. We could have asked them to come after our walk, but instead we waited. So we explained to the hotel manager that our stay has not been easy since we lost a day of touring just waiting for the mechanic to come and everyone was very rude. She apologized for the inconvenience and gave us a room at a higher floor which was twice the size of ours with a really big bathroom and came with breakfast at the top floor with a great view of the city. That made the rest of our vacation, truly deserves 5 stars for listening and doing the best to accommodate their customers. We decided to stay in for most the remaining 2 days and did the touring when we moved to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with very good conference facilities, several blocks from Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: lcking82
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for several nights in March 2012. The hotel is approximately a $35-40 cab ride from the airport, or several blocks from the nearest commuter rail station. It is located very close to several restaurants and bars, as well as some very lovely churches. It is several blocks from the Convention Center, unfortunately. Check-in was swift. The hotel is two towers that are not connected as far as I could tell, so it was a little confusing when I was directed to my room across the plaza. The rooms were comfortable. The first room I was placed in had a broken outlet in the bathroom, and the hotel staff were very nice and prompt about switching my rooms. The second room was a little larger, too. There is a nice TV and huge windows with very nice views. The bed was cozy, very soft with two thick duvet covers on it. You felt as though you were in a cacoon when you snuggled into it! Bathroom was spacious, although the fixtures on our shower were strange, and I always felt like the water was either too hot or too cold. We had a meeting there, and it was VERY well-run. The meals were delicious, and the coffee/soda/teas available were plentiful. I really enjoyed the area they put us in for receptions, too. Overall, this was a very nice hotel for a business trip. It is farther from the convention center than I would've liked. Join Starwood Preferred Guest program to get on higher floor with better view. I would probably stay closer to Conv center if I were returning for a trade show, but for a small meeting--Sheraton Wall Center is a comfortable, classy, and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, room service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: HalifaxGreg
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel - good location, renovated rooms, good fitness centre, comfortable beds. The only area for improvement is room service. I ordered on 4 occassions over my stay and the food was always cold. I called an asked about it. The kitchen is prepared in the north tower, but in was in the south tower - by the time the food arrived it was luke warm at best. For example, the butter would not melt on my toast. I have seen other hotels with stainless steel boxes that the transport the food in so its always hot. Until they get those, i would not order more than a salad if you are in the south tower. I relayed my comments to the front desk twice during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Bunhun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre from 11th Mar 2012 to 13th Mar 2012. The staff at the check in desk, a guy was not welcoming nor friendly. He did not greet us at the desk and simply just ask for our credit card. Our stay was already prepaid and he did not inform us that he had placed a hold on our card for incidentals. We were from America and we only realize that when the bank called and ask if it was a fraud transaction. Of course i understand that almost all hotels placed a hold on cards for incidentals but i just wish that we were informed. We check in at the South Tower and the guy again did not provide us directions to get to the North Tower nor were we told that there were free Wifi throughout the hotel. Rooms were still ok but overall, not a pleasant experience. This hotel is not exactly located near downtown too. So be prepared to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, and is maintained very well. My room was in the north tower, one of the lower floors (7th). It wasn't the largest room I've ever been in, and the shape of the building made some of the angles a bit odd (I had a devil of a time trying to open the door while holding a room service tray to put it outside the room for pickup), but everything you expect in a sleeping room was great. The hotel offers two levels of wifi--one complimentary, with lower bandwidth, and one hi-speed for a fee. My hi-speed was supposedly included in my room rate. However, I was there for a conference, and because I was working needed to download a 4 gig file once. It took several (ok, closer to many) hours. I'm not sure yet what made it hi-speed...so, be aware that if you are going to pay the money for the hi-speed connection, that still may not give you everything you would want or need in terms of band-width. Also, the breakfast staff in the north tower restaurant seemed very harried when I went there to get breakfast once. It appeared that either there was a decision not to fully staff for that morning, or someone didn't show up for work that day. I ended up ordering room service (hence the need to remove the tray mentioned above), and rooms service was very fast and quite good. I would absolutely stay in this hotel again, and the only reasons it doesn't get five stars are the small things I mention here. Reserve there without any concern. You should have a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe_petr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in 2009. This hotel in my eyes was great. The bed was amazing such a good sleep. I only stayed one night i never tried any of the amenities. Good location average price for Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: geniejava
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre for one week for a conference. My room was on the 30th floor of the south tower. The view was absolutely gorgeous. The rooms are small but the beds are really comfortable and there's free wifi throughout the hotel. The bottled water in the rooms are also free. The hotel itself has a really weird architecture. My conference meetin rooms were near the north tower so I had to do a lot of walking to get from south to north. The elevators in the south tower are incredibly slow, north tower elevators were a bit faster. The hotel location is great though - smack in the middle of downtown Vancouver. Hotel service was also really good. Overall I do recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel with a bad location”
Reviews.Author: intlalberta
Reviews.Content: First I would like explain why I said it was a bad location. This hotel claims to be downtown but it is on the edge of downtown which means a long walk to downtown ( which I wanted to avoid). The rooms were small and difficult to move around; a long mirror would have been nice. The staff is ok, nothing special, considering that you are supposed to be staying at a 4 star hotel. I would definetely not go back to this hotel. The walks to downtown wouldn't be bad if the weather was nice but since it was raining all the time, it was just annoying...it is an option if you are in Vancouver for the hospital; it is literally across the street

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly dated room”
Reviews.Author: dracooper
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre this weekend, and the hotel is nicely situated just a bit south of Robson. Short walk to all the nice shopping, good food is nearby too. Upon check in to our 500$ 2 bedroom suite, I was shocked to see the decor. It looked like a mishmash of furniture pieces from the 80's. Even the trim and finishing in the room seemed very dated. For 500$ I was thinking luxury, but instead received a trip down memory lane. It literally looked like they had converted a dated condo into a hotel. The view was terrific, the service was great, but the room certainly did not meet my expectations for that price. For that money I would recommend getting two rooms at another hotel if you are travelling as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MSkinner
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night post-Whistler here in March 2012. It`s a great spot, right in the downtown area. Within walking distance to the little ferry to Granville Island, close to the main shopping area, Yaletown, etc. The hotel is very nice and the staff were very helpful. Rooms were nice, beds were VERY comfortable. We got a Family Suite room and it was a good size. Weird layout, but nice (you enter the room, go down a long hallway and at the end of it is the general living area, which included a small sink and fridge, 2 beds, a chair, and the bathroom. There`s another bedroom attached to it with a queen bed.) We used the pool, hot tub, and sauna area and they were nice. Not amazing, but nice. The workout areas (several) looked good. I`m not sure which hotel tower we stayed in (there are 2), but you had a bit of a hike to the fitness & pool area. Did not get a chance to eat at the hotel, so can not comment on that. Brother in law had a room on the 30th floor and the view of the harbour at sunset was incredible! Overall, very nice hotel in a good spot, so would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday weekend in Vancouver and Canucks game”
Reviews.Author: jasmine499148
Reviews.Content: Great location ,St Pauls Hospital is right across the street for patients needing to go there.right downtown, can walk to from Skytrain Canada Line Airport.close to Yaletown, alot of great restraunts close by. Robson street for shopping and Pacific Centre mall.Rooms are very clean and comfortable and quiet. The restraunt and bar are a little pricey though. my only compliant is no queen size beds, only double and King rooms. Great views of the city from room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel...”
Reviews.Author: universalmgm
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood gold member I have stayed at many Sheraton hotels. This was not my first time to Vancouver. This Sheraton was in a good location, walking distance to everything. The rooms were clean, stay in the north tower. The down side was, parking rate was outrageous, little things. Like Internet and small requests, they would charge you for.

Reviews.Title: “Not our family favourite”
Reviews.Author: IslandVisit0r
Reviews.Content: Everything was so so to be quite frank, and we are dissapointed. At arrival, no one to check us in - 3 other parties were around and one guy threw up his arms in dispair. Location so-so. Two double beds in room: for a family of four, not the best sleeping space (we are used to 2 queens), and room (although furnished modern) space a bit small for our liking. Wasn't nice to have to walk in rain to the north tower after check in. Wasnt nice to find the bath plug not fit tightly (water draining thus) and having to bathe children quickly and invent a make shift plug ourselves. Not nice either to have to wait to have in room dining table removed. Not nice not to find a spot in the restaurant for breakfast in the morning and having to go to our room again. Lots of business people around, and I think more ideal for business travellers than traveling families like us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Matt D
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre and had a wonderful time. The hotel staff was very friendly. We stayed in the north tower on the 15th floor. Our room was well appointed with a great view of the city. There was a small desk area, a small refrigerator and "bar" area, large bathroom, and amazingly comfortable bed. The room was clean, bright, and inviting. We did not use the pool or eat in the restaurants, but both looked very nice. We were very impressed with the hotel grounds. The property takes up an entire city block with nice landscaping and lighted trees at night. Everything seems meticulously manicured. The location was great. We could walk to markets, restaurants, etc. Parking is expensive, but so is parking in any city. We we found a self park lot about a block away that was 12hr for $12. We had no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “not safe”
Reviews.Author: seekingtomorrow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from January 16th until the 19th. During this time a murder took place in the lobby restaurant on January 17th. There were no apologies from management regarding this and no explanation to guests about what was going on. Stay somewhere that's safer where people aren't getting shot in the head.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rick S
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this property. Loyalty counts... I'm Platinum with SPG and am typically upgraded to a suite upon check-in (even when using SPG points for redemption nights). The rooms are clean, and the sheets are comfortable. Parking is extra (rate is $30 before hat), but that's to be expected in this area. The hotel is 2 blocks off Davie street, and there are some fun bars there (= 4pm guaranteed late check-out for Platinum guests is great, and I've never run into any problems with requesting this service. They also have an executive lounge, but I keep waking up way after breakfast time, so I've never actually visited the lounge (located in the south tower).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for 1 night, good location downtown close to multiple attraction and food. Typical Sheraton... smaller than average rooms but very clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would Stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Apart from reception, a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: lamington_jones
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning from an international flight, very tired and crossing our fingers for an early check-in. No such luck and, in fact, we found the receptionist very unfriendly, cold, uncommunicative and verging on rude. I don't usually pay much attention to service standards, but (being tired and emotional) I was disappointed with how unsympathetic and unhelpful the receptionist was. Anyway, we stored our bags with the concierge and wandered off for several hours. Our room was very nice though (and I think we were in the older tower). It was smallish, but very comfortable and clean. And the location is fantastic. We enjoyed eating and drinking on Davie Street and were able to walk to the seawall, the Granville Island ferry and Stanley Park, all of which I highly recommend. I would stay there again beause the attitude of staff is not that important to me - I just didn't feel very welcome on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great. If you can afford it, go ahead.”
Reviews.Author: Hunnai
Reviews.Content: THE SERVICE: I was surprised when the Concierge/Doorman opened the door for me when I got off the taxi. He was all smiley and helpful; I think other Front Office staff should take some lessons from him... The Front Office Supervisor who facilitated my check-in, however, did not smile at all when I arrived (This, I was really unimpressed). His eyes were fixated on the computer screen the entire time and didn't once look up until he handed over my room cards. It was definitely an awkward check-in! I also found it weird how I didn't have to sign any papers or confirm my departure during check-in...maybe that's just their operations or I'm not used to it. THE ROOM: I read descriptions of the 2-bedroom suite online and booked with great expectations; the reservation department even confirmed the room type I booked for (in which she described as a 2-bedroom executive suite with 1 king, 1 double, a kitchenette, a living space, and 2 bathrooms at $245.00+taxes CAD). However, I was a bit disappointed when I checked in only to find out I actually booked a Junior Family Suite and not the Executive 2-Bedroom that I was confirmed for. The Junior Family Suite was small and the area with the king bed was connected to the living room which I didn't like. I had some friends coming over from outside the city so I needed the 2 separate bedrooms. I called down to Front Desk/ Guest Services to confirm my booking and the agent informed me that since the reservations department is from Ontario, they cannot exactly confirm the exact room types as they don't work onsite the property. When asked whether I could upgrade to the room type I originally wanted, she sort of hesitated to give me an answer as she probably thought I wanted a complimentary upgrade. It didn't stop them from charging me $500.00+taxes CAD for the 2-Bedroom Suite but I didn't mind; I was tired, hungry, and had the money so I accepted the upgrade with the fee willingly. Regardless, I found their explanation regarding their reservations department quite absurd as they didn't even try to lighten the situation and apologize about the room type discrepancy. Overall, the room was nice with a beautiful view of the ocean -- lots of space, nice bathroom, wonderful floor-to-ceiling windows. THE BEDS: Sweet sleeper? I didn't have a good sleep because the beds and pillows were WAY TOO SOFT! I felt like Goldilocks stealing a nap from Mama Bears' bed because they were ridiculously uncomfortable. They literally didn't have a shape and it hurt my neck and back the entire night. BACK OF HOUSE STAFF: The housekeeper on the 30th floor was the friendliest of all staff - very nice and thoughtful. She actually gave me a better impression/image of the Sheraton Wall Centre than the Front Line Operations staff. Generally speaking, it was a nice hotel; it could have been better but it was good enough for a 1 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great view of city and mountains”
Reviews.Author: Martyn W
Reviews.Content: You said: We spent three nights and was surprised to have the 27th floor! The view of the city and mountain was fabulous! We got a great welcome when we arrived at the hotel and generally found in all people we met in Vancouver very friendly people! I would without a doubt stay here again. The biggest downside was that I fealt I did not get value for money. It was over $200 per night. I have had better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable beds, great location, bar and room service terrible.”
Reviews.Author: ndrewg
Reviews.Content: We splurged and ordered room service breakfast. The coffee, toast were all cold, our bagels (also cold) arrived without cream cheese so we had to wait an additional 20 nibutes for that to arrive. Gratuity of 17% was per-included (for our convenience of course) plus a $5 delivery charge. Ended up paying over $50 for cold toast, cold coffee, and cold bagels without cream cheese. Not happy. Also, we went to the bar last night and ordered a Mojito cocktail, it looked and tasted like a bunch of lawn clippings in a huge glass of soda water. Wins my award for the worst cocktail I've ever ordered. Although we weren't impressed with the food or bar experience here, the location was great and the bed was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the restaurant. Otherwise it's OK”
Reviews.Author: Scargod
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a great view of the harbor. We were on the 25th floor, a club floor, where there is a private room for breakfast and drinks and an office are upstairs that is usually very quiet and private feeling. They do no have a decent drink selection, though some beer and wine is free. If you want a "real" breakfast or a "real scotch", you must go to the other tower, to Bar 1 or the restaurant in the same spot. We had one dinner at the restaurant because we felt lazy. The cost for each entree was $22. For that we received small bowls of pasta with seafood or sausage and chicken. The sausage and chicken was fairly good; the other was not. The shrimp were popcorn sized and there was too much cheese and salt and virtually no cream sauce. It was dry and gooey. No bread nor anything else came with these bowls of pasta....for $22! The hot wings were tasty, but way too salty. So, like I said in the title, skip the restaurant. The bar is fairly pricey, too.

Reviews.Title: “HOT HOT water”
Reviews.Author: MimicoGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on business. The water in my room was SCALDING HOT. Seriously. No cold water at all. It took 2 days of complaining (during which time I could not shower) before they moved me. You would think after that I would at least get upgraded. Especially since I am a SPG member. But no. Did I mention that I am a professional event planner? You would think they might be interested in that but apparently not. Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurenkarl
Reviews.Content: Normally stay at the Westin but wanted the Sheraton Link and free WiFi that this hotel offered. Efficient check in and was able to secure at 4:00 check out. Nice size room with floor to ceiling windows and very comfortable beds. I stayed in the North Tower and did find it a little noisy across from the hospital but it would not prevent me from staying here again. Great location to all of downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business hotel”
Reviews.Author: COCOFromOttawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all covered - efficient check in, great staff, large comfy rooms, clean, handy location. Breakfast staff particularly excellent - zoomy service left me maximum time to read paper and check email before getting on with my day. Rooms on hospital side quite noisy from ambulance sirens. Suites very large and extra comfy. Only note: subject of recent gang related shooting in one of the (closed now) restaurants handled a bit awkwardly by staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I reserved, but nice place”
Reviews.Author: punkrawker4783
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room in the North Tower, and asked for North facing, I got South Tower South facing. While I am not one to squabble unless really necessary, I went with the program. It was a nice room, floor to ceiling windows, view of South Vancouver. I was somewhat difficult to keep the room warm, it was cold out and all those windows create a challenge. We also got the Breakfast buffet (included in our rate, cause it would NOT be worth $22/each) which was pretty basic. The service was good, valet was quick, is in an excellent location, about a 10min walk to SkyTrain, 3 bus lines within one block. We would stay again, but next time I might stand my ground on which tower i booked.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: OttawaMimi
Reviews.Content: A twenty minute cab ride from the airport. Quick and efficient check-in and a room with a great view. Only slight downside is the very noisy fan which won't be a problem for those who like to fall asleep to white noise. Good location, near the shops on Robson, walking distance to the waterfront and plenty of restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and modern”
Reviews.Author: BoywonderTo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre for two weeknights. It was a wonderful stay. The location of the hotel is pretty convenient. Skytrain/Robson/business district are all just a few blocks north, but it is just far enough so you don’t feel you are in the midst of all the hustle and bustle. I was on a fairly high floor, and loved the floor-to-ceiling, wall-to-wall window and the view. The room was spacious and modern. The décor was simple, chic and practical. The wifi in the room worked very well. The bed was very comfortable. Didn’t interact with the staff much so can’t really comment on the service. The health club and the poor were pretty nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingbadger17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on vacation in August and it was a good stay. Front desk staff was pleasent and were able to upgrade us to a room with a wonderful water view. The room was a bit small, especially the bathroom, but it was very clean. The hotel has an excellent on site fitness center with a decent pool (not quite big enough, considering the hotels size). When we needed directions, the conceirge was very helpful. The hotel is a little more of a walk to Canada Place then you would think, but a nearby walking path along the beach can get you to Stanley Park. If you stay here though, expect to have a car (and pay an outrageous amount for parking). Overall, I would recommend the Sheraton and thought it was a decent value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,clean hotel in wonderful downtown location”
Reviews.Author: silverbike
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vancouver for 3 day with our 2 young kids (aged 8 & 5). We choose this hotel based on it's star-rating, reasonable cost and centrally based location. The hotel staff were professional and courteous. We had no problems or complaints with our room. We had mapped out all the places were wanted to visit and because of it's central location, we were able to walk or take transportation very easily to our selected tourist spots. Therefore, we did not need to rent a car for our Vancouver visit and therefore no expensive parking costs. We had heard that parking in downtown Vancouver was quite expensive. Would have liked to rate this hotel 5/5 but we found the cost of eating at this hotel quite expensive. We had gone out for breakfast 2 out of 3 mornings but decided on the last morning that we would have breakfast in the hotel. The cost of breakfast (non-buffet breakfast -- standard fare) was approximately $80 for 2 adults and 2 young kids! I would advise eating out for your meals -- there are some great local restaurants/cafes within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “amazing view”
Reviews.Author: Kate C
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel because it across the St Pauls Hospital . I was having minor surgery and this was convenient. Our room was spotless and quite large with a fantastic city view. The bed was VERY comfortable. I think the decor was a tad dated and could do with an upgrade but that is rather unimportant. We would stay there again but it would not be my first choice because I prefer a smaller hotel with more of a quirky vibe. It is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: pamarx200
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three night and didn’t find anything wrong! In other words, lived up to the global Sheraton standard by providing a good-sized room, all the amenities that one would want or expect at a very reasonable price booked directly on the hotel website. First: great view (from a high floor) and great location, within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, cafes and conveniences. Second, the room design is a bit unusual, with a big pillar separating the bed fro the sitting area. I found it distracting on first sight, but ended up liking the separation because it actually gives you the illusion (and the actuality) of more space. Plus, the bathroom had two sinks and two sets of the amenities. I had no problems with water pressure. Third the mini fridge is empty so that you can put what you want in it instead of having to work around the overpriced offerings. Fourth, wifi is free and fast. Lastly I didn’t find any problems with the staff—everyone was pretty friendly and on the way out we were offered bottles of water for our drive. My only possible complaint is that the pool picture on the web is typically deceptive. The pool can’t be bigger than 12 meters long but of course on the picture, it looks big and luxurious. I guess this is “normal” for hotels with small pools (ie to angle the picture so that it looks huge). The gym is pretty good, though. But aside from the pool, I was pretty satisfied with the Sheraton, particularly at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “BIG BED good pool”
Reviews.Author: Blair W
Reviews.Content: Close to everything downtown. Walkable and taxi - able. New and well kept. Now as most hotels in downtown vancouver you pay to PARK and you pay 21% tax on PARKING! CRAZYNESS. Now i live 1 hour from DownTown Vancouver but if you want to drink and do something fun downtown you need a ride home or a hotel room. If you cant afford insane expensive hotels for a night or 2 chose this one. Typical price for nice clean friendly room

Reviews.Title: “great urban hotel”
Reviews.Author: enilorac22
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to the Sheraton brand, quite nice and has amazing floor to ceiling glass windows. It's really amazing to wake up to that view. Extremely comfortable beds too. Nice conference spaces too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel - Extremely expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: HighTechTraveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed for a night at the Sheraton Wall Centre. The hotel itself, like most Sheratons nowadays has been renovated or is pretty new and well kept. Parking a car at the hotel, though, cost $45, about 30% of the cost of my room and about double what other parking complexes charge for a 24h parking. The bed was very comfortable and the room was semi-soundproof - a little noise did get in from the street, but not enough to bother you at night. I would be happy to return, but next time I'll find a cheaper garage to park my car overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: iscreenwriter
Reviews.Content: Location....Location....Location..This is in the heart of the city on the main drag Burrard St. Close to shops and attractions. If you can't afford the new 5 star locations this will be ok. Only issue i had was at night i hear strange clicking noises in the room. Switched rooms next day and it was fine. Nothing special here. Having stayed at two other hotels in the city this is my least favorite by far.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: panam747
Reviews.Content: Last time I visited Vancouver, I left with the impression that it is a town of nice folks who appreciated finer things in life. A weekend here at the Sheraton Vancouver-Wall Center changed it all for the worse. The lobby is very small and is taken up by a sad looking Christmas Tree. The doorman was not interested and neither were the three receptionists. A very, very dry acknowledgment of my existence and our room was issued. Our rate covered breakfast and parking, but neither were addressed until questioned. Furthermore, a surprised parking fee was tagged onto our bill on check out. A simple "oh" was all I got for explanation. Plus: fantastic view from the South Tower, and it had a small alcove with sofa to watch the cloud drift by. Minus: old room and no night stand. Water pressure in the shower can be a bit weak and ventilation lacking. Walls are a bit thin and you could hear doors slamming down the hall. The hotel is across from a hospital, a block away from the YMCA and is about two blocks away from Robson street, the shopping district. There is a supermarket down the street and a Seven Eleven nearby, to stock up on all those forgotten treats. The fantastic view from the high floors of the South Tower make you forget all the little annoyance from the staff. Best for no frill stay, and nothing more. You will love the ocean and mountain while in the room, but feel dirty and in need of a long shower when you leave. Double check your bills.....too many "added mistakes." Tip: high floor, south tower rooms. The hotel accommodates animals and charges CAD 35 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel for business or vacation stay.”
Reviews.Author: CC_Hughes
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Sheraton Wall Centre. Everyone from the Bellman to the housekeeping staff was pleasant and professional. The location is Fantastic, walking distance to everything downtown and to the Granville Island Ferry.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gordontaylor1971
Reviews.Content: stayed here in may.great location.great gym.clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Montreal246
Reviews.Content: Our room had a wonderful view and was fairly large. It was almost like being in a suite as we had a sitting area next to the bedroom area. The bed was particularly comfortable. This hotel is great for business travelers as the rooms have lots of electrical outlets and free wireless internet access. Our concierge was very helpful with restaurant suggestions and reservations. We had breakfast at the hotel and found it to be very expensive with only fair service. When making reservations, try getting a higher floor to fully appreciate the superb views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Things mysteriously disappear from room...”
Reviews.Author: jptherockstar
Reviews.Content: I was in town on business. I left my iPhone in the room when I went out one afternoon. Came back and my room had been cleaned, and my iPhone was missing. When I approached the front desk staff to raise a complaint, they were dismissive and told me that if it was found I would get a call. I sure hope some housekeeper is enjoying their new phone. Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Ghoston Wall Centre”
Reviews.Author: Petitaix
Reviews.Content: Good location although not right next to a Skytrain station. Early check-in went like a breeze in a hotel that seemed desert on a cold monday morning. Nice room in the North Tower, nothing exceptional, no special view, but well appointed. Spacious bathroom. Had to wait for check out as there was some kind of maintenance issue of key card reader going on. My overall impression was quite depressing: I felt like I was alone in this giant hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: toddycrackkorn
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the amenities and service, top notch. Beautifull building . Parking a little much but in a beautifull metropolitin city like vancouver I guess I should expect to pay for valet. Will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing atmosphere, fantastic building layout :)”
Reviews.Author: Coastlover85
Reviews.Content: My husband, and I wanted a nice, romantic, easy going mini vacation without children, and just some time for ourselves. My parents could only provide babysitting for 2 days, and one night. I had searched a fair bit for something that would spark our interests, provide some extras, and stretch our dollars. I came across the Sheraton Wall Center, in beautiful, close to home, and very diverse city of Vancouver. I managed to find the best price through booking through the Sheraton website specials. I choose the Club upgrade, king room, w/t a private, small balcony, floor to ceiling windows, flat screen t.v., very clean bedding, bathroom, room in general. (I had asked as a special request on the special request type box for exceptional cleanliness. As I have had problems with previous hotels in the past that I have not written a review as of yet, but will). Now this is the kicker; This room was on the 26th Floor on the special Club Floor. Yes, I had got an upgrade to a 26th floor king room price on the Club floor, with the Club Room serving h'orderves in early evening, and breakfast in the morning included. There is complementary coffee/tea/espresso( top of the line little machine), small jars of honey, jams, fine cheeses, fruit, meat appys, etc. My husband was so amazed at everything, and could not believe how wonderful it was, and how much we got for the price. The whole hotel was fantastic, layout, decor, marble, tile, wood, height(very high ceilings, and open). The pool, hot tub, extensive gym areas, sauna, and change rooms were exceptionally clean, well laid out. Towels, locks, and (hair dryers, woman's only) are provided.(Health Club, located on the ground level, and a short couple of steps outside to access) . The whole Health Club was decorated tropically with many tropical trees, and ice cube tiles, very nice ambiance overall. The Vida Spa is next door, and although I did not get the opportunity to use their services, they provided a $40.00 off coupon with our accommodation, and have extensive healing, and relaxation treatments available. The hotel property is very large for downtown Vancouver, and decorated quite well, and extensively with beautiful, exquisite winter lights around all the property's many trees. If your like us, and feel room service is not for you, then there is a Marketplace IGA down the street, where you can have a large selection of fresh, ready made entrees, snacks, groceries, essentials, etc.(Cheaper alternative, and more food choices). The ONLY thing I was not happy about was the over-height parking availability. We have a club van that is 16 ft long, and not much over height. However, it was a problem to know where to park. We parked in the front of the entrance underground with some Hummers. (there was ONLY 3 spots anywhere). Parking with tax was $40.00 from check-in, to check-out. I would suggest if you do not need your vehicle to explore out of city as we were, and are staying for more than 1 night, then either hire a limo with transfer from point A to B(different, cheaper rates, and you can relax, maybe with a drink or two, ask a limo company), taxi, sky-train, or bus. Overall, great experience, and would definitely go again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Advice from a native Vancouverite...stay here”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCanadian
Reviews.Content: I live here and I have stayed at a few downtown hotels for conferences and other events. The ones that are most comparable are the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver, the Hyatt Regency and the Wall Centre. Let me start by saying that for the rooms alone, the Sheraton is superior to the Hyatt and the Fairmont. Service was excellent at both the Sheraton and the Hyatt. The Sheraton is a little further down Burrard, away from Gastown, the Seabus and perhaps the more touristy part of town. But it is within easy walking distance of all these sight, and closer to trendy Yaletown than the other two. I haven't stayed at the Waterfront or the Pan Pacific, but for the money, the best bet is the Sheraton Wall Centre. Best mattress hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Rocks”
Reviews.Author: BevAnne23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early November 2011, the service was fabulous and the room was awesome. The beds were really comfortable and there was a good space to the room. The hotel is situated close to the centre of town but also within walking distance to the waterfront. The gym is fantastic, with loads of equipment and a great pool. The business centre was useful and easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Cafe One Chef Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: travelpigletCA
Reviews.Content: We came to play tourist in our own city, got a beautiful room on the 27th floor and a great deal with our SPG Gold membership. But the very best thing was the chef at Cafe One at breakfast. We have a daughter with a severe peanut allergy. The chef not only came out and went through all the buffet items and checked ingredients of anything brought in from outside suppliers, he actually made, and hand delivered, a special peanut safe waffle just for Zoey!! Amazing service that gets 5 gold stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & location”
Reviews.Author: mike219jma
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, the value was great. High floor, spectacular views, convenient location. When we come back to Vancouver, this will be a top option. Please see the rest of my review and pictures here - http://infam.us/tGHHkM

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Vickimsea
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton. Our room was spacious and we had an amazing view. The beds were comfy with great linens. We got a great price on the room by bidding on Priceline. The biggest disappontment was the cost of the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: savanah11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre for two nights in mid September and was very happy with our experience. While we used to live in Vancouver, it's always interesting to go back as a tourist. The hotel was booked thru a discount site and we did not have any problems with the front desk. They were pleasant and helpful. Our room was located on the 24 th floor with sweeping views of the downtown. It was clean quiet and up to date. Everything worked the way it was supposed to with no problems at all. The bathroom was decent size and (again) very clean. The only reason they got a lower rating on service was they were to courier an article I left behind and it took over a month to receive it. Small complaint for an overall fantastic stay. Very centrally located and we walked everywhere. No need for cabs or rental cars. Close to some fabulous dining and shopping. Even took the Canada line to get to the airport $2.50 compared to the $60 we paid for car service to get us downtown. I would recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but north tower better than south tower”
Reviews.Author: Tracy98110
Reviews.Content: This is a nice large property, well located in Vancouver, very friendly staff. But, the south tower is a bit dated, get the north tower if you can....

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable 3 night stay in first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjbcjb
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the Sheraton Wall Centre. Check in was efficient and gracious. Our room, in the north tower, had an incredible view of the city, mountains and water. The staff is professional and helpful. There are lots of small cafes within a short distance. For breakfast I would recommend the Cafe France at Smithe and Hornby. The location is convenient to most everything. Ask for the north tower and a view.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Views”
Reviews.Author: Love2Quilt2Day
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful view from our hotel room. We just sat and took in the view. The rooms were very clean, the linens fresh and welcoming. We were close to all the amenities. Umbrellas are loaned out, which is something that is appreciated while touring Vancouver. Downside: the workout room is located in a strange place and of course there is the parking fee which is typical but expensive if you are a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Archivista
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Wall for a conference.Amazing view from our room but the service didn't match the view. Upon arrival there was only 1 robe. After 2 calls and 1 hour later the robe finally appeared. Then, the next morning as I was just about to hop into the shower, I discovered that there were no shower caps. Then, deciding to have a bath instead, the bathtub has one of those square backs that one cannot lean back on. Why build a swanky hotel and put in cheap bathtubs?. The soap dish in the shower was falling off the wall. I asked reception about the shower caps and was told to just phone down to get one. I suggested that this wasn't very helpful when you are just ready to get into the shower. The towels while clean were very small. In order to use the elevators guests need to use the room passcard, only 80% of the time I just in the elevator and pushed my floor. What security is this. And then the passcard demagnetized - 4 times over a 3 day stay. A bit inconvenient. The health centre was very cramped and the weights were relics from years ago. The treadmills and stationery bikes were in one room and you have to pass through the ladies or mens locker rooms to get to the weights etc.Again, the towels looked old and were very small. Pool and hot tub looked nice. Conference food was very good and the location of the hotel is quite central for getting around Vancouver. The waitress in the breakfast area and buffer was very helpful. I asked to talk to the manager but never heard from her.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great surroundings in an awesome city!”
Reviews.Author: Chalas78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of so many of what Vancouver has to offer. If you can't get out or just want to chill the rooms are fantastic and the spa is one of the best I've ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Still rates very good”
Reviews.Author: BigTipper
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property more than a few times over the years. They always deliver a good experience. The only little odd issue is that the hotel is spread out between two towers, with a third tower of condos in between. You may get delivered to one lobby, only to be sent packing (about a hundred metres) to another building, to your room. Elevators in the building I usually end up in are located in two spots, as well, so you may get turned around once or twice. Other than that, the hotel is great. Staff are professional. Rooms are modern and in good shape. Rooms can be a somewhat unusual shape, due to the curved walls, and that gets reflected in the bathrooms, as well, but no issue with this. It's actually a bit of a plus from my perspective, as it isn't the norm. Rooms are quiet. HVAC works and is not too noisy. Great beds, but keep the temperature in the room turned down if you're going to keep the heavy duvet on. It's pretty warm. With my Starwood membership, they always have a couple of bottles of water available, and there is a mini fridge to keep them cool. Big LCD TV with lots of channels. Should be everything you want. Great central location, on Robson, near a train station, etc.

Reviews.Title: “West Coast Zen - aaaand exhale”
Reviews.Author: discerningdweller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Club Intrawest section (the top 3 floors) of the Sheraton Wall Centre for a shopping weekend in Vancouver this past weekend. While it was my first time at this Club Intrawest location, it was essentially just as I expected from the reviews here. There was a sweet Club lounge on the 29th floor and, as Intrawest members, we enjoyed full access to the Sheraton's facilities. The hotel was extremely clean and most aspects were in working order. Unfortunately the music player in my room was stuck on MAXIMUM volume and neither I, nor the maintenance tech, was able to fix it! I was disappointed to have no tunes during my stay. On another note, the pool and workout facility at this hotel appeared a bit of an afterthought due to the small size and odd location. When I asked front desk how to get to the pool etc, it was a rather convoluted route of ducking through hallways between conference rooms and storage areas..thankfully it was evening and there were no events on! It was the end of the day when we ventured down to the hot tub/pool, but the place was in disarray and badly needed to be cleaned. Other common areas, such as the lobby and restaurant, have been given much more attention with their updated decor, etc. However, if you are just stopping in for a quick stay, don't let this discourage you. Another thing I found a bit irritating was how early the attendants began slamming doors and cleaning on Sunday morning. It was definitely before 9am and it was far too loud to sleep! I thought it was decent that the parking attendants let me keep my car in the parkade for a few hours beyond checkout, so that I could finish my shopping without having to pay to park at another location. Not all hotels are this flexible. All in all, I would likely return to this place for the fantastic location and beautiful views!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loybus
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on business trip. Clean and comfortable room, wonderful bed, free basic Internet. Room was close to elevator, so a little noisy, otherwise very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hartss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in July 2011 on Starwood's cash-and-points deal. This is a really nice hotel, a pleasant surprise even. It is big, yes, but doesn't have that anonymous convention center hotel feel to it. Lots of honey-colored wood everywhere, lots of glass (the rooms all have a literal wall of windows - the city views are amazing). Check-in was fast, friendly and efficient and the concierges all get an A for effort (if not knowledge of their city). Their beds are super, super comfortable, maybe even better than Westin's. Bathroom was very clean, although the ceiling paint was peeling a bit, indicating a water leak somewhere. The tower in which I stayed is shaped like an ellipse, so the hallways and rooms have an interesting curve to them. The FREE wi-fi worked very well on all my devices. The spa is quite modern and soothing. Had a great massage doing the last day of my stay. Location is very central - you can walk to everything. Just skip the coffee place around the corner, it was dreadful. A reasonably-priced, modern and pleasant hotel all in all. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: RAL46
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Vancouver Hotel is part of the Wall Centre complex in downtown Vancouver. There are three black-glass towers, consisting of hotel, condos, and offices. All are connected by a two-storey base with lobbies, meeting rooms, pool, bars, restaurants, etc. The complex is on Burrard Street, with easy walking to Granville and Robson streets, with their many trendy shops, bars, cafes, etc. The Sheraton is a terrific hotel. Our room was modern, spacious, clean, and had a good view of the city. The staff was professional and efficient. The pool and fitness area was clean and well-serviced. The lounge was a relaxing place, with a piano player/singer and friendly waiters. We did not eat at the restaurants, as there are so many to choose from just steps away outside of the hotel. Our one concern was the smell of cigarette smoke which seemed to occur during the night, especially when the air kicked in. We phoned down during the night and then commented on this the first morning, and were assured that the situation would be investigated. The second night, more of the same smell. When checking out, we again noted the issue to the front desk attendant, and she assured us it would be looked into. Later, we received an email saying that smokers had been found in a room above us, and they would be fined about $300 in cleaning fees. We also received a generous number of SPG (rewards program) points as compensation for our concern. We were quite pleased with the hotel's attention, although we would have been happier had this happened after the first night!

Reviews.Title: “Soul-less hotel with no charm”
Reviews.Author: dkemt
Reviews.Content: Good location with fairly spacious rooms but totally lacking in charm or soul. Service was efficient but cold and unfriendly. When I asked for a spoon, the response was come and get it from the cafe or there will be a charge to bring a spoon to the room. Parking was outrageously expensive. At least internet was complimentary. Supermarket within 5 min walk and lots of shops and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel stays ever”
Reviews.Author: BugsBunny666
Reviews.Content: The view was very nice, the hotel is perfectly located but that´s about it on the good things I can say about this hotel. I have had the worst service of my entire life. It all started with small things like the remote missing in our room and me having to call three times until one was sent up or the unflexibility of giving us other pillows to big things like our room not being made when we got back to the hotel one day when we dared to stay in the room until noon one day and keep the do not disturb side on until that time. The worst part though was the concierge. Apart from not being good informed about anything we asked I wanted to make a reservation to Vancouver Island the next day. He wanted to get back to me with some information. He didn´t. Instead it took me three calls again to answer the three questions that I had and when he wanted to confirm the reservation with me later on. That call never came so I called again (!!!) only to find out from another concierge that he had gone home for the day. Lovely. I have had enough so I called the front desk and they compensated us with a free movie and at the end of the stay we got a zero balance form that had also taken our two phone calls from the bill. I was kind of excited about so much generosity but when I checked my credit card bill I found out that these calls had been charged anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Whats with the $300 deposit...? May move to another place”
Reviews.Author: Klindatheau1972
Reviews.Content: $300 deposit - but i passed with that as last time it took 3-4 weeks to get my card reimbursed! So this time i did not put the deposit and i am pretty sure i got no internet access and well i was bummed. Lucky i had my USB Wifi stick..

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and Great Views too”
Reviews.Author: terrill03
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Wall Centre is in downtown Vancouver and within easy walking distance to Yaletown, Stanely Park, Gastown, Granville Island etc, as are most of the downtown hotels. Wall centre actually has 2 towers a North and South - I stayed in the North tower, facing north on the 24th floor, all windows are floor to ceiling and run the breadth of the entire room, and I had an absolutely amazing view of the mountains and the water. and the city lights. But as I learned from my colleagues, there are a number of rooms with absolutely no view - so be sure to ask, Rooms in the hotel are a good size comfortable, with nice duvets and coverlets,lots of pillows, ironing board and iron, mini fridge and complimentary water, coffee and tea as well as free wi-fi (thank goodness) Would have liked a bit more closet space though. Hotel also offers a nice spa, pool and gym. I was there for a conference and indeed the North tower has most of halls, but they are all on 3rd floor and given the size of the hotel (it's larger) anyone on vacation shouldn't be too bothered by conferences. Couple of tips...if you are flying out there is both free computer access on 3rd floor and a kiosk by the convenience store in the north tower where you can do online check in and print boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Extra charges really add up”
Reviews.Author: Umbrella_tree
Reviews.Content: We received a heavily discounted rate through hotwire on our room. The hotel itself is nice. The lobby is very impressive and the hotel's elevators have key-card entry only to the guest room floors. The staff were good. Our room was small but clean and as we only slept there, it was more than enough for us. Our main concern with the hotel was all of the extra charges on top of the room rate. Self-parking is listed as $30 per night ($33 for valet), but with all of the surcharges, it is actually $41 ($44 valet). Several guests in the lobby were outraged as they found out after a week-long stay. Local calls are charged to the room (usually these are complementary in higher-end hotels) and room service (that we did not order, so I can't comment on the food) had a $5 surcharge on top of the hospitality taxes/service charges. Again, just one more extra cost. It felt to us as though the hotel is doing the most it can to keep the room rates down and then charging premiums for every possible service. As we did get a deal on the room, it was as though we just paid a normal price in the end, but I would certainly not feel justified paying full price plus premiums.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grace B
Reviews.Content: We were on a train trip to Whister and stayed at Sheraton Wall Centre Hotel for one night. We were very happy with our room and the services offered. Location was good. Room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room”
Reviews.Author: Whizepsom
Reviews.Content: We did the Rocky Mountaineer trip using their Gold Service. This meant 5 star service throughout. Because there was no availability at the Fairmont, (hotels used by Rocky Mountaineer) we wer put up at th Sheraton Wall Centre. Room #1117 has to be the worst hotel room in the hotel business! Do not stay at the Sheraton Wall Centre. Reception staff not friendly. Dont expect to get the correct food order in the restaurant Cafe One.

Reviews.Title: “The beds are great!”
Reviews.Author: Aprilp2412
Reviews.Content: Good location, walking distance to lots of different places. They have two different towers, we were in the one that had the cafe and bar. The rooms have nice long windows and wonderul beds.

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy but needs more substance”
Reviews.Author: Ned07666
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay was in a room with two double beds on a high floor in the South Tower. The room was clean, nicely decorated and bedding was satisfactory, but the room was uncomfortably small and should not have been furnished with more than one queen sized bed. In addition, the available self-parking was located under the North Tower and extremely inconvenient, requiring both a change of elevators and a long walk. It was also expensive. Self parking in the hotel's garage amounted to almost 20% of the regular room price and over 30% of discounted price we paid. Valet parking would have cost even more and the receptionist was unable to suggest an alternative. A significant charge for parking is not uncommon at downtown hotels, but I believe this was excessive. This hotel is well suited to business travelers, especially those attending a convention or seminar at the hotel. It is less appropriate for vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: maggiestravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for the second time in the last year. I was very satisfied with the spaciousness and cleanliness of the room. The bathroom was a decent size. The location couldn't be better; a couple of blocks from Robson Street, a wine boutique attached to the Sutton Hotel that was open till 7pm on a Sunday. Right in front of the wine boutique, there was a Japadog stand! This hotel is walking distance to basically everything in the downtown area. Great restaurants along Burrard, such as Joey's Wine Lounge and Cactus Club Cafe. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: barbara_nair7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 12 nights with my mum on a holiday from Australia. My mother is 81 and has dementia and the long trip and new surroundings lead her to being quite disoriented upon arrival. The hotel is lovely and I would recommend the facilities to any traveller. More importantly, I would like to commend the Assistant Reservations Manager, Cathy Chan, who went above and beyond what I would have expected in the level of service she provided. It is obvious that her philosophy is that a guest is not just another number and that each guest’s special requirements are taken into consideration. Thank you Cathy and the Sheraton Vancouver Wall Centre Hotel for a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: DenandJim
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 9am from our cruise, and unfortunately our room was not ready, as we expected this, it was not a problem. We wandered around for a bit, had some coffee and then joined the tour guys for a walking tour of downtown Vancouver. This was excellent. After some lunch downtown, we made our way back to the hotel and our room on the 26th floor was ready. We were located in the South Tower and we had Club access which was great. Our suite was huge and had good views, with some water glimpses. We were able to look into the neighbouring apartments which for some may be a good thing. I guess the neighbours in the towers opposite are used to it! The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Access to the club lounge one floor below was a bonus. we could enjoy afternoon snacks and a continental breakfast. You do pay for any alcohol, but there was always a sodas if you are happy with that. Again in a great location within walking (for us) distance to downtown. Also close to Davies street, which is a gay area which had some great restaurants. The only thing we noticed was that the lobby area appear quite small for such a large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: AngelaS7
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Wall centre on two occasions for a convention but would happily choose to stay there otherwise too. The staff are always very helpful and the rooms have always been more than adequate. It's a lovely hotel which I very much look forward to staying in again.

Reviews.Title: “North tower, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: MrWiz1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, I was upgraded to a good size room, high floor, corner suite..modern, clean and good location downtown. Bar is a bit quiet, restaurant service was good, a bit $$ for breakfast..gym and pool were nice...overall a modern, clean hotel in downtown nr Robson street...good choice

Reviews.Title: “poor disabled rooms”
Reviews.Author: kellys2
Reviews.Content: staff great roll in shower rooms , the shower poorly designed and down right dangerous unable to open drapes as no handle. too much furniture making it impossible to turn around hotel manager was not knowledgable about disabled shower issues,offered no solutions did not say it would be corrected,although very pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Opulence”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl K
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Vancouver and thankfully I stayed at the Sheraton Vancouver - Wall Centre. Not only was there a beautiful view from our window, floor to ceiling windows of the city, water and mountains. Gorgeous bed that I wish I could take home and nice room layout. All the conveniences in the hotel, live music, spa treatments, hot tub, sauna, warm swimming pool and incredible work-out facility. Room service was scrumptious and the staff was amazing. They treated me like I was an old friend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: lhreye
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the Vancouver Art Gallery and Vogue Theatre. The Burrard Skytrain is a 10 minute walk away. The indoor swimming pool is nice and a good way to relax. We walked down to Sunset Beach which is about 15 minutes away. The rooms are spacious and modern with hi tech fittings and gadgets.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ESME31
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one week at this hotel and I loved it. I had seen the positive reviews especially about the rooms in the North Tower We had a comfortable and spacious room at the 25th floor in the North Tower with an excellent view of the city and mountains. The large windows up until the ceiling were very impressive. The hotel was in walking distance (5 mins) from the city centre. What I particularly liked was that someone in charge checked whether housekeeping had done a good job in cleaning the room. The only thing I didn't like was that there was never any tea in the room. You had to call housekeeping to request it. That's a shame! People assume too much that everyone drinks coffee. However, I would recommend this hotel but look for good deals because it isn't cheap..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - pretty centrally located and great views!”
Reviews.Author: windsova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November (sorry for the late review) for work. I stayed at the hotel for 1 week so I really got to know the place. I had a larger room than my other co-workers it was a jr. suite I think - corner room, 23rd floor (The Starwood Preferred Guest Floor) in the north tower. I had turn down service which is always a bonus, but I know that wasn't standard for all the Floors. Definitely recommend the North Tower vs. the South Tower as the lower lobby had a starbucks and free wi-fi AND a bar. The two towers are connected via an inside walkway which takes 5x as long to walk vs. just going outside and walking to the next building. I was a bit jet lagged and slept during the day a few times, and found the noise from the street a little much at times. I'm from Montreal and I'm very used to city traffic, but even on the 23rd floor found it to be distracting. Maybe ask for a room that isn't facing the major road..... but then you loose your mountain view. Would go back - thought that overall it was a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Most disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A_regular_traveler57
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Sheraton Wall Centre after a 10 year absence. While the hotel has been maintained, nothing has changed - still the same mural on the ceiling as you enter, still the same navy blue decor. We arrived late. Our room had been given away. We were offered a small version of a room on the 36th floor which opened into a party room. This was not acceptable and we offered to move to another hotel. In the name of "going green", room cleaning service is an option (?). No turn-down service - unless you request it (?). Staff were less than friendly. The hotel was very busy though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, even better bed!”
Reviews.Author: chuckd21x
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed a place to stay in downtown Vancouver for a night before our cruise and this was admittedly not my first choice. Well, I can honestly say it's one of the best plan "B's" I've ever had. The hotel was first class, very clean and well maintained. The bed was truly spectacular, I haven't slept that well in a hotel in atleast 4 years. The valet parking is a bit steep ($43/nt) but the hassle of finding your own is probably not worth the $10 you'll save. Our view was mostly of the city and we could see the mountains in the far distance so that was a plus as well. I just wish we could have spent another day or two there based on our limited experience.

Reviews.Title: “Love Staying at the Sheraton Wall”
Reviews.Author: kelcampbell
Reviews.Content: I am regularly in Vancouver on business and whenever I am - I stay at the Vancouver Wall Centre - North Tower. I have stayed there a half-dozen times this year alone, and I've never been disappointed. In fact, I believe this hotel keeps track of guests who have stayed previously and make an effort to book the guest into the same room each and every time. The net result is that when I'm far from home, I am able to go to "my" room at the Wall and it almost feels like coming home. In terms of the restaurant in the North Tower - it is also very good - I especially love the corned beef hash and eggs for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay for a conference”
Reviews.Author: letsgo1984
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference at the convention center in August 2011. Very nice place with a great location close to the convention center. Rooms were very nice and fairly modern. Had flat screen TVs and very comfortable beds. The swimming pool and fitness center were also nice after a long day of meetings. Don't really have anything to complain about... it was expensive, but hey, its Vancouver! Perhaps the most gorgous city I have ever been too (keep in mind I was there in the summer when it was a perfect 70 degrees F while it was over 105 degrees every day back home in Tulsa). The city is very nice and clean with a beautiful view of the mountains across the bay. Hope to get back soon! Tip: A cab from the airport with tip was almost $50. After I was there a few days I discovered there was a rail system with a stop just a blocks from the hotel... so it cost me $3 to get back to the airport and it was faster!!! Lesson learned

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very well located for me - I didn't use my car from the time I arrived to the time I left and was able to easily walk to everything I wanted. The room was very clean and friendly, as was virtually all of the staff. The only issue I had was one of connecting to the internet - I wasn't able to. I called the front desk who forwarded me to a central help desk. Their attitude felt much like 'well, it's working for us, so it must be your problem' and offered no tips to try to help outside of restarting my computer. I fiddled with it for a bit then left for a coffee shop to work. Later I came back and it was working for me so I was able to work from there at least for a time. I really isn't the fact that I wasn't able to work, but the nonchalant attitude of the help desk that bugged me. That said, everything else about the hotel, including all of the other staff I interacted with, was superb.

Reviews.Title: “A great location in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: LongWayAcross
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton has always been a good place to have a solid rest in their comfortable Sweet Sleeper beds. Rooms are a little on the small side, but almost just right. In room Starbucks coffee is a nice touch, now that the Starbucks in the lower lobby is gone. The walls are a little thin, as you can hear people in the adjacent room talking loudly. A nice security feature is having to use the key card for the elevator access. Another plus is the room service pizza - it was actually really good! One small point would be that if you are a Starwood Preferred Member, get your late check out time sorted out when you check in. We tried to check out late, subject to availability, but were denied because the room was already sold out for the same day. Had we known that, perhaps we could've asked for a different room.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: StouffvilleGuy
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent. Friendly and courteous staff. Room was perfect with an incredible view of the montains and the ocean. Sunsets were spectacular. Easy walk to shopping with excellent dining nearby. Particularly liked the variety on Davie street. Room cards were a little quirky. Very recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Really wish I could give a higher rating...”
Reviews.Author: ksduffster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for our summer vacation because it was very centrally located and we enjoy walking on our vacations instead of driving everywhere.
