We were very excited to see that there was free wi-fi (you can pay for a higher speed, but the lower speed is just fine for surfing the web while your partner is in the shower), for which I would love to give them 5 points here if only because that amenity should be rewarded as often as possible. However... I can't justify a 5 when housekeeping DOES NOT KNOCK! Our first full day in town, after biking the seawall and doing Granville Island, we were relaxing in the room a bit before heading out to dinner. I heard a key slide into a door and my first thought was "wow, these walls are thinner than I thought". Then I heard the handle turn and I thought "hmm, someone must be confused about their room number". Then the door opens and my husband says 'hello?" A voice comes back "oh! housekeeping! just checking to make sure everything is ok!" We responded that everything was fine and she left. On our way out to dinner, I mentioned this event to the woman at the reception desk who said she would say something to the head of housekeeping. A couple days later, we were in the room again in the early afternoon and the same thing happened with the exception that, as the door was being opened (not before), there was a timid little knocking at it. Our final day there, it happened again! If I'm awake in my room, I usually don't feel any need to bar the door, but I certainly did in this hotel. Otherwise, housekeeping did a good job of keeping the room tidy and we enjoyed our stay in Vancouver when we were out of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitcellsous
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our anniversary celebration, it was simple an amazing room, spacious, huge window, huge bed, great bathroom, great location as well, not bad for only $210 CAD a night.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: R P
Reviews.Content: Staff was nice, check in was quick and easy. However, we did book a club room and they failed to inform us what privileges a club level room was entitled to. So we missed out on all the privileges. Room was a little small as well, but clean & nicely furnished.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: dadada_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located--Robson St, the waterfront, gastown and Chinatown are within easy walking distance. Stanley Park and Yaletown are a long walk but we had nice weather so it was certainly doable. The property was a typical Sheraton, we had a nice balcony to watch sunsets and could see the water and mountains in the distance. I have one complaint....when I got into bed the sheets had a BO odor in one spot which made me suspicious as to how often they are really changed. We had them changed right away so we were ok for the rest of the stay but it creeps me out to sleep in hotel beds now (more than usual)...

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: szamp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had the pleasure of spending 4 days at the Sheraton Wall Center in Downtown Vancouver, B.C. This was our first visit to Vancouver so we decided to priceline a hotel. We were pleasantly surprised when we got to the Sheraton & we were treated like royalty. We were given a great room on the 25th floor in the North Tower. The hotel was immaculate and modern & staff very helpful & pleasant. We used the free internet to plan our day & found it quick. I really cannot see what anybody would have to complain about. I even liked the hangers but the floor to ceiling windows were the real treat. Helpful things to know, Robson St. with it’s shopping & range of great restaurants is only 2 blocks away, an IGA 1 block away, a wine store across the street from the IGA, Japa Dog on the same corner as the wine store. There is a Tim Horton on the street behind the hotel, several good coffee shops within a 2 block area, self park ½ block away. We parked at an off airport parking & took the sky train in. The City Center station is just a short walk from the hotel. There is a bus stop at the hotel but we are hikers so from the hotel we walked to Stanley Park, Gas Town, China Town, Granville Island & the waterfront. Everybody we met in Vancouver was charming & hospitable. We travel to Seattle several times a year. This will not be our last visit to Vancouver & we will not priceline again. It will always be the Sheraton Wall Center for us.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!”
Reviews.Author: Laura F
Reviews.Content: The view was amazing! The hotel staff was great! Very friendly and helpful! Very clean rooms and the bed was so comfortable! If you are ever in Vancouver I definitely recommend that you stay here! By far the best hotel that I have ever stayed in! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not the quality we expect from Westin/Sheratons”
Reviews.Author: darrenvm
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in the North Tower in Aug 2011. I have come to expect a certain standard from these group of hotels and found this hotel fell short. It is still a nice hotel but considering it was a brand new building it seemed very cheap in the room. Strange cutouts of the bathroom roof and a long dark path down a hallway to the pool kind of dampened our experience. The beds and showers were super nice as always and the staff were very good and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and grounds, great location”
Reviews.Author: Brezzzz
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. The grounds were beautifully landscaped with fountains and were a great place to have my morning coffee before working out. The room was upscale and comfortable and the bed was great. I appreciated having the independent bagel breakfast/coffee restaurant in the complex. The location is close to downtown, Robson Street shops and restaurants and the gay village on Davie.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: MCA_MN
Reviews.Content: Went here for my honeymoon and I would not recommend it. The staff was consistently rude, parking was very expensive, they charged for local calls, and breakfast was not the greatest. The beds are comfy, though.

Reviews.Title: “$40 Parking”
Reviews.Author: doraCanada
Reviews.Content: We were all exited to be staying here until we had to park the vehicle. Any savings we made on a room discount was gobbled up by over the top cost of parking. My daughter who lives in Vancouver said next time to investigate parkade prices before you go as they would be way cheaper. The linens on the bed were so starched that whenever some one rolled over in the night or moved it woke me up and I can sleep through anything ie thunder, lightning, ambulance sirens... Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, prob won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: JavaHeaven
Reviews.Content: Before purchasing my room here, I researched reviews. Sheraton ranked pretty bad, so I was headstrong on NOT staying here. I purchased the hotwire rate where you don't know until after you pay. At first I was pissed, but said to myself "everyone has different experiences"!! The General Manager was nice to enough to change my Hotwire dates to accommodate my new dates to travel. I GREATLY APPRECIATED this!!!!! Me and my daughter arrived 8/16, we were greated by Nancy. She had no personality or customer service skills to make you feel welcomed. Every detail with, nancy was cut-throat dry, no smiling.. NOTHING!!!! To top off being roasted by, Nancy, she assigned us to a room on the 7th floor, over looking a roof. What the hell is her problem, I thought?? I was tempted to walk back downstairs to request a new room, but figured she will muff our room up with no view... A little later I spotted another gal, so I figured it was now or never. She was very nice, and assigned us to 1955. The room was a nice size for a standard and the bed was awesome. Usually when you stay @ an hotel in a standard room, they make sure that room is nothing but standard. The bathroom was a decent size... My only complaints at the hotel is parking. If you're spending $158 per night and up, why the hell do you have to pay $41 for self park and $45 valet? I can only imagine how much dough people pay for the penthouse suites, and then to be nickled and dimed. I almost stayed at Sutton Place, because that hotel offered free parking voucher/food credit... The gym was nice, except it was NOT a gym. More like a weight room. No treadmill or cardio equipment. The weight rooms were very small. I'd probably stay here again if Nancy has an attitude adjustment and I didn't have to pay for parking.. These 2 details caused the Sheraton to score a 3 star rating, instead of 4. The cafe was great. My mocha was one of the best and my bagels also. The bar was a great for a drink after walking around Vancouver all day.. I believe the problem is, Vancouver is not the same as it use to be, parking is an arm and leg, so where does that leave you to park?? At your hotel... I'd say to self-park, the walk is not long.. You walk to the elevator and you're in the lobby...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, fun city”
Reviews.Author: sculpture97
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week at the end of July for a conference. The best things about the hotel were the helpful staff, good housekeeping, excellent exercise facilities, and the view of the water (if you can get one). Beds were very comfortable. Rooms were compact, and somewhat expensive. My biggest complaint is that they only offer cardboard cups for coffee in the room, and one would have to request shower gel instead of it merely being offered. Towels were below average. So they skimped. Also, room service was incredibly expensive once tax, delivery, and service were included! The coffee shop on the lower north level has sandwiches and drinks at reasonable prices. There was no information given about nearby restaurants, although the staff will tell if asked. There is quite a vibrant urban scene nearby, ethnic restaurants on Davie Street, and steak houses downtown, about two blocks in either direction. The waterfront is also quite close.

Reviews.Title: “A chain hotel that feels almost boutique”
Reviews.Author: AlizaFromOttawa
Reviews.Content: After the previous year's experience with a Sheraton (Toronto), I was a bit worried when I saw another conference had chosen another Sheraton. However, what a difference!! First: although there were only two people on staff at reception when I arrived, I got served promptly and they were friendly and welcoming. I got immediately upgraded, and they also advised that I stay in the smaller tower (quieter) rather than the main building-- not a problem since there was sheltered walkway at breakout-room level. The room was very pleasant with a fridge, free internet and even a view. The property is pretty, with a public park and fountains, the conference/breakout rooms are functional, and the exercise facilities are much better than average for a hotel and are free to all guests. And the location is very good-- an easy walk to various sights and the shopping. The smaller tower has limited lobby seating, but the art work is beautiful; the other tower has a generous lobby. The only issue with the room was that although the door was covered with peep holes, none were at women's height -- meaning you either had to bend to waist level or open the door without checking who was there. When I pointed that out to a staff member (the safe wasn't working properly at first, and the front desk sent someone up VERY promptly), he was rather surprised (being taller, he'd never realized the problem). The room safe was also very high up-- and I'm average height for a woman! Bottom line: Next time work sends me to Vancouver, I hope I get to stay there again; it's my new favourite for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Poor service”
Reviews.Author: lcfletcher
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here for three nights because this hotel has several "family suites." Since we have older teens, we liked the idea of having 3 beds. The set up is perfect for my family--one bed in a separate bedroom then 2 large beds in the main room. The bedroom was not overly large, but it was adequate. The room with 2 beds was quite large. The floor plan included a long hallway from the entrance door to get to the two rooms. If I was grading on the room alone the property would get an A. Unfortunately, the front desk service was Extremely poor. There are two towers. We arrived at the first tower (north) and were told that we needed to go to the south tower by the very unhelpful front desk personnel . Nobody offered to take our luggage, and since I saw no bellman around we just headed out ourselves. It was quite a hike to get to the other tower, so I was stunned we had no offer of help with our luggage. (At the time it was just me and my 2 kids and our 5 pieces of luggage; my husband wasn't able to join us until the next day.) When I made the reservation I asked which tower we would be in and they said that they did not know. However, I later found out that family suites are only in the south tower, so they certainly could have saved me a lot of trouble by telling me which tower to go to! I also asked for a room high up; I was told that wouldn't be a problem. We were in one of the highest buildings in Vancouver, but they stuck us on the 6th floor. (I had booked 4 months in advance.) The room key must be used to get the elevator to stop at your floor. You can't go higher than your room key floor if you enter your room key into the elevator. It was so inconvenient to have to use your key every time you stepped in the elevator. Also, If somebody else stepped in when you did and entered their key first the elevator would pass the 6th floor before we could activate the 6th floor button. It was a huge pain being on a low floor! The view was obviously poor too. We paid for the room in advance because we were offered a special directly from Sheraton. I was happy to pay in advance to receive the special price until I noticed that my credit card was billed twice. I called Sheraton and was told that I would have to call the hotel directly. I didn't want to spend a lot of time on an international call, so I was pretty unhappy. However, I was able to email the hotel, and the manager emailed me back promptly. A couple more emails with the accounting manager resolved the problem, so I thought they did a good/quick job of taking care of that issue. However, anyone paying in advance should check his credit card bill to make sure the same mistake does not occur again. Overall, I liked the room. I just wished the people who answered the phone and the people at the front desk were more helpful and knew what they were talking about.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service and experience”
Reviews.Author: ap0k
Reviews.Content: didn't have a good experience here. asked for an upgrade due to SPG status, and they mentioned that the hotel was full( which is fine, if that is true ). after checking into the room, we found used soap, towels and newspapers over the room. the front desk offered to change our room even though its supposedly "full". additionally, housekeeping only came twice during a five night stay( once after 7pm ). the mini bar fridges don't really work and after asking on how to use, they just said, put something inside and it will turn on. that clearly didn't work either. it would have been nice to get some shower gel at all, which they did not refill or have the entire stay. location-wise, its OK - near robson and shopping, but there are a ton of bums right outside the hotel. rooms are olderish in the non-new tower. very small and very worn. noise is fairly high at this hotel; we were probably 5 doors down from the elevator, but it was very easy to wake up in the middle of the night by elevator dings or people walking in the hallways. overall a very weak hotel and you're better off staying at the Westin or Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed at this Hotel several times and have always enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: Moosi_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed August 11, 2011 for one night. The Hotel is an easy walk to the down town core. The king size room was a good size as was the bathroom. We were on the 15th floor and except for the occasional overly loud vehicle on the street below it was very quiet. We had a problem with our room safe and a phone call to the front desk brought immediate attention which was greatly appreciated. They have a nice recreation area with a large pool and two hot tubs. The bed was extremely comfortable. Other than use the lobby bar we did not eat at the Hotel so cannot comment on it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, comfortable rooms - will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Marcello74
Reviews.Content: First of all, let's just say what we know to be true. Vancouver is a very pricey destination. Hotels all charge a premium on rooms, meals, and parking. It's also a loud and busy city, so finding a respite away from that bustle and noise can be hard. The Sheraton offers exactly that escape. The Sheraton Wall Centre is a two-tower, massive property in the heart of downtown. Upon arrival, we had a quick and easy check-in. Valet parkers and bellmen gave us lots of offers of help. The front desk clerk gave us a great greeting, and a very warm welcome. Our Club Floor King room was on the 26th floor. The entire outside wall was windows, affording a spectacular view of the city and English Bay. The room layout was a bit tight, with a small sitting area featuring a love seat and desk/chair, mini-bar area and counter area, and the king bed in its own area behind a partial wall. Not a bad layout, but a bit tight for fitting in luggage and two people. Comfortable furniture, though, and having a fridge in the room was handy. The bed was comfortable, but so big that there wasn't room for a second nightstand. I will confess that the view made up for this, though. The bathroom was a luxurious marble enclave featuring double sinks and more floor space than most of the rest of our room! Our free breakfast in the Club Lounge was a bit disappointing (we've had better at other Sheraton properties) but adequate, and healthy. The evening hors d'oeuvres also included in our stay was much better, with both hot and cold snacks, water and soft drinks galore. The view from the south-facing lounge on the 25th floor was breathtaking. The business centre was helpful to have and easy to access, as it was also on this floor. Spiral stairs between the 26th and 25th floor in the Club Lounge/Business Centre were very convenient to have. Hotel staff were friendly and accommodating. Elevator service was slow but functional -- in a hotel this size, it can be much worse. The layout of the property was a bit confusing for accessing other parts of the hotel (ie the North Tower), and signage or clarification from staff would have been welcome. My only real complaint, however, would be that our valet parking was an exorbitant price, tallying over $44 per night on our final bill. The tags said $33, so who knows why it jumps another $11 on the final bill. Guess we should have self-parked, for $25 a night. For a downtown property, in bustling, expensive Vancouver, this hotel is a great option - and I'm surprised it doesn't rank higher as a result!

Reviews.Title: “Great view. Clean but smallish rooms. Well-run hotel.”
Reviews.Author: D G
Reviews.Content: We had a great view of the city from our room. The beds were quite comfortable. Room service was great, if not so overpriced. Room was quite accessible even though it wasn't designated as such. Only complaint is the metal soap tray in the bathtub area was positioned such that you'd have to be careful not to bump into it and possibly injure yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: liferaft
Reviews.Content: Arriving by bicycle you always expect problems. No we don't want you bike in the room, your cleats are hurting the floor and so on. When I arrived at the Sheraton Wall Center I was informed that my room was more than large enough to hold my bike and that was the preferred place to keep it. This was a great start. The room was huge with a wonderful view, clean and quiet. After a quick shower we decided a drink was in order at which time we found the property really was several towers and the bar and restaurant were in another one. A quick walk across the courtyard brought us to our beverage. It is nice breathing fresh air once in a while. Location, location, location is what this hotel has. Half way between Granville Island and downtown it is an easy walk everywhere. Also being a couple of blocks south of the city center there is a larger choice of restaurants that are not just for the tourists. We look forward to returning, our stay was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, one of our favourites”
Reviews.Author: Jaybirdq
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. The views from the rooms is fantastic. The rooms are very clean and the beds are so comfy. It is right across the street from St. Paul's hospital, so a perfect location if you have to visit someone there. It's a five minute walk to the sea wall for a walk along English Bay. Lots of restaurants are close by on Davie Street and it's about 500 metres to the shops on Robson Street. The only complaint would be that the air conditioning unit was very noisy. Only one small window opens about 4 inches.

Reviews.Title: “At the heart of things”
Reviews.Author: Gerald88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is greatly located in the center of downtown vancouver, rooms were spacious and well decorated, toilet was great too, no complaints. The front staff were helpful and so were the doorman. Couldnt expect more for a holiday vacation to Canada!!!

Reviews.Title: “Priceline purchase for one.”
Reviews.Author: BackporchBob
Reviews.Content: Nice flashy new tower hotel in a decent central location. Executive style room with two double beds. Paid base fee of $139 on Priceline...plus fees and all the over the top tax add-ons Parking with the Valet guy was $44 plus tax...ouch. Oh well, it was just for one night, nice view from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great staff and perfect location for visiting Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: gabster_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when we were roadtripping across western Canada. We are a family of five and it was by far our favorite hotel throughout the trip. We were given a large room with an amazing view of beautiful Vancouver. My husband and I stayed in the private room, and the kids in the larger room. Since we have three kids we asked if we could get a cot, which we got quickly and at no extra cost. The kids didn't really need it since there was a king size bed for them. Like I said we loved it and it was definetly worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: CamUKtraveller
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a really good price for 5 nights at this hotel which is right in the centre of Vancouver easy walking distance to everything in the city as well as Kitsilano beach, gastown and Yaletown. Good size room with a fridge and lovely shower. We were worried it would be noisy being on a main road and opposite the hospital but it wasn't at all. slept soundly every night. Would recommend to anyone wanting to stay in the centre of Vancouver and not have to pay for transport to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a second”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller791
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of July and would stay again if I go back to Vancouver. The location is perfect. I walked everywhere I needed to go. Very close to all types of restaurants. Also only a short walk to catch a water taxi to Granville Island, or near Kits Beach. I had a small room on the 14th floor in the south tower. Although it wasn't very high I still had nice views of part of the city. I was also on the east side of the tower so there was little to no street noise. The room was fairly simple but met my needs, as I only used it to sleep. The only downside was waiting for the elevator can sometimes take a while. 1 morning, it was a 10minute wait to go down. Most mornings I only had to wait a couple of minutes. Check in and check out were very easy and the staff was excellent. All the staff that I talked to were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place downtown”
Reviews.Author: Stefano1968
Reviews.Content: We got a great price on Priceline and we had a room at 14th floor on the south tower. Room and bathroom are nice and clean even if they have an odd shape. The hotel is at a waking distance to almost everything. The staff is kind and efficient. The buffet breakfast is great but is pricey too. There are a lot of places around. Free wifi. If I get a good deal I'll come again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh... Is that a hospital emergency enterance?”
Reviews.Author: LeftRock
Reviews.Content: It really is a decent Hotel, a little confusing as they also have another tower for residential but it was clean, a little bit dated for a 4 star.... but, and this is a big BUT... If your over looking Burrard your DIRECTLY accross from a hospital ambulance enterance for emergency. Maybe it was because it was a weekend when I stayed, but wow. They have alot of ambulances in Vancouver, lets just say that.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: wes74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 nights in July 2011. As a Starwood Platinum member I was treated like a star by the front desk staff. I had booked a room at the north tower, but was given a room at the south tower instead. Initially I was a bit dissapointed based on the reviews I had read here, but the room they placed me in was on a high floor and had a balcony. My room had floor to ceiling windows that extended across roughly half of my room. I thought the room was great and this had to be one of the best views in the city. I couldn't have been happier. Housekeeping did an outstanding job throughout the week and the south tower club room was top notch. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. I loved the mini fridge in my room and the internet was fast throughout my stay. Self parking was a bit confusing the first night, but I understood the parking garage layout by day 2. Here is some general information regarding the 2 buildings (north tower and south tower). I learned the south tower was built in 1994 and the north tower was built in 2001. The lobby of the north tower is amazing and the fitness center, spa, and restaurant are located in the north tower. All Sheraton guests have access to these features regardless of what tower they are staying at. I can only speak for the south tower, but I thought the rooms were great. Every room has a unique floor plan based on the building design. A select number of rooms have balconies on the south tower and there are no balcony rooms on the north tower. The north tower is half hotel and half residential (the lower floors are hotel rooms while the upper floors are residences). The south tower has a club room for elite members and I am assuming the north tower also has one. Self parking is $30 per night, but that seems fairly common for downtown Vancouver hotels. A tip to management - ditch the key card requirement for the elevators. I don't know how many times I rode that elevator up and down because my key would not work. Many other people seemed to have the same problem and once there was a whole group of us riding up and down unable to get access to our floors.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NN1276
Reviews.Content: We visited Vancouver on our honeymoon in July 2011. The Sheraton was a great pick! The hotel is clean and conveniently located to downtown. The staff are friendly and helpful in answering questions about restaurants, hotel services, etc. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great views”
Reviews.Author: ezelion
Reviews.Content: Interesting hotel- right downtown, really great views, and every single room is a different design (because of the location and layout), yet all are really great. Make sure you get a room up high. All the views are fantastic, as long as you're high enough. We were here for a conference and it was great that one could walk across a bridge to the convention centre. The gym's a bit sucky- you have to walk quite a bit to get to it, and it's got lots of bikes and very little else. Don't stay here if the gym's important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: rainman73
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Wall Center after an awful day of traveling (Thanks to Air Canada for a cancelation, and delay of connection for 10 hours. We loved our room, but had to leave early the next day. I asked for the same room on our return from our trip to the Rockies, and they were very accomodating. We were in the North Tower, wonderful views, no problems whatsoever. Very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Another amazing stay at a truly amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: modefan
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver at the Sheraton Wall Centre recently and stayed in their South Tower (for the first time - my many other visits I've been in the North Tower). The room was fantastic, I'm not sure why others have posted negatively about this tower. The view was amazing, the bed was incredibly comfortable and the overall experience exceeded my expectations. The staff make you feel welcome and their location can't be beat. This is why I keep coming back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: DCauthers
Reviews.Content: I attended a business conference at the hotel. The rooms were modern and pleasing with great views. The elevators require that you insert your room key first before ascending (nobody told us, so we went up and down when the buttons weren't responsive until another hotel guest showed us). Restaurants and shopping are a couple blocks away. The front desk and room attendants were excellent. The catering staff for the morning breakfast at the conference were a bit rude and rushed us to leave when we still had 20 minutes before the start of the morning session.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: joann_ting
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in July and overall, my stay was pleasant. My friends, and I booked a family suite, 1 King, 2 Dbl bed suite with no kitchenette or living area. We arrived at our suite to learn that we were given a 2 bedroom suite (1 king, 1dbl), 2 full bath, 1 kitchenette and living space. We knew this coming in that both rooms were at the same rate but felt that we could make better use of the family suite with the more beds. We called down to confirm our room and although they stated they provided the correct room, our confirmation sheet online told us differently. They offered to bring us a cot right away to accommodate all of us which came promptly 15 minutes later and he placed it in one of the bedrooms. It worked out even better since we had a larger livable suite. The cot was basically a twin size bed on a roller which was GREAT and COMFORTABLE. The suite was clean and spacious. We had a great view of the North Shore. The beds are always fantastic at Starwood Hotels. I have friends who may find them too squishy/soft but I think they are just perfect. The furniture in the suite wasn't super comfy (leather vinyl material) but it did the job. Housekeeping was often in the hallway when we left the room and greeted us kindly. The lobby has a really bizarre 'fresh' smell that I didn't care for. It was overwhelming each time we came into the lobby so beware to those who have a sensitive sense of smell. Check in was quick, check out was quick. Probably depends on the line up and how many they have on staff but when we were there, it was quite efficient. We dined at the restaurant for breakfast. The server was personable and encouraged us to have the buffet since we had a 50% off voucher. I regret selecting this since I didn't enjoy it too much but since I didn't have to pay the $30 full price, I didn't feel so bad. Warning: Coffee / Tea / Juice is a steep $5.00. What killed us the most in expenses was the parking. It was about $45/night... If you had a car, I would recommend parking in the lot since Vancouver parking else where can be sketchy (car theft) and quite expensive. You might as well spring for hotel parking due to convenience and suck up the cost. Another prewarning, it costs to make LOCAL calls at this hotel. I am not sure about other hotels, but I have never had to pay a dollar or more to make a phone call locally. If you make a lot of calls and don't want to go over on your calls, there are courtesy phones throughout the hotel. I would suggest you use these or your own cell phone if you have a good plan. The biggest perk of this hotel is really its location. Walking distance to Robson/Burrard for all your shopping needs, walking distance to Yaletown, and anywhere else you need to go in downtown is cab-able or a short distant drive. All in all, this hotel really tries to pinch every penny out of you for anything to want to do but I am sure its the same story for most Vancouver/big city hotels. I had a pleasurable stay and would come again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, I'm moving in”
Reviews.Author: barlone
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful Sheraton. We stayed one night after our cruise. Nice walk from the pier, but kinda hard with all our luggage, but we did it. Great location, comfy beds, club level was great, snacks in the evening and breakfast in the morning. We had a beautiful view we had from our room. Great indoor pool and hot tub. I love this hotel and I think I'm moving in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Eh_and_Em
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a couple of nights with our toddler in tow and found the location to be very convenient-- a short walking distance to a variety of restaurants on Davie as well as shopping on Robson. We were able to secure a lower nightly rate through a discount website which was great but it turns out they made their money back on the parking charges-- $44/night (plus the tips)!!! Fortunately, we still came out ahead given the normally advertised rack rates. That said, if we didn't have a small child with us, we probably would have parked elsewhere. Additionally, while the beds were comfortable, we didn't get exactly what we requested online and ended up with two full-size instead of two queen-sized beds. Further, the remote control for the room's t.v. was missing, the mini-bar was empty, and the in-room dining menu was nowhere to be found. As our room was proximate to the elevator, some of the guests were rather loud in the hallway very late at night (past midnight) and early in the morning (around 6am on a Saturday). We took all of this in stride, however, as we were just happy that our room was clean and our toddler enjoyed looking at the view below from our 17th floor windows. Overall, this hotel was ok and one we would still consider in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Service, Rooms to die for!!”
Reviews.Author: tmmgil
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many downtown Vancouver Properties and this hotel is BY FAR the best I've stayed at. Service is fantastic, the beds are so comfortable, the staff are so helpful and the bellman are amazing. Thanks Sheraton for making my stays in Downtown Vancouver so enjoyable. Oh, ya, the views from all the rooms are awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel great views”
Reviews.Author: chessybear
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Hotwire for a great price. Location was outstanding. We requested a North Tower room high floor and got an amazing room and view of the city. . Room was spacious, beds were very comfy and we had complimentary wifi. Check in was quick. The Hoho trolley stops right outside we bought a two day pass and went all over the city. Lots of great shopping and eating places nearby you really are in a very central part of this beautiful city. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place!”
Reviews.Author: PSI31
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the city center, nice room very well furnished, large, excellent bedding. Warm welcome and helpful. Recommend

Reviews.Title: “Very large, upscale hotel but not for us”
Reviews.Author: JNS514
Reviews.Content: Vancouver was our final stop for our honeymoon. After staying in a cozy hotel in Victoria the Sheraton Vancouver seemed huge. They have multiple towers of rooms over 25 floors high. Everything is very clean, nicely decorated and big. The staff is nice but since the hotel is so big they are very busy and sometimes hard to get a hold of. Checking in was relatively easy since we came on a Thursday but checking out on Saturday took too long. The nicest people were the valets and porters. They were always happy to give directions or suggestions of places to go. The room itself wasn't too big, but it fit a king size bed, desk, chair, TV stand and refrigerator. The bathroom was pretty large and had nice water pressure. The mattress was incredibly comfortable and made it hard to get out of bed in the morning. The valet parking was convenient but very expensive. We didn't have much of an option since parking the car yourself in the garage wasn't much cheaper. Since we were only there two nights it was fine, but for more than a few days it would really add up. The hotel was close to several coffee shops and we were able to wander around downtown Vancouver from our hotel. The business center is located between the two towers and is a bit of a hike to get to. The room itself was very comfortable and had small windows that opened so we got some fresh air. We got a deal on the price because we booked over a month ahead of time. There are restaurants, a coffee shop, a spa, pool and fitness center on the premises but we didn't visit any of them. It's a very nice hotel but felt very large and impersonal at times. Probably better for business travelers than people on their honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Beds to die for.”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiTraveler86
Reviews.Content: The night prior to an Alaskan cruise, we splurged and decided to stay in a 5 star hotel. We got a decent rate at the Sheraton. We arrived about 11 am, but our room wasn't ready and we weren't willing to forgo a King for two doubles, so we left and returned about 5 pm. We got our choice at this point and were thrilled with a lovely view of the city. The room was appointed well with everything we needed, except there was only one bathrobe, when it would seem obvious there should be two most of the time. The beds were the most comfortable things we had been on in years and we slept like babies. Checkout was simple, then my wife remembered she wanted to send some emails. No problem, they let us back into the system without charge. Excellent service by the bellhops and everything was clean and sparkling. Wish we could go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: JaneStoller
Reviews.Content: Great hotel location and rooms are nice however there always seems to be an issue checking in and out and it takes a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway for 2”
Reviews.Author: travelling_fiend21
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me for our 1st anniversary and booked a night at the Sheraton Wall Center. We had a very cute room in the newest building with THE MOST comfortable king bed, I couldn't even tell he was next to me (which is a bonus!). The floor to ceiling windows gave us full views of the city and even though we're from Vancouver, we felt like we were in our own world for a night, which is exactly what we needed. Besides leaving for dinner, we decided to just stay in and hide from the world :)

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, unstylish hotel that claims to be renovated...with horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Camnicsydney
Reviews.Content: I cannot relay to fellow TA's how disappointed I was with this hotel. Firstly I was disillusioned with the price of hotels in Vancouver and with an average choice of hotels around the $250/nt price range I had to succumb to the Sheraton Wall. I should have trusted my hunch....it was terrible and it & the duty manager ruined the beginning of our stay in Vancouver. I had read extensively on TA that there were two towers - one renovated, one not. I had requested the renovated building when I made my reservation approx 1 month in advance. The day before our arrival I phoned again direct to the hotel & spoke to a really friendly girl to emphasize my request and blindly believed that my request might actually be heard. When we arrived at the hotel late on a Friday night I could tell by looking at the lobby or lack there-of that it wasn't going to be good. The vibe just wasn't right. As soon as we got out of the cab the 2 doormen couldn't even bring themselves to acknowledge our existence and the front office staff were dreary, unfriendly and unhelpful. When we asked where was the closest place that we could get a bite to eat the front office girl could barely point us in the right direction....hello, you're in a customer facing role - don't you have to/want to be helpful? When we arrived at the room it was just plain old fashioned, unappealing and clearly unrenovated apart from maybe a lick of new paint. When we ventured out for a bite to eat we stopped by the newer, sleeker Sheraton Wall tower and immediately you could tell that these 2 towers were worlds apart and we had been allocated the old, shoddy one. I was so disappointed that I phoned the front desk and spoke to the duty manager who was an Australian. She was exceptionally rude and would not even listen to me ... which made me really upset not to mention terribly disgruntled considering I was paying $250/nt for a terrible room and horrible service. I then phoned direct to SPG and spoke to a lovely girl in Dublin who was extremely apologetic and she cancelled our 2nd night's accommodation free and also offered to give us 5000 SPG points to apologise for the bad service we had received from the duty manager. To this day....almost 3 months later the points were never deposited which leaves a really bad taste in my mouth and has soured my desire to ever want to stay in a Sheraton again. We immediately went online and booked a room at the Fairmont Waterfront and it was a world above Sheraton Wall right from the beginning.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior40_11
Reviews.Content: This is a clean and convenient business hotel. Booked online and saved a bundle as I dont think they could justify their full rack rate but at a discounted price its great.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: R-NGlenn
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Wall Centre is a great place to stay in downtown Vancouver. It's centrally located, so you can walk to Yaletown, Gastown, Stanley Park, etc. I booked a room in the North Tower, and the rooms are beautiful and have floor to ceiling windows. We requested and got a room with an ocean view which was awesome. The concierge staff was very helpful, and helped us plan our time here. We will definitely stay at this hotel when we come back to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: veredka
Reviews.Content: Big rooms. Very clean. Center of downtown close to everything! Find street parking and save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was acceptable but nothing really special”
Reviews.Author: Zell
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Sheraton Wall Center for 5 days. Check-in was efficient and courteous. Room assigned was as requested in the North Tower and on the 26th floor. Key card access required for all floors. Key card had to be recoded twice during the 5 day stay. Clerk said cards are very sensitive and if kept near a magnet, they become demagnetized. Odd... my card was in my pants pocket and the problem occurred always on the same elevator! Staff were usually very courteous and helpful...front desk staff, everyone at the concierge desk and the housekeepers... and MOST of the valets. However, on one occasion we left our car with valet for parking & went to our room and saw that it was still not parked 30 minutes later. We made 2 calls to valet requesting that the car be parked and were told that they had been busy. I commented that I'd been watching and seen that 4 cars that cae in after hours had already been parked (several immediately) and ours was still there at the front. Considering that we were paying $45.00 daily for valet parking (plus tip), I expected the car would be parked right away! Room decor is light and airy and the beds and pillows are incredibly comfortable. However, there are only 2 chairs in the room, only 1 of which is semi-comfortable. The other is a straight back chair. I would have thought in a convention hotel that there would be an ergonomic chair at the desk. Housekeeping was generally good, although it was not until the 4th day that a pen and note pad were left in the room... this is usually standard in most hotels... even ones with much lower room rates. The mouth wash left with the other standard amenities in the bathroom is a nice touch as well as the robe in the closet. Hotel is close to Gastown and also within a couple of blocks of a large grocery store. Also a number of good restaurants are within walking distance. Our favorties were Earl's on Nelson Street for an evening meal and Cafe Francais on Nelson and Hornby for breakfast or lunch (It's open until about 7 or 8 p.m.). Prices more reasonable than the hotel and both seem to be frequented by locals.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Honey2010moon
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for one night at the Sheraton Wall Centre and every staff member we came across was incredible, and they all seemed to run away before I could give them a tip, this is very pleasant as I have stayed other places where the staff linger until you hand it to them. Also when I did give them their tips they were all very gracious. The room was very clean and nicely appointed. Also if you haven't stayed at a starwood properaty before you need to check them out they have the best beds in the industry!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accommodation; lousy housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Roscoe1955
Reviews.Content: Great king size bed, nice view. Bathroom had a musty odour we noticed as soon as we entered. Upon investigation, we noticed the sink drain was plugged and slow to drain. Reminded me of the drain at home when too much hair gets caught. Shower was fine, but good that we did not choose a bath because that drain was plugged too. Noticed the toilet seat was exceedingly loose, so I just got down on the floor and tightened up those bolts. Easy to fix. We flushed the toilet and noticed the toilet "ran", so I just took the top off and we jiggled the mechanism each time we flushed. My wife thought we should complain, but I really hate making a fuss. After all, who hasn't encountered a few plumbing issues in their time? Upon checkout, we filled in a comment card with our phone number for them to contact us if they choose. I am sure they must have called by now, but we've been out a lot and must have missed their call. I bet they are really busy so I understand completely. Tourism is really strong everywhere right now.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings - Probably Wouldn't Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: RussellPDX
Reviews.Content: The view and the location are great, and the bed itself was very comfortable. The customer service was lacking. I reported an issue with our blinds immediately, and it was never resolved. I was told they were unable to move us to another room. Fortunately the blinds on the other side opened to allow to use actually see the view. It was a very anonymous stay. The modern decor in the rooms just looked cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ammy11
Reviews.Content: I just completed a seven day stay at this fantastic hotel. On all levels, my experience was a very positive one. Some highlights: the beds were super comfy; the location was ideal; the staff was informed, courteous, and helpful. I would highly recommend the Sheraton Vancouver - Wall Center to business and pleasure travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Visit”
Reviews.Author: Mazza57
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at this hotel, so stayed here as well. It was a good stay. I stayed in the South Tower in a room facing Burrard Street. The check in was very quick, maybe 3 minutes, the rooms are large by the usual business hotel standards and have a great feel about them. There's a flat screen TV and large business desk. An added bonus was a small refrigerator which I rarely find in North American hotels, and there's lots of accessible power points, so I wasn't crawling around the floor looking for a plug. It's a big hotel, but it didn't feel like a big hotel to me, never felt crowded and never had to wait too long for an elevator which often happens to other big hotels. I don't usually sleep too well the first night after flying into an overseas location, but this time, I had no trouble - the bed in the room is very, very comfortable and there's a selection of pillows. I was impressed with the option to decline the daily servicing of the room, in return for a $5 voucher to spend on food and beverages at the hotel. There's also a recycling bin in the room. But, on the flip side, the thing I didn't like was the use of disposal cups and stirrers, and the lack of even a spoon in the room. This is cultural, I know, but it's also an environmental issue - but I guess it's cheaper to provide throw away cups than to wash them up? And providing a couple of real spoons couldn't be too much to ask? The hotel is in a good location, within a 10-20 minute walk of most tourist activities and close to Davie Street which has lots of restaurants. Staff were great, particularly the room service folks, and the staff working in the conference area. I got a special conference rate, but even paying the usual rate would make this hotel good value for money, and worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: C&BM
Reviews.Content: This is not a reflection on the staff at this hotel, but we were so hugely disappointed with our room, we would never stay here again. Our room was tiny, the furniture looked cheap, and we were across the street from the Emergency Entrance to the hospital. When we expressed our displeasure we were told to call first next time, but we can assure you there will be no next time. I understand other rooms in this hotel are fantastic, but we sure did not receive a 4 star experience. We felt we wasted our money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking around downtown”
Reviews.Author: megan02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights here and loved it! We were skeptical based on other reviews, but it was great! We had a room on the 19th floor of the North Tower, and it had an awesome view. The hotel is centrally located in downtown and we were able to walk everywhere--Gastown, ferry to Granville Island, Stanley Park, etc. There was a market right down the street, and lots of restaurants and shops very close. We would stay here again if we get the chance to go to Vancouver. Parking is very expensive, so we did not bring a rental car. We booked the room through Hotwire for a much better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Highly to recommend”
Reviews.Author: herbelino
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful. Perfect service from the staff. Clean and near to all attractions in vabncouver. Also with indoor pool and gym. very good. we will come back. thats for sure. best rooms are in the north tower and make sure to get one in the upper level because of the amazing view over vancouver. robson street is very close to the hotel and also water front and stanley park. trip to the airport not longer than 25min.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service i've ever experienced in my life.”
Reviews.Author: kelseyboles1234
Reviews.Content: I have never been so disappointed in a hotels customer service in all my life... the staff was snobby, and appallingly rude. I would never in my life recommend the Sheraton hotel to anybody. And I will be certain that everyone I know is informed about there disgusting service. If I could give this hotel a negative rating I would. I’d rather stay in a motel than this disgrace of a hotel. The front desk workers and even the manager himself were some of the most useless and unhelpful people I’ve met in my life. Rather than trying to help the customer fix the problem by saying "let me see what I can do for you?" the answer was always "I’m sorry but there’s nothing I can do for you" which in my opinion is an unacceptable answer. The Sheraton Vancouver Wall Center hotel is the most dissatisfactory, disappointing, god-awful, hotels in Vancouver BC. And just a side note I was denied permission to speak to their manager... ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Great property. Snob staff.”
Reviews.Author: sens1992
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with large size rooms located right in the heart of downtown Vancouver. The front desk agent who checked us in was very snob ignoring us pretty much the whole time. He was training a new employee and she was however very friendly (luckily). The room had great views on the 10th floor. The beds were super comfortable and all the room amenities were great. We used our car a few times and we noticed that the people at valet seem to be just as snob as the front desk agent. The same happend at the concierge desk where we seemed to bother him anytime we had a question. Anyways, we will remember the Sheraton Vancouver Wall Centre as a great property with comfortable amenities but with poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: mickeytheshoe
Reviews.Content: Just leaving Sheraton (waiting for coach to whistler) so i will write this as it's fresh. Arrived thurs evening for two nights. Check in was a breeze . We were given room 2216 in the south tower. We had pre requested a high floor and hypo allergenic bedding all were ready for arrival. Excellent view from room with floor to ceiling windows. Large room with comfy sofa. Amazingly powerful shower and everything spotless. My wife noticed it could do with bathroom amenities like showed cap and cotton buds but no big deal. Large fridge for drinks and Starbucks coffee for machine. Decent tv and storage. Two closets. For a great priceline rate of $100 it's spot on. Great location for Granville and five mins to robson street.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in great location!”
Reviews.Author: LucaSora
Reviews.Content: We arrived 9am and got a room on the 25 th floor straight away! Very clean and spacious room with all amenities! The beds are super comfy! The staff is extremely polite and helpful! Shopping is just around the corner and lots of good restaurant are in walking distance! Great joice - would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very flexible staff.”
Reviews.Author: RedSnapper25
Reviews.Content: At first, we were placed in a room which was facing the street, across from a hospital. It was a large room but we didn't like the noise from the street. Receptionist was very flexible with our request and changed our room to a quieter room facing the court yard. Pros: It had a very comfortable bed. Centrally located in the Downtown Vancouver. A supermarket, Starbucks, Japadog, and movie theatre within walking distance. Cons: The service was a bit spotty because of the hotel is so huge and they had the hockey game to focus on when we stayed. We asked to come fix our safe about 3 times. Unfortunately, it took us a day or so to get someone come to our room. We also asked guest service to retrieve our voice mails about 3 or 4 times but the phone wasn't really working properly. Every time they connected us to voice mail, it got disconnected.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay, although perhaps a bit overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: DPhantasmagoria
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Front desk staff is friendly. No free wireless internet, which for the amount you're paying would have been nice. However the room had a mini fridge, which was fantastic. Large bathroom (definitely plus with two girls traveling), and amazing view. Nice central location, smack in the middle of downtown and not far from LRT train stations. Had a nice workout centre as well. Beware, though - they leave a newspaper under your door and tell you there's no charge for it, but don't tell you that if you don't take the newspaper then your room gets a credit for it, which I though was kind of sneaky. Overall good experience, though, however it was a bit pricey to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Too much street noise”
Reviews.Author: StarwoodBoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed near Burrard Street on the North Tower and frequently woke up by noises on the street (mostly cars and honks). The hotel is well located near Skytrain station. It is a large hotel and staff can be cool sometimes. The gym is a bit cheap (worse than your local gym) despite it's a 4-star hotel. The coffee shop is no longer a Starbucks, just a simple coffee shop and little to offer. It is a conference hotel for busy people who really don't need much attention of details. The North Tower is roomier than the South Tower if you're booking a standard room. Parking is very expensive I heard.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: windinthewillows
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Sheration Wall centre and loved the central location, with great sea and mountain views from our room (ask for a view). The hotel was great with only one drawback: the food (even the breakfast was below average). But the service was perfect from the moment we were welcome at the desk until our departure. The hotel recommended wonderful restaurants 2-3 blocks from the Sheraton. Be sure to try the superb Asia (or Azia) restaurant two blocks away from the hotel but stay away from the generally overpraised, overpriced and decidely boring big chinese place by the wharf. (Imperial?

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: TedZ
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Wall Centre is ideally located if you want to explore downtown Vancouver. There are more upscale offerings in the area, but for the price it presents good value for a 4 star accommodation choice. My room on the 22nd floor of the south tower was clean and bright, if a bit small. The floor to ceiling windows provided a good view of Burrard Street to the north and the downtown skyline. The bed was comfortable with a feather duvet and the bathroom was tiled with marble surfaces. You'll find the standard in room amenities (coffee, iron etc) although bathrobes aren't provided. The temperature control worked well although I found the fan noise a bit loud so turned it off during the night. I didn't use any of the hotel facilities so can't speak to their quality. The service staff were friendly and helpful. Overall a good experience, not luxury but fairly priced for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and loved it”
Reviews.Author: Klindatheau
Reviews.Content: I liked the fastness of the elevators. Staff was nice and answered all questions. Was even able to get my bills given to me and e-mailed when i required it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for work or play!”
Reviews.Author: sulawesigirl
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation through a professional conference for which I was in Vancouver. My week at the Sheraton Wall Centre was pleasant and comfortable. The free wi-fi was important for me to keep up with the office. Staff was outstanding, very helpful. After my conference, I was joined by a group of my friends, and we loved the location and the views of the city. Within walking distance to the bars and restaurants in Yaletown as well as the shopping on Robson or Granville, an easy 15 minute walk to the waterfront, etc. We couldn't have asked for a better place to spend our fun Vancouver weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: emielle
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel the week of the Stanley Cup Finals so Vancouver was buzzing with electricity. The entire staff was so helpful, but I would like to especially thank Melissa at the Front Desk. We called the night before to request a higher floor and she remembered us the next day when we stopped by looking for some restaurant recommendations. Not only did we get a higher floor we also had a decent view of the water which we weren't expecting. You can't beat the location, in the heart of downtown and so close to Robson Street. And plus you can't beat their beds... SOOO COMFORTABLE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Down Town”
Reviews.Author: SteepleHill
Reviews.Content: We got a great price on Price Line for this hotel down town Vancouver. It was perfect location. Walking distance to everything. The hotel is well staffed so there is always people around to help you. This hotel consists of 3 buildings and recently been renovated. North Tower is much nicer but the South side is not so bad since the reno. Pool is amazing cause its warm so if you have kids..its great. The only draw back is the 3rd tower is a residential building and the residence share the facilities so it can be busy in the pool area. The rooms are clean and upto date. They have free internet and its fast..Will definitely return back to this hotel if I get a good rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: LAXbuzz
Reviews.Content: I have a broken ankle and I walk with a cane. It is painful to go very far. The hotel suggested that they had a wheelchair if I wanted it to get around. I was thrilled as it meant I could go to the local tapas restaurant around the corner without pain. The bed was so comfortable and we were on the 23rd floor which had a great view. I would not hesitate recommended this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Yenjose28
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to restaurants and shops. Room was cleaned and bed was comfortable. Free wi fi acces was awesome!! Thank you Sheraton!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but can hear all noise from upstair & outside”
Reviews.Author: miles88
Reviews.Content: Pros: *Good location *Free internet Cons: *Small bed if you stay in 2 double beds room *Noise - not so much from next door, but can hear all the foot steps from upstairs & from outside (I'm not sure why and don't know where it was coming from, since we were in the 15th floor(North Tower). But there were people having party somewhere and it was pretty loud.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but...”
Reviews.Author: travellingwithkids75
Reviews.Content: First of all, I should say that this hotel is perfectly located. We set off everyday walking to our destination- Stanley Park, Granville Island, Yaletown, Robson Street, Chinatown, False Creek... anywhere we wanted to go we could walk to. We took the C-train in from the airport, and walked over to the hotel easily with our luggage. Certainly much cheaper than renting a car and paying the expensive parking rate when we probably never would have used the car during the trip. Our room was on the 24th floor of the North Tower. It had a nice view of the mountains, comfortable bed, etc... The bathtub is very shallow, but the shower is at a nice height. We did not use the health centre but did have a drink and dessert in the "one" lounge during our stay. It was a little pricy, but not excessively so. The hotel was VERY busy with a conference, but we never had to wait long for the elevator and our room was quiet. For us the rate, though expensive, was worth it due to the location more than any particular aspect of the individual rooms. There are tons of Starbucks, Tim Hortons etc... nearby so we always walked there for our breakfast, picked up something light from Urban Fare or Safeway for our lunches, and then enjoyed a great dinner at one of the nearby restaurants. One problem we had was with our tv. On one of the evenings we stayed, it was raining quite heavily outside so we decided to stay in and watch a pay-per-view movie. However, it wouldn't work. We called down to the front desk and they sent someone up. He tried and tried to fix it but couldn't. He went to get another part while we went to get a drink in the lounge and thought it would be fixed by the time we returned. It wasn't and by that time, it was going to be too late to watch a movie anyways so we ended up turning in early. My other issue was with the billing. I had purchased a pre-pay stay and was billed accordingly. However, I did make a long-distance phone call (at a very unreasonable rate of 18.25 for a less than 5 minute talk to Edmonton). When we received our bill in the morning, the charge had been reversed- I assumed this was the hotel attempting to make some compensation for the fact that we couldn't use the television. However, then about 4 days later, my credit card was charged for the phone call. I think that the bill should be more clear if they are in fact putting an additional charge through- I don't dispute the call, but the bill was very unclear.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: GoneTrippn
Reviews.Content: I really liked this location, so I'm not sure about some of the complaints. If you're a fit walker, most things are 10 or 15 minutes away. I could be in Gastown in 15 minutes and Yaletown in 10. Vancouver is not that big. I would stay here again at the right price. Room not huge, but I had nice light and good views. It's a good, clean business hotel, not a romantic getaway. I did not like how I had to wait in line everytime to talk to the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there again !!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug60750
Reviews.Content: Had a confirmed room for the North Tower (had been warned about the South Tower by a review on Trip Advisor...all facilities, restaurants etc are in the North Tower) When I arrived I was given a South Tower room and told there was nothing available in the North Tower. The room was cramped, furnishings hideous, the air-conditioning did not work (it was 80 plus degrees outside ) and I had an outside view of a demolished building through the window. I was promised/assured a room change after the first night, but there was no follow through as the staff had changed shift; the new woman on reception could not have been more rude. They claimed to have fixed the air-conditioning (in the process breaking the large mirrored wardrobe door!) but this was not so and, again, I slept only a few hours because of the heat. I feel sure that I would not have been treated thus had I been traveling with a male companion; I felt discriminated against because I was a female traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “First and last time I stay in a Sheraton hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monomox3000
Reviews.Content: This was a disappointing experience right from the start. When I was trying to check in the lady in the front desk told me Sheraton would not accept my credit card because it was "flat," i.e., the letters and numbers are not raised. I thought I would just go and stay somewhere else, but then the lady told me my credit card had already been charged for the room. I felt in a tight situation and that Sheraton would not care about it. In the end, Sheraton was "gracious" enough to let me stay in a room I had already paid, by accepting 40 USD as deposit. What did Sheraton get? A liability insurance worth 40 USD and an upset customer. To add insult to injury, EVERY DAY of my stay I had to call the Internet service technical assistance hotline to help me connect to the wireless network. The third time I called, I had to even convince the technician on the other side of the line that I didn't have a network cable in front of me and that I, indeed, had a wireless signal. When I complained about this with the management of the hotel their response was "oh, it's a third-party service, we can't do anything about it." This was the first time I stayed in a Sheraton hotel and hopefully the last one. The week before I stayed in a Hilton hotel in Washington, DC, and the experience was the opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Not for tourist”
Reviews.Author: Wallyjoe
Reviews.Content: Arrived after 8PM and decided to eat in hotel, it was the worst meal I had in Vancouver. The night before I left was game seven of Hockey play offs with Chicago, they didn't have a single reservation! Every place else was packed. No TV in bar area contributes to that. When asked they explained, "That's the way we want it." Hotel is in center of Vancouver but it's a 15 minute walk to anything for tourist. Hotel is sold as upscale. I could tell when the water left in the room was tagged $4.50 if consumed. Don't put out the sign for conservation not to change the linens, they don't enter the room at all, do not replace coffee, shampoo, or vacuum. Exterior looks really nice, but they need an interior decorator. North tower foyer turns into sitting area, then bar, then restaurant. This area with 12 foot ceilings with no pictures or decorations and little color made airport waiting rooms look good. The south tower where we stayed was just as austere. The really good part of the hotel was the best weigthroom, pool, and arobic equipment I have experienced when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the comfy beds and great location!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMGus
Reviews.Content: We were able to secure a good price for this room by using price line, otherwise it would have been above our budget. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious. We came to Vancouver with extended family and were able to have adjoining rooms that the kids could go between. Very quiet without too much street noise. The only draw back was the price for parking. We had a carrier on top of our car and had to use the valet parking. Parking was $45 dollars a day. May be a better deal for those who fly into this city. Otherwise, the stay was great and the staff very friendly. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed , great location and views a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: afm00
Reviews.Content: Great views and good location for walking to most attractions. We had a suite (free upgrade as my companions points had expired) that was very large and comfortable. I am not sure the price we paid would have been worth it if we had a small room. Staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice but, only one (very dreary) restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Salop1
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel last year as I have stayed here many times and it had deteriorated. Sadly I feel just as disappointed as last time. The hotel is clearly trying to save money. First the pros: my room was clean and well serviced, the bed comfortable and the staff very pleasant and willing. The cons: The hotel has no decent restaurant.The Indigo restaurant is closed permanently it seems, (despite still being advertised on the website). The only restaurant is the seriously awful Cafe One. Aircon there is savage (even the table candle flames blow around inside a jar) and the atmosphere there is more like eating in an office. (There isn't any atmosphere). The restaurant decor is really dreary and not in the least warm and welcoming, The food is very average for big money (a $40 steak was well-done when medium rare was requested) and the vegetables went stone cold on a tepid plate in the aircon. There was a time when you were welcomed with some nice warm bread, corn bread and an oil and vinegar dip. Not any more. This explains why it is mostly empty unless there is a convention in town. In the rooms, the free wifi is slow and the premium wifi ($18.95 a day) is not much better. Speed tests show barely a third of the advertised speed. It also drops the connection (apparently the engineers disconnected the server without telling anyone) and so you have to sign on again and pay again if you want premium bandwidth. I use Sheraton frequently, this one is a poor relation.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel Owner”
Reviews.Author: regularJane
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times over the past six years. I find the owner is getting cheaper on many amenities: side dishes getting smaller and entrees more expensive, they removed almost all the pay phones in the hotel concourse (like 18 out of 20), old carpet in the gym, same very old gym accessories (weights, bosu balls, mats), small towels in gym and pool not adult sized. The worst thing that I experienced was taking my family down to the swimming pool. We were shocked to find out that the pool was very cold! Virtually unheated. My children were unable to stay in the pool longer than four minutes as they started shivering and my youngest lips turned purple. Please turn the pool up to a liveable temperature or I will keep posting and taking pictures of the readings, as I stay for business often without family. Also, there was a band aid in the pool during my entire stay of five days. Other than this listed, things were great and I can't complain. Staff was amazing, location great!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money here”
Reviews.Author: NMK22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a Bachelorette weekend, thinking that we'd give the bride to be a special experience - What a joke! There was a very fresh puke stain in our suite. We requested a room with a view and they stuck us on the 6th floor, w/ no view. Anytime we needed any extras of anything they charged us $5 - There was 0 hospitality. For the money we paid for the suite, I'd expect A LOT more out of the Sheraton. We had friends that stayed at the Holiday Inn (located in a better location of DT) and we so happy with their suite and hotel staff - Save your money and don't book at the Sheraton - Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel but under renos”
Reviews.Author: TrueCanucks
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in February while I attended some appointments. The location is great. Its in easy walking to distance to all of downtown Vancouver. We really loved the bed and bedding. The linens were bright white, clean and crisp yet so soft to sleep in. The room was a standard hotel room - nothing at all above a 3 star. However, it was very clean and neat. Our cleaning lady/chambermaid did a fabulous job of taking care of us. The Indigo restaurant had delicious food but the prices were exorbitant compared to the multitudes of other restaurants of the same caliber in the surrounding area. So, we only ate there once. The prices are probably why the room was usually no more than 1/3 full during the supper hours).The beverage prices at Indigo were ridiculously high. For example, walk down to Robson Street and try Zeffereli's restaurant (its atop the Cactus Club). Old world, early 20th century charm and fine Italian food, prices and atmosphere. Don't let the sign that says 'spaghtetti' fool you into thinking its something less than it is. And there's an Earl's restaurant 1 block from the Sheraton, too. No one told us there was renovation going on in the main lobby when we booked. That would have been courteus. It should be posted on the website. The renos didn't disturb our stay, but it was in the lobby (so not an inviting place to sit) and, it was their main restaurant that was being redone (not the Indigo). We had a very difficult time getting our messages from the Front Desk and actually didn't get them for some hours sometimes. Not helpful. The swimming pool is a very long way from the hotel rooms, down long corridors and stairs and while we were there, the roof near the stairwell was leaking. The hotel put a garbage bin under it to collect the water! Odd. All of this aside, this is a comfortable, clean and safe hotel right in the heart of the city center and yes, we would choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and central”
Reviews.Author: Getawayguy20
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Wall in Vancouver, British Columbia likely isn't the fanciest hotel in the downtown area, but it's central to going nearly anywhere you'd like, like English Bay, Coal Harbour, Granville Island, or even Stanley Park. The hotel is spacious, elegant, clean with good amenities. The pool was large and long enough to do a proper swim workout, the exercise equipment was in very good shape, although I believe it's shared with a residence tower as part of the hotel chain, so it might be very busy early am and evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhop123
Reviews.Content: Just attended an annual meeting, held at the Wall Centre this year. Nice room, comfortable bed and great staff. I paid a few extra dollars for a north tower corner room-money well spent. Will stay here again next time in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Good Location, Modern, Starbucks, Free Internet”
Reviews.Author: CliveWoodrow
Reviews.Content: I forgot how nice it is to stay at a hotel that has modern amenities. Here is my list: Master Room Switch - all lights off, at once. Cool. Cupboard light when the door opens, Nice. Simple Thermostat. Up = Heat, Down = Cool, Fan on/off. And it's quite. Comfy. Desk and chair that you can work at. Chair arms actually go under the desk. Works. Shower light. No blinding experience first thing in the morning. See. Card needed to access floor. Security (but not needed in this area). Starbucks in the room. Real Cream, no powder. Stirring. Finally and this is a neat idea. They have card that allows you to get a $5.00 gift card at a local food store if you want to pass on housekeeping. So drives local businesses and save on really unnecessary housekeeping, chemicals, washing towels, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and simple rooms. Good value”
Reviews.Author: bwb512
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this property 10+ times over the past ten years! It has good beds, great location, close to David and shopping. Can be a bit noisy if you are in the tower facing the hospital. The two bedroom suites with balcony are nice in the Summer

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: ctlshaw
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here in November. The hotel was located very closely to Robson and Granville streets. Plenty of restaurants, corner stores and shopping nearby. I took in a Canucks games and the walk was a brisk one but not overly far for me. The staff at the front desk were very accomodating. I asked for a late checkout and received one and they were able to give me a touristy walking itinerary for the short time I was there. If I had a complaint, it would be that they didn't really give me adequate directions to the business centre / LInk@Sheraton area which is in the walkway between the north and south towers. I spent a good ten minutes trying to find it. I stayed in the north tower and view was nice though the weather really prevented me from seeing to much. The room itself was pretty spacious for one and came with a mini-fridge. Always a plus for me. I didn't entirely care for the decor, but that is personal taste. The bed was nice and comfortable and I was able to get high speed wireless in my room. The value for what I paid seemed reasonable and I would stay here again if coming to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Yukito22
Reviews.Content: This place is a little pricey, but so are a lot of the hotels in the main part of Vancouver.
