It's only a few blocks from the beach and from Stanley Park and it's right in the midst of all the restaurants and shops. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The man at the front desk gave me an option of having a room right away on a lower floor or waiting for one of the higher ones (I was there early) so I waited. The bellmen here are prompt and always helpful. The beds here are EXCELLENT. You sleep like a log because the beds are incredibly comfortable. What I especially like about this hotel is that the rooms have options to not have maid service the next day and if you choose this option, you get $5 to use at the hotel (there's a starbucks, for example). Good deal! I used the fitness center every day. It had a lot of good machines and weights. Also? The Spa here is HEAVEN. Not only is it stunning when you enter the space, but the people who work there are good at their job and really give you your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “best location, view and beds in downtown”
Reviews.Author: jkbc2010
Reviews.Content: We always try to stay at the Wall Centre - it's super location just can't be beat! They always upgrade us to the view rooms at the top of the north tower and the starwood beds are simply amazing. Service is pretty good and I have experienced some great and some medium. They even have a car wash on sight! We are heading there again next month and I can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kicking_it
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling for business - this is a great hotel in Vancouver downtown. It is a short walk to Robson street for shopping and Hornby street for a quick bite. There's a 7-eleven right around the corner, which can be handy for buying cheaper water or snacks, if you don't want to shell out 5$ a bottle at the hotel. There is a small coffee shop and a subway on the back side of the hotel so you can grab a quick bite there as well. If you have status with Starwood then you can get access to the lounge and enjoy good complimentary breakfast every morning with fantastic views from the lounge. You can also get snacks there in the evening, which is wonderful. There is a small but decent gym along with a swimming pool & sauna that is attached to the hotel to keep you fit while you're away from home. There are many good eating options in Vancouver and close to the hotel, walk 5-10 minutes to get to Yaletown & enjoy amazing food. A great hotel to stay. I liked the ambiance of the Westin hotel on Robson better but Sheraton is recommended for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels in Vancouver for the price.”
Reviews.Author: mairc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the South Tower... Had airmiles (4000 airmiles miles for two nights, two beds) book as I have stayed in the north tower before and quite enjoyed everything then when I booked it myself. I think because it's airmiles they (airmiles) reserve the least desireable of rooms. Small!! Upon arrival check in was very friendly and fast! Same as check out. We got in late and decided to stay in and watch a movie (a relaxed evening as we had a big concert the next evening) but the pay per view was not working. Phoned downstairs to make sure it wasn't me that was having a problem with the TV and the very friendly and appologetic staff stated that they have been having problems for the past few days or so with their provider. OK then! As I stated the room was small for the 4000 airmiles, but that is likely the deal between air miles and the Sheraton with airmiles cheaping out. I have never used my airmiles for a room before and think that they are best used for flights. One nice thing about this room though is there is a small balcony and if you smoke it does keep you from having to go 22 floors down to the lobby. Front door people were super friendly as you would come and go. Cleaning staff was cordial and did a good job cleaning the room while we were out. No pop-vending machines and ice machines every other odd numbered floor South Tower. Stay in the North Tower. It's newer and the restaurant is over there.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Vancouver option but watch what you pay”
Reviews.Author: Reisaapie
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline at 100 us. Good price for the two doubles, downtown location, fridge and sink in the room, staff were friendly. Room was not superclean- and was not properly attended to after we called it in (leftover sandwich in fridge, dust accumulation under desk and behind chairs). Parking, as we knew beforehand, expensive at 40 dollars a day. We arrived at 330 and room was not ready yet, were told it would take 30 mins, but when we asked again at 430 assigned room still not ready, but staff were able to reshuffle. 9th floor still has significant street noise in the south tower. Small extra sink, fridge and starbucks coffeemaker nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Sloppy hotel management”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1234532513
Reviews.Content: Checking in to a Shertaon, you expect hot water. But unfortunately this wasn't the case at this Sheraton, with little urgency shown by hotel staff to address or update me on the attempt to fix. On return home I contacted the hotel and got the response: "Unfortunately we did experience a larger boiler problem during the time you were with us which could have affected the water temperature. Due to the sporadic nature of the issue we could not notify or even identify the affected rooms at that time. Luckily our engineers have been able to identify the cause and are working on a solution." If they told me during my stay they were having sporadic boiler problems I could make a choice to stay somewhere else. Sloppy...

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel albeit exceptionally bland”
Reviews.Author: rrafay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sheraton with my wife on our way back up to Arctic Canada from a honeymoon in Bali. We had already spent much of our budget and just needed a quality place in the middle of town, which is difficult to come by in Vancouver. We used priceline and got a very good rate, so no complaints on price. If I spent full price on this place though, I would be angry. The hotel is clean, the hotel rooms are clean, functional and really have everything you 'NEED.' But, there is no personality in the entirety of this hotel. It is like sleeping in an office. If it disappeared tomorrow, no one would remember it. It does not have a vibe at all, entering the lobby feels like entering the lobby of an office building... just a place used to get to the actual offices. Location is excellent though. Parking is a little bit too high ($35 a day) and internet too ($15 a day). Keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Most Comfortable Bed Ever & Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: kimeh
Reviews.Content: My first few days staying at the Sheraton Wall Centre were for my company's annual conference, but I stayed a few extra days for the personal vacation I took after the conference ended. Overall, it was a very positive experience. The staff was very helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable, the food was good (if overpriced) and the views were amazing. This hotel is centrally located; a quick 10 minute walk to Robson Street and tons of great shopping. The building itself is beautifully designed, with wonderful rooms. I stayed in both the North and South towers during my visit, and can definitely say I preferred the newer North tower. It's also where I had the best view from my floor-to-ceiling window which gave me an amazing view of the harbour and the buildings downtown. I can honestly say that the mattress was the most comfortable I've ever slept on and I still think of it longingly!

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear what a pity, it used to be so good .....”
Reviews.Author: Salop1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times when working in Vancouver.The rooms are good and well priced but the restaurant availability and pricing has gone completely down the pan in the last 18 months along with certain services. Which leaves room service which is happy, friendly and OK, but the food is never really hot. Once upon a time they had a convenient little restaurant called Indigo on the ground floor of the South Block which was easy to get to, had great staff and a good, reasonably priced menu and wine list. It is still advertised on the web-site but it's actually now closed. Thanks for the misleading info Sheraton. Instead you have to go to a place called Cafe One, trekking way away across the site, with no signposts, to the North Block. It's probably quickest to go out in the pouring rain to find it. When you have found it, what a disappointment. It's a huge place with no diners, (not surprising), a very expensive and very limited wine list and the food is now very expensive but just about OK. Just what a working person needs. Its served on plates that get ice cold in the air con before you can finish the food. I had no spoon for my soup and the server filled up my glass with wine like it was a beer glass. No training on how to serve a $50 bottle of wine I guess. This place is so depresssing, what a shame, compared with what it used to be! In addition, "Guest Services" take ages to answer the phone so you give up after a while. As a Platinum level guest I expect a great deal better. I am heading for the Sheraton in Kuwait next month, soooo much better than this dump. May be I will check out tomorrow and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best Comforter and okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: wylieb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre for a couple nights. Check in was quick, elevators were quick but steady, room was okay. Had trouble initially getting the lights sorted out and getting the temperature sorted out. But room was comfortable, internet worked easily after registering. Real standout was the bed and comforter - best hotel bed I've eve slept in and the comforter was great - I was actually warm! For the first time thought about asking where the comforter came from. Loved, loved the comforter. Cleaning didn't happen until later in the day so was initially surprised at mid-day when room wasn't done. Not a huge number of restaurants to choose from so didn't eat at hotel. Well stocked gift store in lobby. Could hear the ambulances once in a while at night as hotel is by hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, good food, moderate service, awful location”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary S
Reviews.Content: Please bear in mind my perspective. I live in the pristine Bella Coola Valley. Down town Davey street with the dirt, crowds and construction was almost unbearable. The view from my spectacular room was attempts at greenscapes on roof tops, and bumper to bumper traffic. I couldn't keep my window open for cool night air because of the bar across the street. But the rooms were great, the linen lovely, the food great. They couldn't get me the right food (I have a wheat allergy and don't eat pork) at any meal. But I didn't starve eating around the taboo items and what I did eat was good. And I was able to find a Tim Hortons just 1/2 a block away! I certainly would never recommend it as a conference site though (that's what I was at).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: CheshireLady
Reviews.Content: Room was fantastic, good quality and clean. The only negatives were that on our first day our room had not been serviced by the time we returned from shopping (it was after 4pm!) and the bar across the road cranks up the music after 11pm (we kept our window shut!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel except they charge for Internet.”
Reviews.Author: DiscoverAndEnjoy
Reviews.Content: Great room, excellent staff, delightful wine paIring in the restaurant and friendly helpful staff. What I hate is paying for in room Internet whn much of the city is supposed to be wifi. Internet is no longer an option it must be included in room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: airmilesali
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business. Booked through Hotwire and was delighted with the hotel. Beds really comfortable, staff helpful and courteous. Close to Robson Street and local downtown area. Free wifi. Thank you, at last a hotel that gets offering free wi fi. Would recommend to any business travellers to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “hotwire-Nice location but handicap room”
Reviews.Author: sdtomega
Reviews.Content: i reserved the room using hotwire so it might have been why we were given a handcap room. they did fufill my request of getting a king size bed but did not allow me to pick to the tower or the floor. overall the room was nice. the furnishings and bathroom were low because it was handicap. the location was amazing we walked everyhwere and took the trolley to the sites further away. overall well worth the price we paid but be adivsed that when booking with hotwire you can only request what type of bed or room you get.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, though a bit cold”
Reviews.Author: Luke242
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 1 night stay in the north tower, 2 double beds (seemed tiny bit bigger than 1 king in picture but cannot confirm this). I found this hotel to be nice though some staff helpful,some are very cold and borderline rude. I checked out the hotel day before I checked in, used payphone downstairs and was told by a staff member to "get off the call as downstairs was closed". This had me worried about my stay though thankfully this man did not check me in. Tv was not working but after calling many times (no1 answered), to guest services, engineers are up and for some reason they got it to work, which was good. Room was a bit small but not too bad. Pool was alright thought the hot tub was not working, though later in evening it did, pool busy with kids later made pool less enjoyable as it is a decent size but not large, but it was nice. Had a restricted view but still great, could see some mountains and Stanley Park on 20th floor, I would not want a low level floor due to traffic noise on Burrard St. I would probably stay again but only in North Tower and most likely only if I got a deal, otherwise I would explore my options.

Reviews.Title: “Poor soundproofing and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jimforever
Reviews.Content: Design of rooms means noise from corridor is a given. Not helped on my first night by corridor arguments and some very noisy guests nextdoor (who were evicted the following morning). Beds comfortable but rooms small, wifi expensive and always a line at the front desk. Admittedly the staff were friendly enough and moved me to a room at the end of the corridor where noise was less of a problem. You can find much better in Vancouver for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Meh.....”
Reviews.Author: mircoe_mcc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one week. I was in the north tower. The first night I in a lower floor room and the next day the kindly moved my up to the 23rd floor. The hotel rooms are nice. They are small. One thing that I was NOT happy about was I had bought some cereal and on my way back to the room I stopped by the lobby to ask for a bowl. The lady at the front desk said that would be fine, she would send room service up with a bowl but it would cost me $5 as room service would be bringing it up. I told her it was fine and I would wait and I could bring it up (i was standing right near the restaurant). Nope, room service HAD to bring it up and they had to charge me $5. Needless to say, I went out and found a bowl somewhere else. They gym is ok, some of the equipment is very old but the cardio equipment seemed new. The pool was nice - two hot tubs. All in all - the hotel was fine but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, great city views...”
Reviews.Author: ashley_w206
Reviews.Content: I went on a trip to Vancouver with some girlfriends to celebrate a birthday. We stayed at the Sheraton in the north tower and the rooms were beautiful (although quite small). We heard from other friends who were staying in the older part of the hotel that their rooms were a little less fabulous. All in all, though, we had a good experience, and we got a great deal on the rooms via priceline! Parking was expensive, which would be one of the main downfalls.

Reviews.Title: “Noise from night club above tenth floor”
Reviews.Author: rhorm
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel but there was no sleeping for the sound of music coming from a nightclub. When calling front dest about excessive noise they said"IT DOSEN'T" USYALLY GO PAST THE TENTH FLOOR". Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jildebeast
Reviews.Content: A great hotel and excellent staff, fantastic facilities and right in the heart of the city. We were on the 29th floor and although I'm not keen on heights, the views were amazing. Plenty of local eateries within the surrounding blocks and the salmon burgers at the Pirate Pub near the beach were delicious :) Plenty to do and see within easy walking distance. Gas Town, Stanley Park, the beach and Robson Street for shopping and much much more. A very easy city to get around in and I would definitely recommend a visit. Trips to Whistler and Vancouver Island are a must!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: janda12
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, spacious rooms and very comfortable beds, although a big hotel, as its spacious it doesnt seem crowded. 10-15 min walk downtown to lots ot shops and restaurants, would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: mkessler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the business meeting. Unless you are "club" member internet is not included, hotel is full of frills that raise the price and its nothing special. All show, and not much value.

Reviews.Title: “Honest and Dedicated service that I didn't know still exists in this day and age!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyBunny11791
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write reviews- but the dedicated and honest service at Sheraton Wall Centre inspired me to write one... My husband and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. And in our rush at checkout, we forgot to empty the room safe and retrieve our belongings. By time we remembered, we were already 4 hour south of Vancover in US. We called the hotel, and a saint of an employee, Richard in Housekeeping, resolved the issue with class and honesty. He retrieved our items from the safe and mailed them to our home. There were several pieces of jewlery (especially momentous pieces from our wedding- obviously meant a lot to me) and an IPod- and I was so pleased to find out that there are wonderful and trustworthy people left in this world! I commend this hotel on maintaining the highest level of integrity and service to their customers. I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat! You should too. Our room had a beautiful city view. And breakfast was yummy. There is also free Wifi in the big lobby of one of the towers).

Reviews.Title: “Typical Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: cyclinglover
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights. This is a typical Sheraton with good rooms and great service. What bothered me was the lack of proper sound insulation. I'm a light sleeper, and could not sleep well due to the noise from traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Typical Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: edmb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 3 times in September. Each time we stayed on the Preferred Guest Floor in the North Tower ( Floors 25 and 26 ). Friends travelling with us stayed in the South tower which was also nice but seemed a little older and more dated than the North Tower. The North tower is also where the fitness centre, spa, bar and restaurant is located. The rooms were very spacious and very clean. The mini bar was not stocked, which I actually liked as it allowed me to keep my own drinks cool. They rooms all had a flat panel TV and a sweet sleeper bed. We called room service for extra towels one morning and they were delivered within 15 minutes, along with a follow up call from guest services to ensure we had received them. The concierge was very helpful in storing our bags, arranging taxis. etc. There was also a starbucks on the lower level and a check in kiosk for the airport where you can check in and print your boarding pass. The downside is the price of parking, it costs about $40 per night with in and out privileges. There are plenty of lots nearby and I am sure with a little research you can find a better deal. Also there is no Wifi in the rooms and the cost of a ethernet connection is astronomical! There is however free wifi in the lobby and computers available on the 3rd floor business centre for free. This hotel is within a 15 min walk to Robson street, Stanley park, the waterfront and Rogers Place. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Vancouver with a need to stay in the downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip!”
Reviews.Author: ItsFun2BMe
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent location and very clean...Overall beautiful...Room with great views from the 21st floor.

Reviews.Title: “I am sure it is a great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Nathaniels_Uncle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Labour Day and took advantage of Expedia's Labour Day rate special at this hotel. As is not uncommon with Expedia, this entitled us to the smallest room in the place. So small, there wasn't room for a chair. Not that I am complaining as the price was right and there was much to do outside the hotel, but I am surprised a hotel of this calibre sells this room - as a king. Otherwise, great place. Good fitness facility. As is common with high end hotels, the WiFi was expensive. Why are cheaper hotels infinitely more likely to offer free WiFi than high priced hotels?

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: tlkennerson
Reviews.Content: This was a very average hotel experience. The location was great, but the rooms were average at best. I've experienced better. Room service is extremely expensive. The concierge was not impressive. The exterior was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay with great service”
Reviews.Author: YorksUK
Reviews.Content: We had a really good experience at the Sheraton Wall Centre. Got a good rate through Priceline and received a very comfortable room on the 24th floor (South Tower) with fantastic harbour views. The room was very well appointed, clean and comfortable with a superb bed. The concierge gave great advice for planning and booking our day trip to Victoria - nothing was too much trouble. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tangqiao
Reviews.Content: We used valet parking and when we got our car back we noticed a scratch and dent in the front. We notified the guest service and asked to speak to the manager, we were told all of them are tied up with other situations and don't know when they will be available. We waited for 45 minutes, still no one showed up. A staff named Tim G spoke to us with a condescending tone that since they don't know where and when that happened therefore they can't be responsible for it. They kept saying that it might be and old dent etc. We were shocked at their attitude. Never expected such a terrible customer service at Sheraton. It's half hotel half condo sold to private owners. We took a stroll early morning in front of the hotel lobby where there is fountain and a big lawn. An unleashed brown pitbull suddenly dashed towards my 5 year old son and barking horrifically, we were terrified. When we reported to the front desk, the staff replied the dog might belong to the owner of the condo of millions of dollars and she can't do anything about that.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience...”
Reviews.Author: CaAz-JT
Reviews.Content: We are on the second night of a two day stay, but I am confident of our experience that I can comment on it prior to checkout. We are staying in a large room in the south tower and couldn't be happier. I reserved the room via hotels.com and was expecting to have a less than happy experience (based on a few reviews previously posted) but all that went out the window when we showed up and were treated very, very well by the staff at the south tower. I was originally assigned a 2 double bed room, but when I inquired if we could get a king bed room instead the girl at the counter said "no problem" and proceeded to check for me...finding one of 4 that were available and checking us in with a very cheerful attitude. The concierge in the lobby was used a number of times, and each time the individual at the desk was very helpful and polite. We would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend this to anyone staying in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious North Tower Room - Cozy Stay”
Reviews.Author: Trevelling_Macs
Reviews.Content: Was on a business/leisure trip in Vancouver. Stayed at the Wall Centre for 4 nights. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Beds were comfortable. Initially was given a tiny room in the south tower even after I specifically asked for a room in the north tower. The staff were helpful and allowed us to transfer. The building in itself is impressive and they have nice fountains and a spacious lawn for kids to play around. Thanks to AAA we got free breakfast vouchers and had a sumptuous breakfast at the restaurant. Overall a very good experience. The only negative was no free-wireless in the rooms. In fact our room had only a wired connection which we paid for. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: JKMMP
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several nights last month--wasn't too sure we'd made a good choice after reserving the Sheraton through Hotwire, but had a very nice stay. We had to wait a while when we attempted to check in a bit early, but were rewarded with a room on a high floor (26th floor?) with great views, although we happened to be there during a (by Vancouver standards) heat wave, and so things were hazier than usual. The location was great, the room very nicely furnished and reasonably sized; the service was somewhat impersonal but not surprising given the size of the place--and frankly, that's not why we stayed there. Great city--TUTS was a highlight!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bedding!”
Reviews.Author: Welly9355
Reviews.Content: We spent a quick overnight at this hotel but will definitely return. The staff were accommodating, the rooms were clean, modern and comfortable. The duvets/pillows were particularly inviting. Only negative was the sound transmission between rooms. I have not noticed this at a hotel for some time and was glad that we had our earplugs along. A tip: Go with the valet parking - it's only a couple of dollars more and a lot more convenient then navigating the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth money paid for”
Reviews.Author: Jenny10103
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire and t's NOT worth the money we paid for!! We asked for non-smoking room because of young kids, however, there's very strong cigarette smell in the room that we have to open the window for the night. Room carpet is very dirty, so is the floor of bathroom. One thing terrible is the toilet seat, it cannot stay up by itself when boys using it, you have to use one hand to hold it, otherwise it will fall down. Maybe only our room has this toilet seat problem, so please stay away from Room 707!!! The hotel location is okay, but no free parking, prepare to pay 41CAD/night for self-parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mrsenano
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay in this hotel. We originally got a corner room with two double beds but it was in this strange corner configuration where each bed was in a cramped corner. We called to guest services and for $50 we were upgraded to a two bedroom suite on the 19th floor in the South Tower. Totally worth it! The suite was nicely appointed with comfortable beds, had a bedroom with a queen bed and the main room had a king size bed with a leather couch. Bathroom was adequate and they provided plush robes. Location was excellent, just a couple of blocks from Robson Street and walking distance from Granville Street with its nightlife. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: parkedunderthestars
Reviews.Content: absolutely my favorite hotel in vancouver. I'm from victoria and whenever my boyfriend and I cross the waters to enjoy a concert or a weekend on the town this is where we stay! Always clean and the beds are so comfy I could just spend the weekend right there haha. The floor to ceiling windows are always great. I don't believe we've ever stayed on a floor below the 12th so I'm not sure what street noise etc sounds like from down there but it's never been an issue for me. The central location is great too. While I believe other reviewers complaints are valid, I wanted to point out one thing. A lot of people mention the mini fridges and their lack of cooling. Mini fridges, no matter where you go, will always have very poor "pull down", meaning that while they keep already cold thing cold, they're not very good at pulling down the tempuratures of warm items.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice views!”
Reviews.Author: kmarinov
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre on August 22 and 23. When we first arrived in our room we were amazed, we were on the 23rd floor of the hotel and had a beautiful city view. The room was a fair size and had an incredibly comfy bed. I would suggest looking in their information book they provide in the room so you can see the costs of everything. Phone calls are outrageously priced. As well, i suggest you don't drink the bottled water in the room, they cost you $4.50 each. The fridge in the room is a good size but doesn't cool anything. A great perk was that we could forgo house keeping and we would receive a $5 voucher to the hotels restaurant, bar, Starbucks, or gift shop. We went for a swim in the pool on the first night there and enjoyed ourselves, the pool was crowded, but a fair size. A big plus about our room was that we were able to open the windows, which most hotels don't have. We were disappointed in a few areas of the hotel, one of the major ones being service. Throughout our stay we didn't see a single person at the concierge desk, every time we needed directions we either used our phones to look them up, or stood in line at the check in desk to get a map. As well when we went to the pool, there was no one manning he desk. And of course you need to get your towels from them, so we had to walk up to our room "toweless". Oh yes and don't let me forget that parking was $38 a day!!!! All in all we had a great stay, and would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Usefull but also used”
Reviews.Author: Bjoern W
Reviews.Content: Hotel consists of different buildings with a very nice outer front, very mondern styled, very easy spotable from the city as a good landmark positive: good service, good office center, good beds, nice, cheap internet access negative: quite far away from the congress center and waterfront, rooms are normal equipped but used

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Enjoythetrip
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hotel very much. Location was wonderful and the staff went beyond expectations. No trouble recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very clean room”
Reviews.Author: mjgilles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for a week to celebrate my Birthday, We had a nice time and enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff was friendly, the room was clean and modern. It had great views of the city and part of the ocean. The only issue with our room was when we took a shower; the pipes would make a loud noise. Probably old plumbing.? The showers were great, other than that. We loved visiting Vancouver fo the first time, but will probably not be back . Too many people and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “No wifi in room”
Reviews.Author: Grgz
Reviews.Content: The website says "Internet access is available throughout the hotel", but there is no wifi in the rooms. You have to go to the lobby in the main building. :-(

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel - Pleasant But Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Michael_SD
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Vancouver - Wall Centre is a high rise hotel in downtown, conveniently located within walking distance to great shopping & dining. This hotel has 2 towers, an older one and a newer one. We were in the older one (I'm sure due to the fact that we booked off of a discount travel site). The tower we were in was fine - nothing more, nothing less. The room was clean with Sheraton's great bedding. There was nothing memorable about the room, but it served its purpose and allowed us a good night's rest. You can tell you're in an older room that has been touched-up several times. The lobby area is small, but lovely and modern with a great fragrance throughout and a friendly staff. The hotel also has a fitness center which was nothing more than a closet with some equipment. Don't go expecting some grand spa/fitness center. This is as basic as it gets, but is fine for a run on the treadmill. As we were in the older tower, it was quite a walk to the fitness center (down a hall, across a skybridge, down a hall, down some stairs, around the corner....) There is also the usual Sheraton internet center at this hotel. This hotel was your typical downtown, chain property. It was fine for what it was. I had no complaints. Clean rooms, nice staff, good location. Just.....well, fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great Price. Expensive parking.”
Reviews.Author: jgm2
Reviews.Content: This is so well located that the open-topped tour buses leave from just outside. Rooms are very well appointed with their own fridge. We lucked-in and got water-facing rooms which was a complete bonus for the Fireworks competition. Who knew? Room not ready on arrival though so perhaps they up-graded us out of pity. Or my wife's Gold Frequent Sheraton-Stayer card or whatever it's called. Actually that was probably it. Parking was 50CDN a day (with tax) and took a fair while from ordering the car to it actually appearing. Hotel is just opposite the hospital so I was expecting a night punctuated by sirens but none came. Perhaps they don't shoot each other or stab each other quite as regularly as we do in the UK or the US. Well located for shopping and eating and near to a supermarket if you want budget provisions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and stay!”
Reviews.Author: caram30
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre for three nights from Aug. 17th - 20th, and our stay was nothing short of incredible. Since we had arrived quite early, we fully expected to have to wait to check in, but the hotel was able to check us in immediately. In addition, although we preferred two double beds, only a king size bed was available at the time of booking. When we arrived, however, the hotel immediately checked for availability of a room with two beds. They not only were able to accommodate us, but our room was a corner room on the 33rd floor with ceiling to floor panoramic windows and a balcony. The view of English Bay and towards Granville Island was unbelievable, I took so many pictures from our balcony, and loved sitting in my bed looking out over the city. Our room was lovely, comfortable, and clean - a joy and what a view!!! The service, from start to finish, was exceptional and everyone went out of their way to make our stay a good one. When our air conditioning did not seem to be cooling, the hotel sent two repairmen up immediately. They were very pleasant and fixed the air conditioning very quickly. They told us if there were any problems, just to call. Meanwhile, the front desk checked with us later, just to make sure it had been taken care of. Also, the hotel had a wheelchair that we could borrow for my mom to use. As far as ammenities, the hotel had a wonderful fitness center and pool, and my mom and I loved getting breakfast at Tim Horton's which was only a block away. There was also a 7-11 right across the street which was great for snacks, a packed lunch, or stamps. My mom and I had booked the Hop On - Hop Off bus for sightseeing in Vancouver, and the Sheraton Wall Centre was in an ideal location to "hop on or off". The red route stopped at the hotel and the blue route, only a block away. Even when not using the Hop On - Hop Off bus, the hotel is in ideal location with easy access to all parts of the city. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver. We LOVED our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Death by a thousand cuts”
Reviews.Author: stricklandia
Reviews.Content: Had the service been up to snuff, I would have rated my stay with 5 stars. Unfortunately, the staff here just couldn't get it right. I must have had 20+ interactions with the staff over little tiny mistakes and miscommunications, any one (or several) of which would have been inconsequential. But over the four days of my stay, they eventually added up to a slow "death by a thousand cuts," and ended up being the most memorable theme of our stay. I'm talking about little things -- double-charging me for use of the in-room internet; not leaving the $5 coupon they offered for declining housekeeping; not crediting my SPG account for bonus points for declining housekeeping; and many more that I've already forgotten. Again, none of which were the slightest big deal; but all of them together -- and no, I am not typically a needy guest at all -- just grew very tiresome to deal with. Many of these were miscommunications, but many of them were also overly bureaucratic processes that the management could easily streamline if they did an analysis of how they do things, and how they could make things more efficient. I assume they could capitalize on some internal expertise from Starwood for this, as I haven't experienced the same issues at other Starwood properties. (Maybe it was a Canadian thing, though; this was my first stay at a Canadian Starwood property.) Otherwise, the hotel was great -- the location downtown could hardly be better, and the views from the rooms (we were on, if I recall correctly, the 26th floor) were spectacular. Based on a review posted here, I requested a water/mountain-facing room, which was a good tip. The room itself was a bit small, but clean and nicely appointed (as are most Starwood properties, in my experience). If your needs are simple, and you don't think you'll need much from the staff, you won't go wrong here (but yes, the parking really is $40 per day).

Reviews.Title: “over priced and noisy”
Reviews.Author: norbrian
Reviews.Content: Hotel consists of two towers. We stayed in the South tower. It is right next to Burrard St., consequently there is a lot of traffic noise and there is a hospital ambulance car park right opposite, so expect siren noise throughout the night. The North tower is further from the street and may be quieter. Hotel was expensive and car parking charges are nearly forty dollars a night with taxes. Internet is also charged for at around eleven dollars a day. Room was clean and staff very friendly. But would not recommend this hotel for the price and charges. Far better deals to be had I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth $155”
Reviews.Author: jukeboxg
Reviews.Content: Got a room with two double beds, everything looks good. Just too expensive for what we got. NO FREE PARKING. Cost us $40/day to park our car. Internet is free only for 30 mins. Pool is very small considering the size of the building. On the positive note, the hotel staff was very knowledgable with regards to the restaurant around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, right in the middle of the city.”
Reviews.Author: M0rgoth
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is perfectly located, clean, modern and the staff very friendly and helpful. It helped that we had excellent weather, first time I had been to Vancouver and I would love to return. My room was small but well laid-out, very clean, with a kitchenette area that I never used. The restaurant in the North Tower makes an excellent breakfast, went elsewhere for other meals due to schedule. Side note: Ate at Cardero's on the harbor, wonderful meal. Also at Cloud 9 (rotating restaurant), the seafood chowder was excellent, but my prime rib was substandard.

Reviews.Title: “GO TO VANCOUVER! STAY IN THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: YirgacheffeP
Reviews.Content: Had the executive suite WOW what a view. That's all I can say. If you are going to go stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and views.”
Reviews.Author: sgjsn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on two occasions -first for two nights and then just for one night (after a trip to Victoria). As we were out most of the time, we only really slept in the hotel, and did not get to use the bar, business centre etc. However, we were impressed with our room, which had great views, and - unusually for North America - efficient and quiet air conditioning. The bed was large and comfy. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: FussyTraveler99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and were very impressive. Nice sized room with fabulous view of the city (we got the 29th floor). AC worked really well. Helpful staff, particularly the bellmen. Great location right in the middle of everything and restaurants and a grocery just a block away. We loved the free Wifi in the business center with over 7 huge screen computers. For the price we paid off Hotwire, terrific value and nice experience. I was more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Understaffed, overpriced extras”
Reviews.Author: kathblair
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was the location of a conference (I wasn't part of the conference; my husband and mother-in-law were). Our room wasn't ready on time and the front desk was understaffed. The room service prices were pretty steep, so I would recommend eating all meals at one of the 800 (roughly) restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Internet is pretty expensive unless you go down to the business lounge, and you have to pay for each computer you use. The location is great but there are a plethora of other hotels in the area, probably with a huge range of quality and price, so I certainly won't be at the Sheraton Wall Centre the next time I'm staying at a hotel in downtown Vancouver. Also, the restaurant wasn't really open in the south tower where we stayed -- you had to go to the cafe/bar in the north tower. The room was reasonably clean. Views were interesting but not spectacular -- our view was of the city and headed NE. We didn't take advantage of any of the other services in the hotel both due to time and not wanting to be charged an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: “Robbery at Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Robbed020810
Reviews.Content: I went to Sheraton Vancouver-Wall Centre with my wife and my 2 kids 11 and 12 years old. The second day we staid there we went on a day trip to Whistler and while we were away one of Sheratons employees has been in our room 3 times (at about 10, 11 and 15). This according there own log for the rooms. We were robbed of our childrens money, mobile, $ 1120, - and clothing in total values exceeding $ 3000, -. The hotel appears very arrogant and says they must rely on their employees. No one was follow-up from the hotel and completely dismissive attitude to the case. The hotel can not give any good explanation for why their employee hvar our rooms 3 times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but often lackadaisical staff and not enough of them. Below average - Just.”
Reviews.Author: GJNBennett
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, great location - walking distance to about everywhere, Gas Town, Shopping District, Canada Square and Stanley Park (although the latter will need comfortable shoes - its about 30 minutes away). Poor start to our stay though - my wife and I arrived and there was no valet available to park our car, so we were left to "park it" ourselves, as suggested by the bell-boy. There were also clearly not enough staff at the front-desk to cope with the number of guests, it taking approximately 30 minutes before we were told that our room wasn't yet ready. Given that it was one of the busiest weekends of the year in Vancouver (the gay pride march, the end of the firework festival and a public holiday weekend), one would have thought that the Sheraton would have made sure that there were enough faces to attend to their guests. The lobby bar staff were attentive and friendly, and some of the concierge staff were very helpful and clearly knowledgable about the local restaurants and ferry timinigs. The side was let down however, by a different concierge on the second day of our stay, who seemed more interested in flirting with a colleague than helping us. Ths pattern was mirrored by the front desk - some extremely helpful and friendly, others cold and desperate to move us along (in view of the increasing queue behind us and a lack of colleagues to assist). The business centre is shocking - slow computers and a printing service that required me to email my print-outs to the front desk (consequently further over-burdening the already stretched staff there). Parking will set you back by about C$40 a night, which in my view, should be free for guests (although I appreciate that very often, it is not). My wife visited the SPA for a "mani/pedi/wax" - which left me a further C$180 lighter - be warned - either don't bring your wife, or don't visit the SPA! I'm an SPG member and regularly stay at their portfolio of hotels. For the money spent however, on this occassion, I feel short-changed, As mentioned, this hotel has a lot going for it. Some of its staff however are discolouring its positive attributes and I'm sorry to say that on this occassion, I can only recommend this hotel on the basis that on receiving my feedback, the Sheraton will give more thought to the appointment and training of its employees.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ginger064
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton north tower for 3 nights. Checking in was a little later than should have been but it was worth the wait. The 27th floor starwood preferred guest king sized bedrooom was absolutely superb. It overlooked the front of the hotel onto the city with the mountains for backdrop. It was immaculate and everything we could have wished for. The staff were very helpful with the exception of the lady in the giftshop who was not at all friendly. Great ING supermarket just down street with superb quality fruit, salad, rolls and cakes to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the south tower...great location”
Reviews.Author: trip2323
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were given a room in the south tower. Had read the prior reviews, I was hesitant on the south tower. When we arrived in our room it had a very musty smell and in the shower there were four dark hairs in the tub. We went back to the front desk to report this and after about 5 minutes we're given a new room in the north tower. Staff was very accommodating and fixed the problem. Also gave us great travel tips. The room was clean and nice. However don't plan on using the "fridge" in the room, it just keeps things chilled not cold. So if you have perishable items I recommend bringing re-closable bags to keep everything cold with ice from the ice machine. Parking was expensive but thats expected in the downtown. One plus is if you opt out of housekeeping each day you will be given a $5 voucher for use in the hotel/Starbucks. Overall great location but I would recommend staying in the north tower. No free WiFi but you can use the internet in the business center for 30 minutes for free.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is seriously understaffed - but what do you expect for $100 nite?”
Reviews.Author: EdenTravels
Reviews.Content: Many of the reviews written already were spot on! This is a nice hotel in a good location but it is seriously understaffed and this could impact your stay. For me though, I only paid $100 night on Hotwire so I has my expectancies low... but still! The staffing issue is prevelant in most parts of the hotel. Regarding the room cleaning... one day, our room was never cleaned. We had to call at 7pm and finally they had it cleaned. No big deal really, but not what you would expect with a four star rating. They have one restaurant and it is packed and totally understaffed. They charge $30 for breakfast buffet which was mostly empty. We actually had to go get the pitched of juice ourselves and serve our drinks. We saw the poor server once and he was very nice but harried. Poor guy. It was crazy busy and you had to take what you could just to eat. The hotel didn't have a conciege. This was hard because we wanted to get maps and area info. They had a concierge desk but no one staffing it. We actually had to go behind the desk and get a map. There were other odd issues here and there with lack of staff. We had to ask 3 times for a hotel folio with menus, hotel info, spa info and we never did get one. I was looking for internet info and even though we called and even went to the front desk, we never got one sent up. Strange but goes back to staffing. The rate we paid was basically what you would get for a 2 star. So if you have the expectancy that you are getting four star service - you will be disappointed. We were in the south tower rooms which I read were not the best. The room was small but fine. It had an incredible view which we loved. The good things about the hotel was the location, the staff very nice and mini fridge in the room. Oh and the views are incredible!! The location is close to a grocery store so this is convenient. I hope this review helps you in your planning.

Reviews.Title: “better than reviews made out”
Reviews.Author: castlent
Reviews.Content: This wasn't our original choice of hotel - our booking was transfered as our original choice was closed for referbishment, this had been recommended by our agent who stayed there every year - some of the reviews for the sheraton made us slightly nervous about tfr to here but our 2nd choice had a building site next door to it. We had a lovely room in the south tower, with a view of the harbour and a balcony on the 22nd flour! We were not bothered by noise from other rooms or from the ambulance bay across the road (but 22 flours down). The reception and concerge desks were always manned in both towers when ever we passed them, even when we left at 5.30am and there were several taxis waiting in the rank so no need to book one. The staff were very helpful and friendly and chearful. There is a walkway from 2nd/3rd flour as indicated in the lift and room information pack, between south and north towers so no need to get wet if raining. restaurant no more expensive than the rest of vancouver Only a 5 min walk to restaurants and shops one way and harbour the other. The pillows were the best I have ever come across in a hotel - I have neck problem - but no problems here! Yes we will stay here again Only negative - making tea with a coffee maker really doesn't get water hot enough for a real good cupper, there was no kettle in room only coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Way below par with other 4*”
Reviews.Author: anh_toronto_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3pm after a long flight thinking we would be able to get some rest (time zone difference!) but our room wasn't ready. OK, no problem we'll go grab a bite to eat after leaving our luggages with the bellboy. We returned at 5pm and the room still wasn't ready. They gave us a different room instead. I'm a bit annoyed but since the switch was relatively fast I didn't say anything. We get in the elevator and our card keys didn't work. Back to the front desk to get "It's not the cards it's probably the elevator, try a different one". From then on we spent an enormous amount of time wait to go up since we have to avoid 1 elevator. The room was small but clean, the view beautiful. More closet space was definitely needed though, I don't know how people fit their winter jackets in there? We had to share the closet space with the ironing board, the safe, and a chest. Just not the quality you would expect from the Sheraton. The fridge hardly kept things cool and we only had water, yogurt and milk in there. Also when housekeeping arrived the next day they turned the master switch off when they left and the fridge was turned off until we got back at the end of the day! I ended up dumping an unopened 8pack yogurt and 3/4 carton of milk. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom clean. I love the location and convenience but there are other hotels around the same area so we definitely would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for one in downtown Vancouver. All in all, I think we've had better experiences at other 3*. This was definitely not 4* and definitely not worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Substandard Service”
Reviews.Author: VoxPop
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with beautiful rooms and views. However, I question how long it will stay in good shape given the problems we experienced. Although the staff we dealt with were always polite, I think the hotel itself is understaffed and, in particular, room cleaning was a problem area. We arrived on the day of a wedding we were attending. We had requested three rooms on the same floor. My parents (who arrived first) were advised by the hotel that there were three rooms reserved for us on the 26th floor. However when we arrived at 3:00, they put us on the 17th floor. When my brother and his family pulled in just behind us, they were told that they would be put on the 26th floor, but that the room wouldn't be ready until 5:00 -- not good sine the wedding was scheduled for 5:30. Ultimately, they were moved to the 8th floor. The rooms themselves were nice, well furnished and had great views. Ours was spacious enough to accommodate a crib (supplied by the hotel) for our two year old. The fridge in the room was questionable (turned to maximum it kept food cool but not cold) and the carpet felt damp in places. On our first morning, a mysterious slow drip appeared, coming from the door frame of the bathroom. Hotel maintenance staff investigated (responding promptly when we called) but were unable to identify the source. It stopped with time; I suspect it was either from an overflowing tub or toilet upstairs (yech). Issues like this make me question how well a hotel will age. Hotel cleaning staff stopped by at about 8:45 am to clean the room. Having been out late at a wedding, we asked them to come back later. They never returned. For an expensive hotel, I would have thought they would make a better effort to clean guests' rooms. Again, I think they were probably understaffed. Again, it makes me question how quickly this hotel will deteriorate. The pool and fitness room were good. In the rooms it says there is a charge for the fitness room, there was not. The fitness room staff were shaking their heads over that. Although the pool is essentially a lap pool, my children enjoyed it. It was shallow, varying from 3 1/2 to 4 1/2 feet in depth. The only real surprise in our stay came upon our departure. We were quoted a rate of $33 a day for parking -- expensive but it is downtown Vancouver. While that was the rate, with taxes, it came to $45 a day. While the taxes aren't the hotel's fault, they didn't provide a breakdown or explanation on the bill. It was only when I inquired that I learned that Vancouver charges a draconian parking tax. As a service business, it would make sense to provide either advance notice or a breakdown of the charges or both. Ultimately, I would say it was a nice place to stay. For the price, however, I think they should do better. Other hotels I have stayed at in this price range do.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay before cruise”
Reviews.Author: serca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night in early July 2010, prior to boarding our cruiseship. We had a nice room in the North Tower with a bit of a view of the ocean and mountains. Room was spacious and very comfortable. Got a good deal on Priceline, so the quality/price ratio was pretty good. For breakfast we found a nice little diner on Davie Street, just around the corner. Location was great, easy to walk and to get around with public buses. The taxi to the check-in for the cruiseship was only 8CanS.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: cvalen7024
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from staff at Reception and Concierge. Stayed for 5 nights in a clean, comfortable and spacious room with the option to opt out of housekeeping for a $5 voucher towards Starbucks or other in-house restuarant. Fortunately, we surrendered the car to the rental company on arrival in Vancouver as the cost to park is prohibitive. Hotel is in an excellent location for Canada Place to Robson Street to China Town with bus and taxis all close at hand and a 7/11 round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a couple of drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: geetabix
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in January, just before the Olympics. There were some great things about this hotel: SPECTACULAR view. Very convenient location. Incredibly efficient and welcoming check-in staff (also very helpful when it came to giving directions, and storing our luggage after checkout). What I didn't like: on a high floor, in a storm, it sounds like the hotel is going to fall apart. Yes, you've got a great view, but the windows are rattling. That kept me up all of one night. The fitness centre was also understaffed. And, as someone else pointed out, it was all a bit "IKEA." Generally, it was a nice comfortable home base as you could take the subway to the airport, get anywhere downtown. It had a fridge and microwave, and grocery store across the street if you wanted to eat in and just relax looking out at the wintery view.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: ridersfan23
Reviews.Content: I use to stay at this hotel or pacific palisades (before it closed) in 2003 & 2004 about once a month for business and I at least get back to Vancouver once every 3 months since then. This hotel has really gone down hill as far as a Sheraton is concerned. Had trouble checking in even though we called to make sure my name was on the reservation as we used SPG points to book...what a disaster! This hotel claims the system charges your credit card but I've stayed at other sheratons where they only take about $100-300 usually per night. Be prepared for them to hold up about $700+ all for 3 nights even though one of the nights was already PRE-PAID for with points!!!! And they are weird amounts too my credit card company was even taken back a little...I understand having to pre-charge for incidentals but to take over $700 in incidentals for 3 nights? Unreal. Staff was not friendly, you can tell the rooms are getting out-dated. Only real bright side is the Pool/Work out area. Don't bother being "green" the $5 card for not having your room cleaned wont even work in the starbucks in the hotel. Fantastic! Why did I bother? Club lounge was nothing special, the business centre in the club lounge is a laughing joke, and the other one was under renos so I couldn't see it. Just bad...from all my trips. Will be trying Westin Grand now hoping for a way better experience! Real shame its a nice property....

Reviews.Title: “A nice room and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: happycamper1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Wall for one night in June. We booked our room through Priceline $100 so I was leary about the room we would be given. When we checked in at 10:30 am we were told that our room (on the 5th floor) wasn't ready and that we couldn't change to an available room as they are all "pre-assigned". We left our luggage with the bell hop and left to explore Vancouver. We returned to the hotel at 4pm and asked for our room. We were given a room on the 14th floor (so much for the "pre-assigned" comment from the morning front desk clerk) in the south tower. The bell hop who brought our bags to our room was very helpful. He phoned his friend to find out the name of a good mexican restaurant for us to eat at. There are two towers of available rooms. The north tower houses the main lobby, restaurant and has a grander feeling then the south tower. We chose to walk across the outside drive to the south tower( 1 minute walk) but if it was raining we could have taken the inside walkway. The south tower has a small lobby and concierge desk. Elevators require room cards to activate. Our room was very nice. It had two queen beds with quality bedding. There was internet available in the room and monitors + were also available on the third floor. Coffee in the room was Starbucks. The bathroom had been renovated with new granite counters and tile floors. The baseboards ( painted poorly)was the only cosmetic fault I could see. The room was quiet through the night but once the city woke up we could here the traffic on the street below - lots of ambulance sirens. The housekeeping room was right across from us so we heard the banging of the cart quite early as the staff started cleaning the empty rooms (about 8:30 am). Check out was smooth, done through the room TV. There was no opportunity for a late check out as the hotel was "booked solid". As a final note, we walked with our baggage from Canada Place to the Sheraton after disembarking from a cruise. This turned out to be quite a haul as it was up hill all the way. I would not want to do that again! As for being in a good location, we found the Sheraton to be very close to many shopping areas. It was close to downtown and was on a major bus line.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Service, Mediocre Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: bcislandmum
Reviews.Content: I stayed here along with my husband and son for one night last August. I was impressed by the location and the service we were provided by the bell and valet parking staff, but not so impressed by the quality and condition of the room. For $279 per night, I felt that the furniture and carpets could have been in better shape. The shower/bath area was worn down as well. That being said, the room was clean and the view of the city was spectacular! In my opinion, the price was way too high for the product. Parking was expensive and there was an extra charge for wireless service.

Reviews.Title: “No way this is 4*”
Reviews.Author: austintravel66
Reviews.Content: Not sure how this got rated as four star. The room is small and old. The service is lousy. There is North Tower and South Tower. The South tower lobby is small but the North tower is much bigger. Our room is in the South tower so I can only comment on that room..

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: Grums
Reviews.Content: My 29 year old daughter and I stayed a Saturday night to attend the youngest daughter's bridal shower. As the two of us were coming in early from Calgary I called to get as early check in as I could as we 3 were headed to the hotel spa. When we arrived we were greeted by 3 very nice front desk staff who pass on discount card while one checked for a suitable room. We were in by 12:30 at to the spa by 1:30. The room was on the 8th floor, smaller than most but had 2 double beds, floor to ceiling windows, small bath room but a bar in the bedroom area with a very large mirror. Starbucks coffee and a fridge. The room was clean and the beds delightful. All he staff were great even waving at us from the front desk as we were in and out to the spa then to dinner and back again. Great stay. Beautiful hotel, wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel - GREAT Staff”
Reviews.Author: SomeDudeinTexas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good, but what really set this hotel apart from others was the friendliness of the staff. I am not a very patient person and ususally will nit-pick at what I consider to be a lack of service, but there was absolutely nothing that I coula complian about at this hotel. The fron desk, the concierge, the club lounge attendants....you anme it, they were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very centrally located, walking distance to many of the tourist attractions around town. I would not hesitate to stay here in future visits. Below are some tips that will hopefully be of help if you decide to stay at the hotel: View: Ask for a room with a view of the ocean and / or mountains. When we got there they had us in a city view room. With all of the high rise towerrs near the hotel on the city side, I can't imagine there is much of a view in those rooms. Casino coupon books: We asked the concierge how to get to the casino and he proceeded to also give us coupon booklets for the casino. They're not anything that great, but each book has a $5 match bet for blackjack and a $5 free play for slots. On the latter coupon they actually give yoy $5 for you to use as you wish....not necessarily for slots. I;m sure the concierge has promotional tools for other attractions as well...we just didn't ask. Super secret tip of the day: Our room was next to the club lounge, which has free Wi-Fi. We were so close we actually got a free signal in our room. Beats paying $12 - $18 per day. If you're interested, it was South Tower Room 2503.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to be nickle & dimed to death.”
Reviews.Author: rennyn
Reviews.Content: Full price rate of the room? Nearly $300CDN Price of Internet access (per day)? $11-20 depending on speed, the $11 option is hardly usable Price of a bottle of water? $4.50 Price for SELF-PARKING per day? $38 after taxes. Add another $30 or so for Valet. I'll admit I haven't stayed in many Vancouver hotels, but I've only seen nickel and diming like this in the most touristy of areas (and even prime beachfront tourist traps on the Waikiki beach charge less). That said, we booked our room in advance through a travel website and were not given the option of choosing the type of room we wanted and ended up in a Double room with two small beds... for our romantic getaway option. Before we settled in, I politely went down to the front desk and asked if they had any rooms with a single King bed available. They couldn't answer, of course, until they looked up our room and our rate code, at which point they informed us that they did not. The manner they went about it was polite, but also quite obvious that the fact that we didn't pay full price played a role in the 'availability' of a suitable room. So we were left to either sleep separately, or share a tiny bed together in our room. The TV system is horrible. The TVs are decent flat panel televisions, but connected via an ancient analog hotel system. It has a basic menu system from the Hotel that allows you to view your bill, order some newer movies to watch (for $15 each), etc. At one point, our TV went unresponsive after sitting at the hotel menu for a while and when we went to change the channel we couldn't. So we called the front desk to ask about it and were told that there were some 'upgrades' being done that were causing this and to try again later. Odd. Well, to make the story short, we did some playing around and testing, and as far as we can tell, the hotel terminal system has some sort of timeout/screen saver, and if you sit at any of the official hotel menu screens it will eventually time out and go black and there is no way to get it back without turning off the TV for a while to let it reset. There were no upgrades happening and nothing changed after these 'upgrades' completed that evening. The front desk clerk basically lied because they knew their TV system was junk. Aside from that, the hotel staff was polite at least, and the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spacious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: NinaKrohn
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 10-month old daughter and I stayed at the Sheraton Wallcenter for 5 nights in May 2010. Our room was at the North Tower, on the 22nd floor with a really great view and a lot of space. Prior to our arrival, we booked a baby crib for our daughter and got the written confirmation about it. When we checked in, we were even told that a baby crib was built up in the room. But when we entered the room, there was no crib. It wasn't too bad, since we spontaniously brought our own travel crib, but the organisation just wasn't okay. When we entered our room, there was a notice on the table, that all the pool and sauna facilities were closed due to renovation. The reception didn't inform us while checking in. We would have been able to use the facilities at another hotel, but since it was about 3 blocks away, it seemed a bit too inconvenient with a baby. Prior to arrival we were promised a quiet room, on a higher floor and away from the elevators, because of the baby. We got that, but unfortunately the maid supply room was just across the hall and the door was banged from early in the morning till late in the evening, paired with garbage bag noise... The rest of our stay was just great. Our daughter loved the view from the windows that go right down to the floor. The staff was always helpful, and when the coffeemaker just didn't work anymore, it didn't take long until we had a new one. There is also a good Spa on the property. I had a Aroma Therapy massage, and I absolutely loved it! There are a lot of good dining and shopping possibilities in walking distance from the hotel. It is right in the centre, were you want to be! If we come back to Vancouver, and we definately will, then we will book a room at the Sheraton Wallcenter again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, excellent location and rooms with fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: JanLin
Reviews.Content: Arrived from cruise ship very early not expecting to be able to get into rooms but were offerd a room immediately by a very friendly efficient receptionist. The corner rooms on the 22nd floor had amazing views. Beds and pillow extremely comfortable and rooms spotless. Traffic seems to keep going nonstop in Vancouver so had to sleep with window closed. Vancouver is beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: bludtek
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Sheraton Wall Centre. I was in Vancouver for a conference. I arrived around noon and my room was ready. Check in was quick and hassle free. The room was clean, modern and comfortable. I really like the small fridge in the rooms. During both of my visits here the staff were excellent. The bell staff are quick and courteous. Late Saturday afternoon I was waiting in line for the concierge behind a couple who had unrealistic expectations of getting dinner reservations that night at one of the more popular waterfront restaurants. Unable to accommodate, the concierge tried his best phoning around to other establishments and suggesting alternatives. Seeing how this concierge dealt with these difficult people says a lot about his professionalism. I was impressed. I like the area of this hotel – walking distance to English Bay, Robson St, the waterfront, and lots of restaurants and pubs nearby. I took the Canada line from the airport, and it was about a 10 – 15 minute walk from the downtown station. This is a great hotel and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I stay here 2-3 times a year it never changes...”
Reviews.Author: sirdaav
Reviews.Content: Much as I love Vancouver, an old home, its hotel industry goes from gouging to disgusting. It was once renowned as the only North American city with 4 true 5 star hotels. The Sheraton fits into none of these, as many say it's bland. The North tower is new and contemporary, although odd bits like carpet are wearing down, the south tower has been out of date for ever. I stayed three months almost non stop at this hotel and the service was in the main, lousy. Still is. I was once in a south tower "club" room, frankly the north tower was still better. It had cracked coffee carafe, noisy plumbing, stains everywhere, the usual bath drains badly (always a problem here) etc etc. No one issue is a deal breaker, apart from, maybe, the rotten staff. The hotel gets a lot of tour buses through large Asian tour operators, and I feel much of their interest lies there. I stayed there last in August it was red hot, tropical for Vancouver, many things on there so many hotels were full. I could still get a room here without paying inflated "city is full" rates. Sheraton Platinum card holders - in 3 months of going there I never saw an upgraded room, never mind the best room in the house promise. If that's important, you may well be out of luck here. The staff at the front desk often sneer and laugh at the previous person just walking away. They also like to turn around and face the wall to snicker about people on the phone. If they do it to you call them on it - if I see them doing it to others I call them on it. They should really have other jobs... Nicest person there was one particular valet/bellman. We tipped him $20 all the time for being the only one not drawn into the misery of the other staff... and one older room maid with a German accent who was just lovely. I do keep going back - as I can get a good deal at this place and sometimes get in when others are full. So you can tell the better rate and location - these balance out what I know to expect. I always get the North Tower, even though there is no true "Club" rooms over there, the corner rooms are perhaps the best in the North side. If you're having a wedding or joining a cruise of a lifetime - don't stay here. If you get one snarky staff member or surly service, it will just detract from your day. The Hotel Vancouver has awesome staff, as does the Fairmont Waterfront, the Marriott Pinnacle is good, rates are stupid (but as low as $55 US in the off season on priceline.) The beds are nice, the rooms are generally quiet - street noise is blocked but hallways often noisy... Other than that great location, it's easy for much of "tourist" Vancouver - shops and restaurants always close by. If you can get a deal (140 Cdn or less before tax) it's probably worth it. There are plenty other hotels in the same category, but their rates are nuts. The other bonus for this place is that it's handy for Yaletown as well as the shopping district and one of my favourite sushi places is 5 mins walk. I am going here again this summer, I doubt it will ever change.... Just be aware what you are booking so you don't get surprises. Getting snarky staff you can pretty much expect on check in - it's the tradition here! The recommend to a friend vote depends on rate... Yes if rate is low, definitely not if the want high!

Reviews.Title: “very very nice”
Reviews.Author: ToAFarOffLand
Reviews.Content: First off, the location cannot be beat! steps to Robson/granville, Less than 5 minute walk to train station, The train goes straight from the airport to Vancouver city centre in 25 min. Being that this hotel is right smack downtown, it's right in the middle of one of the most walkable cities in North America. Walk to Davie st, walk to English bay, walk to coal harbour, walk to gastown, walk to chinatown. (whew!) We scored a 19th floor room with an absolutely amazing view of downtown Vancouver, the mountains and the water. The floor to ceiling windows are stunning, and everything else is simply wonderful. We had perfect sleeps both nights on one of the most comfortable beds ever.. The only gripes I had were: Th key cards are needed to activate the elevator. Both of our cards stopped working, so we needed to to the front desk to fix them. That leads me to my second gripe: There needs to be more than one person at the front desk! It took us 10 minutes of waiting, just to fix the cards. This is a hotel with 30 + floors, 10-15 rooms/floor, so at least 450 rooms. Having at least two people at all times should be mandatory. Check in/check out was so nauseating, having to wait in line for 25 min during check in (due to only 1 person being there.) Overall, this hotel is great. Would I go back? Probably not, just because there are so many amazing hotels in Vancouver. This city is truly world class, and there are so many 4-5 star properties to try out. It's definitely in my top 3 though!

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly bland, but still nice”
Reviews.Author: Nina J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in December of 2007 as we had a Christmas function in downtown Vancouver, and we wanted to stay someplace we hadn't stayed that was 'nice'. Given that it was fairly new, we thought it would be pretty nice. My first impression was that it felt like an office building, and walking to the front desk felt like walking into the lobby of an office building. It didn't feel like a hotel at all, but for the valet parking. Even more suprisingly, it was filled with kids....not something you'd expect in a nicer downtown hotel. Reception explained that there was some sort of function going on and that our room had accidentally been given over to the group, so we were sent to the other tower and a room upgrade - good start! Our room was on the 25th floor and therefore had an amazing view of dowtown. The furniture looked a little dated for the hotel's age though. The bathroom was very nice, similar quality to the Four Seasons where I stay a lot. Our bedroom was a small separate room that was filled almost entirely by the king sized bed, but it was very very comfortable and the one wall was floor to ceiling windows with a great view to wake up to in the morning. Our room upgrade included free breakfast, buffet style in a nice private area/room (hard to describe) that had two floors, more great views, and decent food and coffee. There were tvs and couches in there, it was like a private lounge, very nice. Location wasn't bad, have to walk a few blocks to get to the major points of interest, but still fairly central. I'm still little suprised about the blandness of the decor on the whole, but we had a comfortable stay our needs were met. I'd stay again, but for the price I'd rather go to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are very plain, certainly not...”
Reviews.Author: drgmobile
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very plain, certainly not up to the price. Restaurant is very small with lineups for breakfast. Not great menu choices either, and the breakfast buffet is grossly overpriced

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Hambug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two boys during the Olympics. Our room was in the north tower which I think is much nicer/newer than the other side - literally two separate structures. Our room was large, stocked with plenty of products, had a great view, and we never heard a peep from neighboring rooms. It was outrageously priced, but that's probably not the hotel's fault - the Olympics ticket broker set the rates. Beds were comfortable, water pressure in the shower was good, the free breakfast was plentiful and good, and the boys loved the pool. Within walking distance to Robson Square, BC Place, and other spots. But cabs are also reasonably priced and the cab drivers we had were all friendly. Canada is just a friendlier place than the US, I think!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: JoeandMichelle
Reviews.Content: We travelled for a business conference and were thrilled with the location. Very close to Robson and Granville Sts, museams and great restaurants-everything was well within walking distance.
