Magnificant views from the rooms which were quite comfortable with their signature 'heavenly bed'. Service was excellent would definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Was not impressed for a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shaynelle
Reviews.Content: We booked through priceline.com, so this may be why we had one of the less-nicer rooms. The views were spectacular, the beds were amazingly comfortable and the rooms were fairly clean, but in obvious need of updating and repair. The grout on the bathroom tiles for instance was black in some areas and missing in some areas. It may be that we normally stay at B&B's, but I found myself really turned off by the nickel and diming of customers for things like local phone calls ($1.60 each up to 20 minutes) and a daily fee for in-room internet connections. The location of this hotel is excellent, you can easily walk to many restaurants along Davie or shopping along Robson and many other streets close by. The fitness centre is well equipped and fairly nice, as is the pool. Overall, I would say if your company is paying, this hotel is decent. If you're putting out your own money however I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Sunbound
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is in a great location and priced right! The room was extremely quiet which is a huge plus and the club lounge was very spacious and clean. I will not complain about the long hike to the fitness area since this served as a good warm-up walk...the nice steam room made up for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very big, food is pricey tho.............”
Reviews.Author: scott_cop
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 2162 for 5 nights 12-17th January 2010. The hotel is very central to downtown so everthing is right there which is handy. It looks impressive from the outside but it is huge, therefore I feel although you got a professional and courteous service you lose the personal touch of a smaller establishment. The room was nice enough, I E-mailed ahead after reading reviews on here and requested a high floored room (for a better view) in the North tower. (there are North and South towers, the North is newer and the rooms are more modern and nice). I got a response an hour later to confirm this was all sorted, which was impressive. If you don't already have a SPG (starwood preferred group) card to collect points on then you can ask for one for free at the desk. This entitles you to discounted rooms at numerous hotel chains, or room upgrades etc. If you choose to not have your room cleaned then you get a bonus of 500 points per time. As I was there for an operation and therefore stuck in the room alot I didn't really want people in and out cleaning the room. So, I did it myself most of the time and got the points credited at the end of the stay!! The room itself was nice. I was in a standard King room. It depends what kind of budget you are on and what type of room you are after but they offer quite a range. Obviously there will be different prices for the better rooms. Oh, there is a starbucks on the lower ground floor open from 0530 hours!! (you won't be devoid of Starbucks' though, there is one on every street, i'm not joking!!). The bed was very comfortable and the mattress was nice and soft. There was a flat screen TV in the rooms but be careful not to order a film by accident on the remote control as once you switch the TV on it opens up on the film ordering screen! The bathroom was adequately sized with marble work surfaces, it was nice. The cost of the room service menu was very high and the breakfast costs for the buffet were quite high also, therefore i didn't utilise this service. There are many local restaurants/cafes in the immediate vicinity though so you won't go hungry. There is also a cinema and the Davie village just a short walk away. There are reviews on here that I read before my stay about the noise from the street and the hospital that was opposite. I have to say that although i was on the 21st floor there was a fair bit of noise from outside and other rooms, the walls are very thin and you can hear quite a lot of stomping about from upstairs so hopefully you will have quieter neighbours than i did!! You will hear a lot of ambulance and police sirens from the opposite hospital.............but i guess if you book opposite a hospital then thats to be expected??!!!?!! All in all I would return here if I went back to Vancouver, but I might try somewhere else next time as there are so many hotels locally and most would probably be a lot cheaper..................... Oh, one more thing.....there is internet in the rooms but its not free you have to pay and its about $10 per day via a wire thats in the room. You can use the internet for free in the lounge which is situated in the corridor between the North and South towers but its only free for 30 minutes. If you log on via your own laptop then you can log on for up to 2 hours for free. I think with the price of the rooms for this hotel they should supply free wi-fi in the rooms. Most of the other much cheaper hotels in Vancouver offer this free in room service, that was my main gripe.........

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to my next visit”
Reviews.Author: Travellinggirl2010
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times before and my reaction is the same - awesome!! Great location, friendly and efficient staff, very clean hotel with updated decor. Feels more like a boutique hotel than a large chain. Premium Sheraton members get the choice of three club lounges, 2 for beverages and snacks, and an extra 1 for business services. This hotel caters for business and leisure travellers. It's located right downtown Vancouver and everything is within easy reach by walking or taxi (which are readily available outside the hotel). There is also a very nice spa for massage and beauty treatments.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bus Noise”
Reviews.Author: Retailwonderer
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, friendly service, nice bar & restaurant. Wonderful location, good size (and funny shaped) rooms. But if you get a room facing Burrard Street, especially on the lower floors, you will hear buses all day and most of the night. When I returned for a second stay I asked for and received a room on the other side and it was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: biotribe
Reviews.Content: Central to all things Vancouver. Request a high floor room view (NW corner of the West Tower). Beds were ok, nice bathroom, view was incredible. Super efficient and corporate staff. Very on point the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “awesome times”
Reviews.Author: AshleighM
Reviews.Content: it was awesome its was a 5 star hotel there was always sumone willing to help you with ur luggage and stuff and it was close to every main place in vancouver

Reviews.Title: “No problems with my stay but it could have been better”
Reviews.Author: mrjanto
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a good place to stay. We stayed in the tower where they did not staff the front desk. That's not really a problem, but I do like the convenience of stopping by there on my way in if there's something I need. We also were not told about the free wifi. I don't know if that was available when we stayed there. I was disappointed by our view. I asked for a room with a view, and the front desk said they'd give us one. I wasn't too impressed, but maybe I don't how bad it could have been. I would have preferred it if they had told us that there were none available.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: VikiB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the CST conference. Have stayed in a number of hotels in Vancouver and I think this is the nicest so far, although I haven't stayed at the Fairmont and they tend to be fantastic. I stayed in the North Tower, on the 20th floor with views of the mountains and the sea. The room was not huge but well laid out, and the bed extremely comfortable. A safe is an extra I appreciated, and the fast internet (the basic package at $10:95 for 24 hours) was good for work. Only problem was the lack of a proper chair at the desk, only a chair with 4 legs, and rather uncomfortable. The conference food was above average (it also wasn't chicken everyday). I had breakfast in the restaurant on the Sunday, and the continental brunch was good, though not cheap. There is an off licence (liquor store) in the other tower, and prices seem reasonable. I went to the small supermarket opposite and got some real milk for my coffee, and it was nice to have a small fridge to put it in. I swam every morning, the pool is OK for lengths, and there is a sauna and a good sized gym which appeared well equipped; all seemed well used by members as well as guests. The staff I encountered seemed polite and helpful. There were plenty of lifts so you never had to wait too long. The new train from the airport ($3.75 weekdays and $2.50 at weekends) is fantastic. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the nearest station, past Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Feregamo, very dangerous location I would say, too many temptations!! There was a range of conference rooms, rather dated decor, and sound engineers were rather absent to resolve issues, but perfectly adequate for our conference.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good except the bathrooms smells.”
Reviews.Author: victorsh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice in one week with my girlfriend. The location is excellent. The room had a sink, fridge and microwave and cooktop. So if need to do some quick fixing for food, it is quite nice. That said, the bathrooms smelled bad. In one room, I felt like I was in a public bathroom. They need to fix this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Night of luxury”
Reviews.Author: hertshezbulla
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night.Got an excellent rate on a corner room high up in the north tower. Very comfortable bead the room was lovely. Service excellent.Valet parking$20 a day. Cant wait to return,loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LilsfromCanada
Reviews.Content: wow! I can't believe some of these reviews! I was at the hotel for We day, and it was amazing! We got to the hotel about 4 hours earlier than we were supposed to get there, and when we checked it our room (no big surprise) wasn't ready yet! The kind man at the front desk told that he would get the cleaners to clean the room asap, to leave our baggage in this storage closet and come back in about an hour. When we got back, the room was ready! We stayed in a Junior Suite, and I have to say I was very impressed. Two HUGE beds in different rooms, and on-suite bathroom with bath/shower, minibar, complementary water bottles, and on the second floor of the north tower, there is free wifi internet and about 6 computers you can use for 2 hours per day without paying the extra cost of wifi for the room. I have no complaints at all about this hotel! It was really really great! Thanks so much Sheraton Vancity!

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: agtspooky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wall Centre for a week and would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. We were on the 27th floor and the view of Vancouver was amazing. The hotel is centrally located in the city and wherever we couldn't walk to we took their very easy to use public transportation system. Our room was very clean and always well stocked with towels, etc. My only grip is that for a hotel like the Sheraton they do not offer free high speed internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time with family!”
Reviews.Author: dhemmah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with our two year old stayed at the Sheraton Vancouver Wall Center from 9/18/09 through 9/21/09. The location is walking distance to everything. We walked with our daughter in a stroller to Robson Street for high end shopping, to Canada Place, to the Gaslamp District, to Chinatown, to the Science World, down the Marina area, and then back to the hotel. There is a Seven Eleven a block away where you can get snacks and drinks, and there are little restaurants in walking distance if you do not want to eat in the Hotel restaurant. Through floor to ceiling window, our room had a breathtaking view of downtown Vancouver and the Pacific Ocean. There was a separate sitting area with a couch, desk, and a wet bar, which included a little refrigerator. The refrigerator came in very handy for my daughter's milk and juice. The bed was comfortable and there was plenty of storage. The bathroom was spacious and beautiful with granite countertop and nice bath and body products. The staff was friendly and readily available. Check in and check out was quick and easy. We would definitely stay at the Sheraton Wall Center when returning to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: rpnan
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Sheraton Vancouver-Wall Centre. Our room in the North Tower was very comfortable with a wonderful wall that was all glass providing fascinating views day and night. After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, I chose a room in the newer North Tower. I was very happy that I did, because the South Tower was much less attractive. I didn't see any of the rooms in the South Tower, but the lobby and business center were a little shabby. The location is great - walking distance to shopping and restaurants. The Hop On/Hop Off bus stops right across the street, and the Hop On/Hop Off Trolley stops right in front of the hotel. Very convenient! We used the bus, but next time I would select the trolley, because the bus has one long all-encompassing route while the trolley has divided the same area into two routes, making it easier to go directly to areas that you haven't seen without having to pass through the areas that you had already visited.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BCHappyGal
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel while attending a conference. We booked "Club Level" 9 months in advance and were placed on the floor below the designated Club Level. As we are 2 Ladies travelling alone we book "Club Level" mainly for the security by being placed on the lower floor we did not benefit from the key coded elevator security. Our room was missing amenites such as shower caps - Q-tips - robes etc that I take for granted when paying for "Club Level". Further the staff neglected to clean under the bed (someone elses dirty socks were still there). The washrooms on the convention levels were neither cleaned nor restocked with paper towels during our events. Would neither recommend nor ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but would try someplace else next time”
Reviews.Author: Mid_30s_Couple
Reviews.Content: Location was good. View was nice. Room was mediocre at best. Bathtub had black mold growing at many of the grout lines--was nervous to put my washcloth down anywhere. The room just didn't feel very clean. For the price, we really felt we could have done better. Dissappointed and wouln't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a nice location”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotiaSeaport
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel located conveniently near downtown shopping, reasonable walk to skytrain and sightseeing adventures. very clean. we stayed in north tower on 22nd floor so had a fabulous view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Halifax_Lass83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Location was perfect, in the heart of the downtown. It was close to some fabulous dining places, tourist spots and shopping. There is also a great movie theatre a short 5 minute walk down Burrard St. The rooms were clean and well made up. Staff were helpful and professional. We had to ask for a kettle as there was not one in the room. It was sent up shortly afterwards, with a followup call from guest services to ensure it had been delivered. Great service! The only downside to the room was a noisy air con unit. However, this could be easily turned off. Complimentry internet access at the computers on the 3rd floor of the South tower proved very useful. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We were sorely disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Jpius
Reviews.Content: Having travelled across B.C. and stayed in various accomodations we decided to treat ourselves for two nights and go for the Sheraton experience which included the highest cost for shelter during our two week vacation. The underground parking was somewhat of a mystery as there were two P1's, one under the North Tower and one under the Pavillion. While we figured it out for ourselves, the guy on the front desk didn't seem to know that there were two P1's (separated by P2) He could only state that it was confusing and that maybe we were pushing the wrong button. We had to exit the parking garage and walk into the lobby of the North Tower with our luggage. It would have been so easy and economical for the front desk to have a map of the garage available. Whereas we decided to use the Trolley system to tour around Vancouver City and Stanley park we asked the lady on the lobby desk where to catch it. She directed us across the street to Century Plaza. As we were talking to the Doorman there, he turned us around in time for us to see the trolley passing on the other side(the Sheraton side) of the street. We then had to wait in the bus shelter in front of the South Sheraton tower and were shortly joined by a crackhead for the next 15 minutes. The toilet ran water almost continuously after our first flush for the next 48 hours. The exhaust fan did not work in the bathroom. The quartz light fixture over the coffee counter was falling out of it's ceiling. The TV would not work from the bed. (you had to get with 8 feet of the TV). My wife called down for two wine glasses. An hour later, whereas the wine glasses had not arrived, she called the second time to cancel them. 15 minutes later, we were both napping as a knock came on the door. The two wine glasses had arrived. We reported all the maintenance issues on the first afternoon we were there. When we left 48 hrs later, the light fixture had been pushed back up but that's it. Upon complaining for the second time about these issues, we were told that these things happen. I find it hard to believe that all these things happened the day we got there. The front desk had offered to to give us another room but we declined as we had no guarantee that the next room would be any better and we were tired of moving our luggage. We were offered free breakfast which we took and I asked for free parking which we were given. It was still not worth the money we paid for the two nights. In the South Tower, the lobby ceiling plaster is deteriorating and the granite floor has a large crack in it. The management company really needs to provide more money for their maintenance budget if they plan to keep selling the Sheraton name. The Accent Inn in Kamloops was a far better experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Best !”
Reviews.Author: samantha1313
Reviews.Content: I`ve arrived to the hotel quite early,at 11am,and even though check-in time is from 3pm,the lovely lady at the reception put me in the room immediately. I was staying in the North Tower in a king room on the 8th floor.The room was clean and I loved the layout.I`ve been staying in quite a few hotels worldwide,but never ever slept in such a comfortable bed before.I wish I could`ve taken it home ! Everything worked perfectly,and the cleaning lady kept my room spotless throughout my whole stay. Oh and the Starbucks coffee filter that came with the coffee machine was brilliant. I didn`t experience anything negative during my stay. Thank you,Sheraton !

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: evilbee11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to go to a concert at the Commodore Ballroom. It was conveniently within walking distance of the venue, and of Robson for fun crepe breakfasts. The hotel was clean, service was great, room was large. The bed was on the firmer side, but I'm used to latex foam so I'm picky. I think we were put on a floor that used to be smoking, so the smell would hit me whenever we walked in the room. But otherwise, it was a good value because we pre-booked on the hotel's website (pre-paid) and got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great, central & spacious!”
Reviews.Author: liliput1960
Reviews.Content: It was great accommondation for a family with 2 teenagers. The family room had a bedroom with a massive bed plus the other room had 2 double beds which gave us all space after travelling across Canada and sharing many rooms. It was very central and very relaxing. *****

Reviews.Title: “Dishonesty and Security at its worst.”
Reviews.Author: Shazaal
Reviews.Content: Well, basically my friend and I were attending an event which was being held at the Hotel. Like most large events we had reserved a room 3 Months Prior to our stay with the event code for "cheaper rooms". We arrived late due to unforseen travel issues and had called the hotel at check in time to confirm that we would be arriving late. Honestly, we had a great first impression, with the courteous valet service and the friendly staff which were outside. Upon check-in we were notified that our room was not available. Seriously, 3 Month reservation and we got a not available. We were asked to downgrade to a King Size bed from a 2 Double room. OK I understand , no big deal! Upon this we were sent to the 35th floor of the South Tower. We were originally booked for North and this was a dissapointment for us considering the event was being held all in the North Tower. However, the receptionists had really hyped up the room by saying it was on Club Level, and the fancy rooms were located there. So we would try it out. Up the elevator 35 floors and immediately we were submerged into a stench of banquet food. Upon entering the room you could hear the sounds of a banquet in progress. We had a door , which was unopenable and you could hear the banquet on the other side. We took the elevator back down and immediately asked for a different room... anywhere. However, they said this was impossible and that the banquet would be ending soon. Around 12 Midnight, we had a patron from the banquet ENTER the room! We went down to front desk and immediately complained. The gentleman said he would send security to look into it. At 4 AM we had yet another Patron enter the room at which point we called and demanded security and the guard came up and locked the "secret door" on the other side. Overall, very terrible for it's name and prestige. Was very dissapointed and surprised that we werent offered any compensation for our horrible night. Not to mention, there is no real amenities available. No vending machines, a horribly overpriced restaurant, a bar that closes extremely early and no free internet service. We did however get extremely good service from the Valet service and the Bellboys.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room with fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: traveldreamsII
Reviews.Content: Location is great for walking to almost everything, we only took a cab once to Stanley Park to go bicycling. Short walk to Yaletown's great restaurants and shops and not much further to Pacific Place and Robson Street. Vancouver is a great town to discover by walking. We stumbled into an Islamic celebration by the Vancouver Art Gallery and a night market in Chinatown without knowing anything about them. The hotel rooms are pretty new, we were in the north tower, comfortable beds and very nice clean bathroom. We were on the 27th floor and the windows are floor to ceiling, which really enhances the view! Overall great experience, although the front desk and bartender in the lobby bar could use lessons in smiling and being just a little more friendly. I would go back again, especially with the great deal we got on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: aaa77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights. When we arrived the room was muggy and warm, and we realized that airco didn't function properly. After the technician did not seem to be able to fix it, we asked for a different room. We received an upgrade to a wonderful one bedroom suite on the 31st. Very good service,

Reviews.Title: “Brutal!!”
Reviews.Author: sharknes
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at 20 or so hotels in Vancouver and this is the only one I will never stay at again. It looks nice on the outside but the rooms are mid eighties, the internet jack was broken off, the AC humms so loud it wakes you up at night and the elevators are always so slow and packed its worse than the Marriot Marquis elevators in NYC. On check out we gave them our bags to store for an hour so they put them on a cart and left them in the middle of the lobby so anyone could just grab them and leave with them. After watching this for 10 minutes we asked the guy to put them away so he put them behind the desk for 2 minutes them shifted them back to the mid lobby again. Total disrespect for someones belongings, AVOID this hotel, it has way too many people for the infrastructure and there are so many other better hotels in Van

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: Cartervan
Reviews.Content: Average hotel Rooms were clean, but boring..could have been staying anywhere Service was non-existant..but its a business hotel..with over 700 rooms I wouldn't recommend, or repeat Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Geoff & Barbara
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in a large room on the 23rd floor of the South Tower. Of the three full days we spent in Vancouver, one was glorious tourist weather (we spent it wandering around Stanley Park) but the other two were mostly wet. Although museums and shopping kept us occupied and relatively dry we were still grateful for all the space and facilities inside the hotel, which we had great fun finding our way around. In particular we enjoyed (1) the free PC internet access set out along the wide corridor connecting the two towers (Apart from a half hour time limit for any one session, we didn’t experience any constraints and seldom found all the terminals occupied by other guests.) and (2) the bar in the North Tower, which served wine by the glass, had a relaxing atmosphere, comfortable seats, friendly staff and always provided a free bowl of nibbles. We didn’t use the pool, which sounded noisy and crowded each time we walked past outside. We had a reasonably quick and painless mid-afternoon check-in experience, courteous but impersonal. Our room was roughly triangular in shape with reasonable décor, plenty of hanging space, hangers, drawers and desktop space. The best part was that the longest side of the triangle was a wall to ceiling window with a great view over the city and the sea. The bathroom was very small but clean, well decorated and had reasonable flat surface space. We avoided the hotel eateries after looking at the menu selections and prices. For breakfast we used the Starbucks outlet on the lower lobby level of the North Tower. For evening meals there are several good dining experiences to be had within ten minutes walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, overpriced and poor quality food.”
Reviews.Author: Seattlego1
Reviews.Content: While the building, particularly the North Tower, are relatively new and therefore still fairly clean, the service in this hotel is sub-par. We had to wait four hours for our room, despite checking in at 2pm and, despite multiple phone calls to the hotel, no updates were provided at any time. We finally got our room at 6pm after 'camping out' at the reception desk. Pool is small and crowded, health club staff seemed more concerned with tracking their towels than with providing good service. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was equally disappointing. Poor, disorganized service, sub-par food (especially for the $25pp charge for the buffet). Overall, would definitely not come to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay For The Money”
Reviews.Author: excelden
Reviews.Content: Found a good price on Starwood's web site last minute for one night. Upon check in, the front desk person was just down right RUDE!!! Did not care if we stayed there or not, no "good afternoon, or how are you doing today?" Now for the room, clean but basic for a Sheraton, these rooms are in need for a renovation, very worn. I would also guess because of the room rate I paid we were given a left over room, the bed was not comfortable (lack of support). In my opinion, false advertising when it came to the room description and how good their beds were. At the end of the day we only stayed one night, if we were to stay multiple nights I would pick another hotel, there is a lot better out there for the price! One more negative these rooms are not sound proof!! Thin walls??

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Shaun52
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Wall, has to be the most terrible hotel we have ever stayed in. It is totally impersonal. The rooms are not the largest and quite honestly were in need a refurbishment ( 5 years ago ). This hotel came as part of a package booked with Rocky Mountain Explorer, and for what they charge you would expect a higher quality of hotel. As soon as you get to the elevators you are hit with a horrible stench, and wait until you arrive to your rooms, it is disgusting. We had a balcony which had not been cleaned in god knows how long, full of pigeon droppings a closer exploration of the room showed it too had not been properly cleaned for an age, beds are terrible too. DONT STAY HERE, THERE IS MUCH BETTER IN VANCOUVER FOR LESS !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - close to everything, too.”
Reviews.Author: frannmatt
Reviews.Content: location is perfect. only 1.5 miles from chinatown, but the walk felt much shorter because there's so much to see on the way there. #22 bus right outside the hotel is extremely convenient, too, of course, if you don't feel like walking. robson st. just a couple blocks away for fun shopping or people watching or a hotdog or "japadog" on the street corners. stanley park also only @ a mile away and the stoll there thru cute neighborhoods or along beach drive is very nice. north tower built in '04 or '06 the front desk said and is supposed to have more modern rooms, but i wanted a room on a high floor to get a better view and ended up on the 29th floor of the south tower which was totally fine, too. front desk said south tower was actually refurbished in '07 so it's just as good. we had a city view which was really nice definitely, but am excited for our next trip back to ask for a water view for a change. i heard there was a fee for the gym, but there wasn't, and the gym was very nice. pool was always full of kids, so didn't use.

Reviews.Title: “There when you need them”
Reviews.Author: mowog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a fourteen day cruise . On the day of check out our friend who had been feeling ill, collapsed in the lobby. The staff was fantastic. Doorman and front desk both called 911, a banquet manager who was nearby ran to administer first aid. A concierge desk person got the wheel chair.. Our friend being taken to St. Paul's hospital, which is directly across the street and admitted. The front desk staff immediately arranged for a room for the wife, got her luggage back in the room and without hesitation offered a compassion rate... Once my husband and myself got to the airport we realized in the excitement we had left a piece of luggage at the hotel. They immediately found it and had a taxi bring it to us.. Our friend who had to stay in Vancouver an extra week said the staff looked after her like family. I say these experiences speak volumns about the quality of a hotel , more than views , and fancy ammenties can ever do....

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Cleo4e
Reviews.Content: So I tagged along on a business trip my my husband to Vancouver. We were in Victoria BC prior for business and took 2 extra days to explore Vancouver for leisure. We arrived at the hotel, checked in from one Tower and stayed in the other. As I walked into the room I gasped. IT WAS GORGEOUS! I've stayed at many hotels in my life time all around the world, but this one was something else! Spacious room, gorgeous artwork, a heavenly bed, spotlessly clean and a cute coffee bar set up, with starbucks coffee! The room was very mordern and very stylish! The hotel staff was wonderful at helping us plan our very rushed tour of Vancouver city. The hotel is very ideally located in the heart of downtown-within walking distance of all the shopping hot spots as well as the harbour. I STRONGLY recommend the tours through the hotel! The restaurant downstairs was great and, so was the taxi stand so getting to the airport was no issue. We had such a wonderful two days, totally worth our while! And I'm looking forward to staying there again when we go back to Vancouver in October!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views, great location”
Reviews.Author: rileigh15
Reviews.Content: From my balcony on the 23rd floor, I could see the harbor area. It was beautiful! My room featured a window across the entire wall facing the water, floor to ceiling. The room was definitely tight; to access the mini bar counter area, you had to climb over part of the bed, but I did have a small desk area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: thisscreennamewasok
Reviews.Content: We had no problems with this hotel. Check in was fast, easy and the staff was very helpful. We valet parked the car as it was only $3 more than the regular parkade fee. Our room was beautiful with the floor to ceiling windows. We had more of a city view than one of the water, but since we're from a small town, we loved watching it! The room wasn't huge, but it was perfect for us - it was all we needed. I didn't pay for a suite, so I certainly didn't expect one! It was close to everything that we wanted to do. The grounds are beautiful too! The only "con" I can think of is that if you don't want to eat in the hotel restaurant, there isn't much to chose from for breakfast... maybe we didn't walk far enough? We were happy with the Tim Horton's around the corner! We just went for a weekend getaway and were very impressed - I would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “It used to be much much better...”
Reviews.Author: OJonVacation
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Wall Centre and was looking forward to a nice stay in the new tower once again. Upon a lengthy checkin (only 2 people working, long line-up), I went up to my room to check in. I noticed a no-disturb sign at the door, so was puzzled. I knocked and a big burly annoyed guy came to the door! I tried my card in his lock to make sure it was not my error and it opened his room door! Concierge at the bottom of building was very helpful, apologetic, but couldn't get the key to me without me/her having to go to the main building to change the key. They had given me the wrong room # and coded the wrong # on the key. There used to be a checkin desk at the new tower, but this seems to have disappeared, so for all front desk things one has to go to the main tower which is a bit inconvenient. The rooms are not as fresh and clean as they used to be. Bathroom was not super clean. Hotel needs an upgrade...it's showing its age! One amazing feature - the view from most of the rooms are AMAZING - on a clear sunny day you will feel like you are in heaven...and don't want to leave your room. The wall-to-wall windows (that open) are a great feature.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel but its too big for it self.....”
Reviews.Author: andytudor46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in a clubroom on the 27th floor.... We booked this through hotels.com we could have picked this club room at the Sheraton or a standard room at the loden but now i have stayed these i wish we would have booked the loden for the same price. We booked this hotel because we got a good price for a club room including continental breakfast, We arrived at the hotel at it all seemed manic....cars everywhere and the concierge rushing everywhere to park all these cars. We checked in and i was excited as i have never stayed at a hotel on the 27th floor. We got to the room and i was expecting a bit more from looking at the pics... i was expecting a very modern funky room as it was a club room and it was a very new hotel, but it was a standard room really with nothing exciting about it apart from it been on the 27th floor and having access to the club room. The room had really good views and the club room was a good thing too as you had acsess to this 24hrs a day with free drinks and snacks but for break fast the 25th floor is where you will need to go. The breakfast was nice but it was a standard continental breakfast. It was nice and clean and had a flat screen tv and no fridge or snacks as you have the club room on the same floor and everything was free in there, also you had accsess to free wireless internet which you needed a code from the club lounge. Getting to the 27th floor was anoying as the lift stopped at every single floor and was always busy prob cause of the size of the hotel but I didn’t like how busy it all was it all seemed so manic. The hotel was very good located 2 mins walk to the cinema and all the shops. We tried the gym also which was a right pain to find lol it was like a maze to find it..... it was well equipted and was busy too. I would recommend this hotel as its a nice new hotel but if you could anywhere nicer for the same price go for that especially the loden.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: ssbCalgary
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! It was new and clean with very comfortable beds.The floor to ceiling windows gave us a beautiful view of English Bay that was awesome at sunset. My 16 year old son loved the full gym and I loved the two hot tubs, pool, steam room and sauna. It is only a few blocks from Robson Street for tons of shopping and a few blocks from the beach. I booked online on their website and got a one night rate of $129 which they extended for 4 nights.The staff were friendly and very helpful. The landscaping was beautiful and well maintained. I highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location But HUGE Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Codester
Reviews.Content: We just got back (husband and I) from our 5 night stay in Vancouver. The Sheraton Wall Centre was in a perfect location within a 3 minute walk to the amazing restaurants and shopping on Robson St. And about a 10 minute walk to the Harbour and a 20 minute walk to Stanley Park. Our check in was fast and the only issue we had was that we booked online the North Tower, which is a new part of the hotel with updated modern looking rooms. We spent our first night in a South Tower room, which was oddly decorated, almost an Arizona Desert look but spacious with a very nice bathroom. But we decided to argue our way into the North Tower which is where my husbands conference was and the pool area. The North Tower room (2460) was very nice, very modern with a nice bathroom and an AMAZING view of the harbour and Grouse Mountain....and all of the other mountains. Plus an excellent view of the city below. The room was smaller than our South Tower room, with a flat screen tv and a nice bathroom. Basically you're just paying for the view, which I am sure you could get from the South Tower building, but you're not in the same building as the pool. The service was good and we had no other problems. The cab service is fast from the hotel and the bellboys are helpful. The drinks and lounge area is great but over priced, but definitely a great ambiance for sitting at night before dinner or an outing. Overall we had an excellent trip and the hotel and location is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler010177
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Wall Centre was the worst part of my stay. At 2 in the morning I was woken up by four guests arguing in the hall outside my room. Their fighting went on for two hours both inside their rooms and outside. I had to call for security twice to deal with them, but nothing was done except asking them to be quiet. The staff in general at the Wall Centre are not courteous, which is disappointing for a hotel as well known and as expensive as the Wall Centre. For the incident I described above, the staff were unwilling to fix the situation. The only remedy I could possibly receive requires me to stay at this terrible hotel again. As other people have stated in reviews, the rooms are indeed tiny. You're better off at the Hampton Inn or the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: sandy_why
Reviews.Content: Booked a night at this hotel on lastminute.com for £90. Having stayed at other Marriott and Quality Inn hotels in Vancouver/Calgary/Seattle on the holiday I was excited about the prospect of staying in the Sheraton. From the outside it looks magnificent and the location of the hotel is great. The service at the reception was good and what you would expect from this type of hotel. I asked for a late check out due to a late flight departure, but the best they could do was 1400. On arriving at the room, I was a little disappointed. The room was adequate, the bed was large and comfortable but it was just like any other 3 or 4 star hotel, wakening up in the morning you could quite easily have been in a room provided by a less prestigeous hotel chain for half the price. The pool and sauna are okay, you have to pay extra to use the gym!! If you can get this hotel at a good discount, it's worth it. I certainly would not pay the normal rate. If I really needed to stay in a luxury hotel I'd choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing, bad service, small room”
Reviews.Author: Fingermouse
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sheraton for 5 nights on a business trip to Vancouver. I have stayed in various Sheraton hotels around the world and this has to be the worst. I checked in late due to various flight delays and at check in explained that I would be paying extras and the company would be paying the hotel and breakfast. I was told this was fine but at that time they did not have the company credit card details to hand. At the time I told them that they were not allowed to pre-authorize the room on my credit card as it was getting close to its limit. I later found out this is exactly what they did, after complaining I got the impression they did not care, they had a way to get there money so did not want to help me. After speaking to them every day of the trip on the final day we got it sorted but there customer service leaves a huge amount to be desired. My room was a corner room on the 15th floor, the room was clean however because of its odd shape was very cramped. The view was OK, but mainly blocked by there other tower. The room had a small kitchen area which I did not expect, or need which simply took up room that could have been used for other things. The air conditioning/heating was so noisy you could not run it in the night which was a pain. Also the walls must be failry thin as there was lots of noise from other rooms. The bed was comfortable enough, however I found the bathroom very cramped. I had breakfast in the hotel once and it was massively overpriced and nothing to write home about, after my one experience I decided to stick with the local shops for breakfast. The location of the hotel is pretty good, a short walk from Robson Street and down to the waterfront if you want to go to Granville Island. We get a good corporate rate for the hotel however even at this rate I would not be staying again. I have stayed at the Pan Pacific which I would recommend other people do if they are in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: JennahGrace
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two children stayed at the Wall Centre for an entire week. The hotel is located in the perfect area. It was minutes from the shopping district, food, restaurants, etc. Since it was downtown, it was also very close to attractions like Stanley Park. When we first got there, we were told our room was in the South tower. I would have to say it's the worst of the two towers. If you can, ask for the main building. It's newer and more worth the more than $100 you'll be spending. I simply called into front desk and they sent someone up within 10 minutes to escort us and our baggage to our newer, bigger room in the main buliding..free of charge. The hotel is very clean as soon as you walk in, all the way throughout. Staff is friendly (with the exception of the doormen). Your room will be cleaned daily, unless you ask that it's not. Our cleaner was extremely nice, and does an excellent job. I am huge on having clean rooms and this hotel definetly met my standards. The views are all amazing as well. As for the rest of the features such as restaurants, it way more expensive and you're better off eating at the hundreds of restaurants in the downtown core. ***Try a restaurant named "Saltlik" it's AMAZING..

Reviews.Title: “Nice view - bad sound proofing.”
Reviews.Author: kotarok
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton because of its convenient location and a decent rate. The poor sound proofing made the stay less enjoyable. You can hear your neighbor's conversations (and screaming children), and the elevators keep you awake. The good: - Floor to celiing windows with great views of city. - Convenient location - Plenty of free on-street parking available around the block. - Starbucks available downstairs - Very friendly bar staff. - Pretty spacious rooms with up-to-date furniture and carpets. The bad: - Check in and room may be in 2 different towers. - No free Wifi - unacceptable at this day and age. - Poor sound proofing between rooms. You can hear everything. - The bar atmosphere is rather sad. You feel like in a mall, right next to escalators. The ugly: - Kids (age 5-10?) screaming next door around midnight. Had to call front desk to get them to shut up. As a parent, I understand kids don't always behave, but that was anarchy behind a very poorly sound proofed wall with connecting door. - The "ding" sound from the elevator kept us awake all night. In summary - it is a rather average hotel, especially considering (or maybe because) it's a Sheraton. While the room itself is nice, it is very noisy. Bring your ear plugs. And while you are at it, bring your binoculars and satisfy the voyeur in yourself by peeping into the stylish condos next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Chemicalguy123
Reviews.Content: I've just gotten back from Vancouver and if I were to go back, I would stay at the Sheraton again. I checked in early but they found a room for me with no problem. The front desk and cleaning staff were very friendly and greeted me with a smile every time. I was happy with the size and the furnishing of my room. It came with a flat screen tv which is starting to become pretty standard at the better hotels. I thought the bed was very comfortable although I found that the pillows were all either too thick or too thin. The hotel's location is fairly good. It is about a 15 minute walk to the waterfront and about 30 minutes to get to Granville Island. Of course there are plenty of taxis and buses available if you don't want to walk. If you plan to use the health club, you may want to get a room in the north tower since a journey from the south tower is a bit long. They have a business centre but you have to see the front desk to be able to get access to it. If I was coming back to Vancouver, I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"The Right Stuff" and the vancouver sheraton.”
Reviews.Author: SONNYSMOM
Reviews.Content: Loved it! It's a great place to stay for shopping on robson, or riding the skytrain which takes you just about anywhere in Vancouver. There is also a movie theatre and marketplace down the street. Everything was close, and not a far walk at all. I stayed here for a nkotb concert, and will return and be the only place I stay in Vancouver. We had a great view of the ocean and Mts. the room was comfy. We stayed in the south tower, with double beds. We had buffet breakfast the morning we left and it was excellent! There is a children's hospital next door that had its official christmas lighting and we lucked out and was able to see it from the room! The room was clean, warm, the beds were comfy and it wasnt expensive! I cant wait for the summer tour of nkotb to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but I wouldn't return.”
Reviews.Author: rahir
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton twice during a stay to Vancouver. The first visit consisted of 3 nights, and we were placed on the 12th floor of the North Tower. The floor-to-ceiling windows were nice, as was the bed, but the room was way too cramped for two people over 4 days/3 nights. We didn't have enough room in the closet for our coats and clothes (that dresser is TINY!), and we felt like we kept bumping into each other or the walls throughout our visit. The check-in person insisted that this was "one of our nicest rooms," but while it's modern, the space issue didn't make it too nice for us in the long run. On our return trip from Vancouver Island, we were placed in the South Tower up in the 20s. We had a great view, but also could hear the sirens from the hospital across the street at all hours. The room itself was easily twice the size of our first room, but it was much older in style and decor. Still, the space made us feel a little more restful before returning home. We had issues with the concierge. First, we asked for a nice Italian restaurant recommendation for dinner, and our only caveat was that it be vegetarian friendly. The concierge looked at me, and she said, "Well, there's really only one inexpensive place. The rest are all fine dining." Now, we had no preference of where the restaurant was. We were happy to take a bus, a cab, etc. But there's only ONE that she'd assume is acceptable for us? I was even more perturbed that she assumed we wanted something inexpensive. It's not like we're staying at the Best Western! So she sent us to Lombardo's, just a block away, and we had the worst experience. Hard pasta, soggy pizza, and pretty much a poor night overall. On our 4th day, we had rented a car to go to Vancouver Island. We carted our two large suitcases down to the concierge's station (we were directed by the North Tower front desk staff that we had to go to the South Tower for this) and asked for assistance calling Budget because they offer a free shuttle for pick-up and delivery (I even confirmed this by calling them the week before). Sadly enough, it was the same concierge: female, mid-40s, curly reddish hair, and a perpetual frown. She said curtly, "Well. I don't think they offer that service." Um, no. My web confirmation says they do. And I called and they confirmed it! She agreed to call, did so, acted snotty to the Budget person, hung up, and said, "They don't." Yeah. Ok. What do we do? She said we could keep the receipt and Budget would reimburse us. Sounds easy, and it was, but she could have been nicer about it. A smile and a little warmth really go a long way. Lastly, don't order food via room service. It's way overpriced and bland. The bar area is pretty much nonexistent. The Sheraton's big plus is location: not too far from all the hubbub of Robson, and also an easy walk/cab/bus to Kitsilano and even the West End. But unless I had to stay at the Sheraton Wall Centre again, I wouldn't. There are just much better options.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmh274
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Wall centre in Vancouver for the first 5 nights of our honeymoon and we were really impressed. We had a delux, king, corner room in the North Tower. The service from the start was excellent (from the front desk, concierge, room service, in the bar and restuarant), the room was clean, well furnished, a very big and comfy bed and had fantastic views of the city. We had read on one review about ambulance sirens heading to the hospital opposite keeping this person awake, but we actually found the whole hotel to be really quiet. There was no noticable traffic noise and when we were in our room we felt like we were the only people there. The restaurant was outstanding - a great atmosphere, a really good selection of wine and fantastic food. The small bar in the North Tower also served some really good food. The breakfast selection was also good. The position of the Wall Centre meant it was a short walk to Robson Street and the harbour, as well as not being too far from Granville Island. The only part of the hotel we were less impressed with was the pool and changing rooms. When I went through to the pool reception to ask for a padlock for the lockers I was told there were none left (despite there being many empty lockers) and the whole area felt like it could do with a bit of a spruce up. All in all, a really enjoyable stay at an impressive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent upper-tier chain hotel; good central location”
Reviews.Author: garfodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wall Centre North Tower for a business trip. This building and the rooms were clean and modern. Customer service was generally good, though there were a couple of days when they didn't deliver the morning newspaper. The room itself was well-maintained, with nice floor-to-ceiling windows and a good king size bed. The North Tower suffers from the same situation as modern condominiums; because the rooms are not shaped as a rectangle, you have strange and awkward room situations. The desk chair for this room was ergonomically poor -- (it's a standard room chair) -- I've seen better desk chairs in Holiday Inns. That was a disappointment, as was the bright idea to enclose the bar fridge in a tight enclosed closet -- that meant that there was no space for the heat to escape, which meant that the bar fridge was never cold. There was also a really annoying closet light that automatically flicked on and off whenever it felt like it. Parking is a standard ~$25 per night, which is about what you'd pay for any downtown hotel. Standard Internet is $12 per night. All that said, I would choose this hotel again, because Starwood points are fantastic, and because this probably has the best location for any of Vancouver's upper-tier hotels. The proximity to the shopping, restaurant, and cafe areas of Robson St and Davie Street are fantastic, and you're only a short 5 minute walk from the entertainment district on Granville. Other top-tier downtown hotels may have better vistas (Westin Coal Harbour), but are far away from everything. Or, they may be closer to SkyTrain (Delta, Hyatt) but are then in the financial district, which is pretty dead at night. The Sheraton Wall Centre is a solid upper-tier chain hotel, and is recommended, but they really could work on their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: THEDENTS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Seattle for a business trip of his and we decided to go a couple days early and go to Canada. Once we got to the hotel we were impressed. Downtown Vancouver is a busy place but so fun! The hotel was in a perfect location. We walked to dinner and shops and then drove when we went a further distance. The hotel was one of the nicest places we have stayed in a while! I called ahead of time and requested to stay on an upper floor (15 or higher) and that was well worth the beautiful view of the city and the mountains!! The lady was so nice and helpful to do that and didnt hesitate she gladly did that for us! The room was so new and nice, with lots of room. The pool area, and workout space was so nice too! We thought the room service for just some drinks was a little over the top on price, but usually that's how it goes when you stay at a 4-5 star hotel! The weather was wonderful as well! Overall very nice place to stay and had beautifual surroundings!

Reviews.Title: “Great position, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelWarrior
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for a stay in Vancouver, whether it's business or pleasure. The whole city is within walking distance and it is in a nice, safe location with a good choice of eateries nearby. My North Tower room was well-equipped, spotlessly clean, well-decorated and furnished with an extremely comfortable bed and great views. The service throughout was attentive and friendly and I had no problems at all throughout my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views across Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Matthijs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and stayed in a lovely corner suite in the North tower. Thank you to all the people here who recommended staying in the North tower, we had a quick look at the south tower and it's much older and not half as nice. The corner suite on the 25th floor had stunning views across Vancouver. Taking good pictures was not easy due to the coated windows however there were very small windows that could be opened, just large enough the hold the camera outside and take a picture. The room was nice, not massively large but quite new and the bed was extremely comfortable. Stay here if you'd like to have excellent views, day or night, across vancouver. Booking a corner suite in the North tower is worth the extra money. Location is very central - just minutes walk from Robson street and near all the tourist attractions. We walked from the hotel to Stanley Park which was probably 20-30 minutes walk. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: hw17
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe corner room as part of our honeymoon, hoping for a room on a high floor with a great view. Unfortunately they didn't have any available on a floor higher than the 10th when we checked in, but we knew this might happen. The room was large with a very very comfy bed and did have a good view, just not as high up as we'd hoped. Free bottles of water were provided which we stored in the fridge and used each day (they were replaced each day) whilst touring the city. The bathroom was a little disappointing, although clean and reasonably large, with good toiletries supplied, the bathtub was very very shallow and the shower not particularly powerful. The hotel is in an excellent location for seeing downtown Vancouver, a little bit further away from the harbour-front than I'd have liked ideally, although in saying that there is still a lot of construction going on near Canada Place which would've been noisy. The public transport available locally is really limited to buses, the Skytrain is not too useful for seeing the sights of downtown. We didn't use the leisure facilities but were told they are free for guests. We also didn't sample the restaurants at the hotel, there are plenty of places to eat nearby whether for breakfast, lunch or dinner. All in all we were pleased with our accommodation, but it lacked a certain something for a honeymoon. However, that certain something comes at quite a cost in downtown Vancouver it seems.

Reviews.Title: “Wall Centre was a wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: mnfun2bme
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience at the Wall Centre! We all loved the floor to ceiling windows of the North Tower! Thanks to Mark Portner for providing the water for our walking excursion! We were within walking distance of wonderful shopping and we walked to the aquarium and Stanley Park from the hotel. We didn't need a cab for anything except the ride from the airport and the ride to Canada Place for our Alaskan Cruise. Great time was had by all!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: edinpaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in this hotel in a suite on the 12th floor of the South Tower. Although this is opposite St Paul's Hospital there is no disturbance from ambulances arriving or leaving A&E. This hotel is in a perfect location on Burrard Street which is only a couple of blocks from Robson Street on one side and Davie Street on the other. Robson has a wide aray of shops and restaurants whilst Davie is known as the gay village where there is a wide range of independent shops, cafes and bars. The hotel staff at the Sheraton were more than helpful, arranging a late check out and complimentary desserts to celebrate a birthday whilst we were there. There is no breakfast room in the South Tower however there are numerous eating outlets in the area where you can pick up on a full breakfast for less than ten dollars. If you feel like splashing out suggest taking the seaplane from Vancouver to Victoria on Vancouver island...great fun. Would definitely stay at his hotel if I returned to Vancouver. This is a great city to visit and would recommend it to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile If You Stay In The Hotel 24 Hrs A Day”
Reviews.Author: Makr
Reviews.Content: Can't really fault the Sheraton Centre in Burrard Street Vancouver. Excellent service and had a fantastic room on the 24th floor. Breakfast was good as well, but again, how much can one eat at 8/9am.. so really having a choice of 15 dishes or so will only appease Overweight tourists from some parts of the world that think they are getting a service if they start their day by overeating and getting their value for money. Location is also great. The only problem with 4 or 5 star is always the same: there is not much difference between this and some other budget hotel unless you want it to stay in your hotel room looking at the fantastic view from your window. Used to be out by 9am and come back at 9pm or even later: so not much point in paying $200+ when a clean budget hotel would have served the same purpose. It's always up to the individual to make their choices. IF having an overpriced room high up with an oversized breakfast to start your day, and if you want to go back to your neck of the woods and show pictures of your room, then this is certainly your thing.

Reviews.Title: “I'll look for other options the next time”
Reviews.Author: Byron_M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 5 nights at this hotel - here is my overview, including my ratings (on a 1-5 scale) of various attributes that come to mind; LOCATION: 4.0 - very well located close to downtown Vancouver EXTERIOR and GROUNDS: 3.0: - Property consists of three modern but reasonably designed towers built around a very attractive and well maintained courtyard. I would have assigned a "4" rating on this category were it not for the cracked glass panel high up on the North Tower and which appeared to be patched, at least temporarily, by applying lots of duct tape along and across the crack. INTERIOR COMMON SPACE: 4.0 - Functional, in good condition, reasonably well designed and well maintained. ROOM, excluding bathroom: 4.0 - Our room was spacious, - the furnishings and finishings were comfortable and in good condition. The bar style fridge was a plus. BATHROOM: 2.0 - Functional but the cracked wash basin should have been replaced and the toilet required multiple flushes after each use. The single roll toilet tissue dispenser, when coupled with the apparent T.P. rationing policy (see "HOUSEKEEPING" below) was particularly irritating. STAFF: 3.5 - As a group they deserve full marks in repect of interpersonal attributes (friendly and pleasant to deal with etc.) The front desk attendants seemed to handle guests that were unhappy with the fact that their rooms weren't ready by check-in time very well and housekeeping staff typically gave a brief but friendly greeting when guests passed them in the halls. I would have rated the staff "4" or better, but rightly or wrongly I think they have to accept some, but not all of the blame for the check-in problems and my issues over toilet paper rationing. CHECK-IN EXPERIENCE: 1.5 - We arrived at the hotel at about 1:00 PM Vancouver time, after spending nearly 12 hours enroute. That day (a Saturday) there was a continuous long and slow moving line-up at the check-in counter throughout the entire afternoon and early evening - I went through that line-up four times ie at 1:00 PM (which was before the posted check-in time of 3:00, but I wanted to see if they could accomodate us with an early check-in - they couldn't), at 3:00, at 4:00 and at 4:30. In each instance I was told our room wasn't ready but the last time I more emphatically asked them to find some room for us and the Guest Services person I was dealing with came up with an alternate room and also comped us with vouchers for the breakfast buffet for the following morning. About 15 minutes after we arrived in our room and just after my wife got out of the bathtub, the door was opened by a porter and another couple to whom the room had also been assigned. The other couple had to go back through the line-up at the check-in counter again in order to get another room - similarly the mix-up created the need for me to proceed thru the lin-up (for the fifth time) in order to get our door key-cards recoded. If it were not for the complimentary breakfast vouchers, I would have rated our check-in experience as a 1.0. HOUSEKEEPING: 1.5 - Housekeeping staff did a very good job vis a vis daily cleaning and tidying etc. in our room, but the toilet tissue rationing was a real issue with me. i.e when we checked in there was a bit of tissue on the single roll dispenser in our bathroom PLUS a spare roll in the closet, but once we started to use the spare roll, it was never replaced and the single-roll dispenser would never be refilled till it was completey empty. Also we phoned the housekeeoing department that the toilet was flushing poorly. - after that it only took 2 or 3 flushes - instead of 3 or 4 - to clear the bowl after each use. Note: In order to avoid misinterpretation of the above comments I want to point out to any readers of this review that the flushing problem was not caused by excess use of toilet tissue. My 1.5 rating for "housekeeping" also gives consideration to the fact that rooms were not ready by check-in time, notwithstanding this could be due to a staffing deficiency, as opposed to the competence of the statt that were on duty that day. OTHER: This hotel does not provide free in-room internet access, although it can be obtained for $11. or $12. per day plus tax. With respect to in-house food offerings, we used the complimentary coupons for a breakfast and found the food and service to be satisfactory but we also noticed the prices for selections on the menus for on-site restaurants and room service were excessive. Accordingly we ate well at various good restaurants located within reasonable walking distances of the hotel and at appreciably better prices. GENERAL: Our recent trip to British Columbia spanned 9 nights and included stays at three hotels. I experienced much smoother check-ins at the other two hotels each of which offered free in-room internet access and had bathrooms equipped with two roll toilet tissue dispensers. I would give the other two hotels, OVERALL ratings of 3 and 4 respectively, as opposed to the 2 that I believe is appropriate for our experience at the Sheraton Wall Centre in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Haz45
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 12 nights at this hotel and was very happy with the location and the service received. We were located on the 11th floor in the North Tower with a corner room and it is to be expected with city centre location rooms there was some road noise but did not consider this to be a problem. We had breakfast in the hotel sometimes but this was a bit pricey if you are not a big eaters. The food was good and quite a reasonable selection. The staff were very helpful with information when we needed it and very pleasent. A bulb was replaced in within a very short time of us reporting it. The room was spotless and the range of products in the bathroom were very good. Would stay here again if we return to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Ayjones
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay in Vancouver at the end of our 3 week trip across western Canada. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is in central downtown Vancouver on Burrard Street which makes everything so accessible. It is an easy 5 mnute walk to Robson Street and a 10-15 min walk to Canada Place and the Sea Wall walk- which takes you into Stanley Park. It is an attractive buiding from the outside, one of the nicest with landscape gardens. We stayed in the North Tower which I think is the newest part. The lobby is much more spacious and there seems a lot more in the way of amenites in this tower. The staff were incredibly helpful, even after we had got home and we had been charged twice for the valet parking. I have to say they were very good in sorting this out quickly. The room itself was a spacious king room, not as spacious as we thought but a decent size. The bed was very comfortable. The hospitality tray was topped up each day with Starbucks coffee. The bathroom was a good size with a very good shower. The highlight of the room for me was the floor to ceiling windows we had a great city view and at night, with all the lights it was stunning. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, we thought it a bit pricy however we did eat out at the Indigo Bistro one night located in the South Tower. The food was very good and not as pricy as some of the places we had eaten at on our trip. The staff at the Bistro were very good and were always making sure you were OK. All in all a good stay. We will be back to Vancouver because two nights is certainly not enough and we would probably stay at the Sheraton Wall.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PIPTYPIBE
Reviews.Content: This is the third Sheraton I have stayed in in the past two months and it really didn't let me down. Unfortunately we got off to a bad start. The young girl on reception told us there wasn't any king size beds left. Before we got a chance to ask anything the other receptionist came over and said no there were no king size, only two doubles. I tried to explain we had specifically asked for king size in our booking but she said our type of bookings are given whatever is available. I thought she might have suggested waiting to see if a king size room would become available later in the day (or even apologised!) but no. We were allocated a room in the North Tower to which she just waved her hand in the general direction and did not explain where to go. Thankfully a very nice porter came over and explained everything even explaining the difference between the north and south towers. (North is newer but a little walk over) After that everything was wonderful. The room was really lovely! New feel about it and spotlessly clean! Floor to ceiling windows, starbucks coffee maker, plasma tv, dressing gown, newspaper in the morning. The bathroom even nicer! Shower gel, loofah etc The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to Robson St, the main shopping area. You can check in with Air Canada in the lobby which is very handy. Internet access is in the South Tower. Theres a little Starbucks down the stairs in the lobby.We enquired about the Airport Bus and it leaves every half hour, but it's just as cheap and quicker to take a taxi to the airport. I would definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “Top stay in executive level north tower”
Reviews.Author: ATW06
Reviews.Content: The modern hotel is centrally located in Vancouver downtown, it is only a short walk to all downtown locations. The size of the hotel makes a very individual service more complicated, nevertheless, the people tried very hard. The room in the executive level in the north tower was Sheraton standard, not very big, but with the great floor to ceiling windows the impression of space was created. The view on good days is fantastic. Being on the executive level, a continental breakfast in the south tower is inculded. Though not a very big choice, it had everything you needed for a very good breakfast including a perfect view from the 25th floor. The concierge service was good and the restuarant recommendation turned out to be excellent. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Wall Centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBug
Reviews.Content: Great location, centrally located. Fast friendly check-in and it was only a $10 taxi ride from the cruise ship. The room was beautiful, bed very comfortable and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: KingTito
Reviews.Content: Noise level from traffic below a bit of an issue and I was on the 11th floor. TV's need updating as they are small. Some new flatscreens would be nice. The carpet was a bit worn and could use a deep cleaning or an update. Rooms were clean and beds comfortable. The fitness center was OK. The weights are spread between two rooms and feels like an afterthought. A bit of a renovation to update the tired equipment and consolidate it would be nice. The cardio machines are in a third room altogether which looks updated. The hotel is split between two towers. It is a crapshoot as to which one you are in which is a bit weird and I had to walk across the turnaround to get to my tower. The breakfast at the cafe was very good if not a bit expensive. Staff is extremely helpful with directions and questions. Overall, nice, comfortable place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lambchop3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a deluxe room in the North Tower thinking we would end our holiday in style before the flight back across the Pacific. After making our way through an obstacle course of luggage, check in was difficult as could not hear anything in the excessively noisy lobby full of people. The room lacked the finesse and attention to detail from what I would expect, for example - paper 'Starbucks' cups were provided instead of proper ones, no mini-bar, no bathrobes and only one towel hook in the bathroom. Not sure where the 2nd person is meant to put their towel? Don't mind spending $ for the finer things in life. This hotel just isn't one one of those finer things.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: PJTravels
Reviews.Content: Our second stay here, first was 2004. Location is good for all tourist adventures, hotel restaurant is fine as the dont-want-to-go-out choice. The view from the towers is great, the staff are very cheerful and helpful. It was nice to have an empty fridge to use (and there's a good grocery shop just two blocks away). But then there are the negatives. The rooms have odd angles so furniture is hard to arrange, especially if you've asked for two beds: our first room had a bed in each room, but the desk was in one and the cord for the internet service was at the farthest point away in the other room; our second room, with the desk useful for our necessary computer, had an 18" closet in which the clothes had to share space with the ironing board; and the little bar area was 6" away from the edge of one bed. The AC system was horrible -- full-blast on or off, noisy on and switching on and off; because one wall of our room was all glass, facing west, we needed that AC. (The all-glass wall also leads to acres of curtains to pull when you want darkness.) The bath was small. The place is showing its age, and maintenance is sloppy: amateurishly applied caulk around the bathtub, a cracked basin in the bathroom, and a smoke detector dangling from the ceiling! Housekeeping was pretty bad -- one bed not correctly made (one whole corner of sheets and blankets not tucked in), cleanliness not very thorough, and through the course of our week's stay we got fewer and fewer towels and fresh glasses. (At these prices, can't they afford to give more than one drinking glass per person?) Not unique to this hotel, but totally maddening, is the bottle of 'spring' water on the bar area for which they would charge you $4.50!! All in all, not worth the extravagant price.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Boris47
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our holiday, Our room was in the North Tower on the 23 rd floor. The views from here were spectacular , overlooking the city , moutains and ocean.Our room was very spacious and the hotal is perfectly located in the downtown area to explore the whole city.

Reviews.Title: “great location - good for business”
Reviews.Author: ldea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton from July 6 to 9 for a conference. the room was on the 27th floor in the north tower. clean, wide, king size bed, large flat screen tv, AC a bit too noisy, nice view. breakfast is served at the cafe located on the ground floor (17CAD for continental breakfast seemed to much for what was offered). I didn't try the hotel restaurants since the hotel itself is perfectly located in a very lively area. wireless internet is expensive (14CAD for 1 day - just across the street, "cafe de france" offers free wireless). The hotel is perfect for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Sheraton, enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: sayuna
Reviews.Content: Vancouver was our last stop after two-week Canadian/US trip and our three-night stay with Sheraton was a very nice way to conclude our fantastic holiday. The hotel is huge, with two towers, conveniently located just a block away from Robson St. The room was lovely, with incredibly comfortable bed (as expected from Sheraton), good size bathroom and the view of the city from our room was very nice. Concierge service was friendly and informative - a great tip was bicycle ride around Stanley Park! We also had wonderful time walking around the city and trying different restaurants on Robson St. Vancouver is beautiful and so is this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “never go again!!!”
Reviews.Author: MISSYEVELYN
Reviews.Content: they over priced .in that kina service everything! never ever go there again... I stay for 5 nights and switch to FAIRMONT HOTEL VANCOUVER...will write a review after the stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gbtrotter
Reviews.Content: There's not much left to be said that hasn't already been said. The hotel is in a very good location - a little removed from the hustle and bustle of the waterfront but still close to Robson Street and some good restaurants. It would take about 20-30 minutes to walk directly down to the waterfront or Gas Town. I requested a high floor in the north tower with an early check-in and late check-out and the hotel accommodated. While I did not see any of the rooms in the south tower, just being inside the south tower led me to believe it was the older building. Everything is a little closer together and the decor darker. However, the business center is located in the south tower so that may be a consideration for some. The north tower, by contrast, is very light, airy and the rooms have wonderful floor to ceiling windows that actually open a little to allow for fresh air. The health club is also in the north tower and is free of chrage for hotel guests. The indoor pool and jacuzzi tubs were loved by my kids. Starbucks is also in the north tower. Each tower had an airline check-in kiosk in their respective lobbies, something I have come to love with Sheratons and other hotels.
