However, the kiosks were only good for some carriers and while my carrier (Alaska/Horizon) was one of the options, I couldn't get the system to accept my information. I ended up in the business center which didn't cost me anything to log on to the internet and print my boarding passes. A few blocks south of the hotel you can board the tiny False Creek Ferry to Granville Island which has wonderful shops and restaurants. The ferry also goes to a few other places close by and is a cheap alternative to driving to the island and trying to find a space to park.

Reviews.Title: “not up to sheraton standards”
Reviews.Author: QPRJAMES0
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a rocky mountaineer package deal. Upon check in we asked for rooms well away from the elevators. so what did they give us? 3 rooms right next to the elevators of course! this made for poor sleep as it was sat night so the lift bell (it dings ludly when it reches you're level!) was 'ding-ing' all night long! The leisure facility was very poor and very dirty, although the jacuzzi was a good size, and i went for a dip as the bath tubs in the rooms were too small. overall, i would try something a little more modern and this hotel has seen its best days.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: andiamo ssdac
Reviews.Content: I agree with the comments made by the last two reviewers. I stayed at the Sheraton for four nights recently prior to an Alaskan Cruise. I booked the hotel directly and requested a room in the North Tower, high floor which is exactly what I got (26th) floor. I got the airporter bus from the airport which drops you off at the Sheraton. This is really easy, you come out of the doors of the arrival hall and it is literally to your left just outside the main doors. It is 13 CAD for one way. Anyway, when the bus dropped me off I walked into the South Tower and they checked me in and pointed me in the right direction to the North tower, which is literally just across a patio area. I was really pleased I had requested the North Tower as it is much newer, obviously I didnt see the rooms in the South Tower, but the reception area was much older than the North Tower. I thought the room was lovely, huge bed, when I drew back the curtains and saw the view wow! felt dizzy, I think due to the jet lag. My room was facing the main street, so I suppose first thing in the morning for some people they would find it a little noisy. Traffic noise doesnt bother me and after all you are booking a hotel right in the downtown centre. Hotel was in an excellent position, plenty of restaurants all around. There is a handy deli shop literally across the road, this shop is on three floors and sells a wide range of good food. There is a tiny coffee shop in there too. One downside, if you want wine for your room, this shop does not sell alcohol. There are two specialist wine shops, one belonging to the Sheraton on the corner of the hotel, and one belonging to the Sutton place almost next to the Market Place shop. I think these are predominently wine shops - didnt notice any other type of liquor, bu maybe there is some. I found the staff friendly, in fact I couldnt get over how friendly all the Canadians were. I used the pool in the hotel for an early morning swim and it is a decent size. I didnt eat in the hotel restaurants, so can't comment but did use the Starbucks for a quick breakfast and coffee. I was pleased with my choice of hotel and if ever I go back to Vancouver I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view and the room”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRedBear
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here attending a conference at the hotel. I was on the north tower/east side on the 14th floor so didn't have the hospital sounds a previous reviewer experienced. View was fantastic and rooms have floor to ceiling windows (literally) so I really felt like in the middle of the metropolis that is Vancouver. King bed was HUGE (California king) and the sheets were a bejillion count (almost satin) with 8 pillows. Furnishings were all new and the layout of the room was good with bed separated from the office area (although the TV was a little far away to see easily from the bed). I assume room layout varies as the tower is oval shaped, so the rooms along the east/west sides are longer and a little larger while the rooms on the north/south sides of the tower are smaller. Bathroom was adequate and tub had one of those curved shower rails that gives you more room in the shower. Conference provided breakfast and lunch so can't comment on the restaurant (Starbucks on the lower level). But you're right in the heart of downtown. I was eating decent Indian food two blocks from the hotel at 11 PM; the hotel is surrounded by restaurants. Parking was expensive ($26/night) and I agree with another reviewer who complained about having to pay $10/day for lobby wifi access (esp. considering there's an internet cafe around the corner on Davie for $2/hour). All the staff I interacted with (valet, reception, parking garage) were friendly. .

Reviews.Title: “Service, View, Location: Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cajunyank
Reviews.Content: We recently had two rooms on the 20th floor in the North Tower prior to an Alaskan Cruise and found the views to be fantastic. The service staff was always available and courteous for any question. We booked tours through the consierge with ideal service. The rooms were spotless and the floor to ceiling windows were breathtaking. The location was close to Robson Street and all its attractions. The Starbucks within the building made a quick breakfast a real convenience. All in all we found no complaints about this Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Wall Centre”
Reviews.Author: MQuinnCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vancouver 3 times and have stayed at Wall Centre all 3 times. We get a corner suite with a kitchenette and love the views. Price for our suite about the same or less than many single rooms at other hotels. The staff is accommodating and efficient. We were a little reluctant about the restaurant since there weren't so many people dining but the food was excellent and the service good. Also, the location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Should be better”
Reviews.Author: JRD_Oxon
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly nice hotel but I think others should be aware of a few drawbacks which may or may not make a difference to their hotel selection. After staying at the Sheraton and Westin Hotels (both members of the Starwood Group) in Seattle and being very impressed we really thought the same high standard would await us as we moved up to Vancouver. In general terms of room and cleanliness etc it did. However, this large hotel although close to shopping/eating districts only has one small restaurant, and in our opinion it provides a poor selection of food for those travel weary customers who don't want to have to go out to find somewhere for a simple snack before bed. Granted you could just order from room service but the cost is about double what you'd usually pay. They do have a cafe for breakfast which is offered at a reasonable price (for a hotel) but beware of the orange juice they offer to pour as it's a stonking $5 per glass!. The other disappointment was that although internet access is available, it's at an additional cost of $10 per day even in the lobby area. Even the Westin in Seattle provide free WiFi access in their lounge area. The other main issue we have found here is simply the fact that the hotel is situated across the road from a hospital so every night around 2/3 or 4am we would be awaken by very loud sirens. We expect this is only made worse due to each room having a window which can be opened, so sound proofing is probably reduced even in winter. The bathroom is nice and clean but not as well arranged as the other hotels - not so much room around the sink and no where to hang the hand towel or even your swim suits to dry without having them drip all over the floor. That said the hotel is very comfortable, it has a great pool if you like a good swim, and the trolley tour has a stop right outside, making it easy to access various areas of the city over a 2 day period. It's just not the best Sheraton we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A litanny of problems”
Reviews.Author: ScottC
Reviews.Content: Terrible may be harsh but some problems doesn't fit. we stopped counting probelems at a dozen. From my confirmed King room transforming into 2 double beds to problems moving to the correct type the next day to cleaning supplies left in room to ineffective in room internet to early disturbing by cleaning staff..... We are starwood frequent users but this property did not meet the standard we have come to expect and will avoid it in future.

Reviews.Title: “Cold and unfreindly”
Reviews.Author: jobstgeorge
Reviews.Content: Chose this luxury hotel to relax and enjoy our honeymoon however was very disappointed in the size of the corner room we were given, staff seemed to be annoyed when asking questions and were not very hospitable. The restaurants were usually empty and had an uninviting feeling perhaps because of the prices and many many other options in the city. For the price and the luxury brand we felt short changed. We left the hotel early to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: marc0p0ll0
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Sheraton Wall Center and it’s likely to be last. While I remember enjoying my first stay about a year ago, the most recent experience was a disappointing one. I booked through the hotel web-site, requesting a king-size room on a higher floor but was offered a double at check-in. They did find a king-size but on a lower floor. During my two nights stay, I haven’t felt that “extra mile” service that makes a hotel stay memorable. The service you receive is efficient but not outstanding. My corner room was very small. It did have a tiny kitchenette – a faucet, a burner, a microwave, and a mini fridge. However, there were absolutely no dishes or utensils. I was surprised to find no wine glasses or coffee mugs – small touches that you expect from a “luxury hotel” as it labels itself. The bathroom offered minimal toiletries – if you needed anything besides soap, shampoo, or lotion you needed to request from the housekeeping. Another disappointment was the lack of running water for several hours during my second afternoon there – apparently due to maintenance that impacted several floors. The hotel provided no advanced notice or apology. This was a Friday afternoon and having to go to the lobby to use a washroom is an unfortunate inconvenience when you just want to relax in your room after several days of business meetings. I travel to Vancouver very often and have stayed in a number of other downtown hotels. There are definitely better options out there – both in terms of value and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the heart of Shopping in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: fishinwater
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference. The Hotel has pretty good accommodation. I stayed in a room in the South tower which was quite neat and tidy. There were two queen beds in a corner suite which was pretty tight for space. The hotel is quite new and modern and had all the mod cons you would expect for a Sheraton. It's funny but they did not have wireless Internet and you had to lug a LAN cable across the front door of the room to the desk. A bit of a worry but as long as you didn't trip over it, it was OK. Bathroom was as you would expect as well. Facilities are good with a good Gym, Pool, Spa, Sauna and Steam room. The Pool is only 20 metres so not really suitable for doing laps unless you want to get dizzy (or are a slow swimmer). The hotel is located a few blocks from Robson Rd which is the street to go shopping. It is close to Cafe's and the Sears shopping centre as well. Not a bad venue for a conference. Central and easy to access most parts of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Was Great!”
Reviews.Author: ilovejimhalpertt
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay at the Sheraton Vancouver. The room are spacious and well designed, they make me feel very relaxed and the beds are so comfortable. The lobby is very nice too. Very luxurious - and i love how there is a starbucks there! So convenient! The pool is very nice and refreshing, i just love it so much. The location of the hotel is good as well. All in all this hotel is very friendly, convenient and absoloutely stunning and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevboom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference. It's very modern and new-looking with well decorated rooms like a boutique hotel. We had an incredible view of the mountains from our room. The room itself was small, but we had a King room at the end of the rounded hotel, so the "roundness" might have affected our particular room. The hotel has plenty of underground parking with two elevator rides up to your room. We enjoyed being within 2-3 blocks walking distance of Davie and Robson Streets for lots of shopping and dining options. We also walked 8-9 blocks down Granville Street and took the water taxi over to Granville Island for more shopping/dining options--a cool trip! We weren't very close to Canada Place where all the cruise ships dock, but you can walk there too if you don't mind 10-12 blocks in each direction. If you have a rental car, it's worth driving out to the tip of the isthmus to see Stanly Park (Vancouver Aquarium is nice) and crossing over the Lions Gate Bridge to see the Capliano Suspension Bridge with its amazing Treetops Adventure attraction. Try to plan your trip so you aren't crossing the Lions Gate Bridge at rush hour--backs up for MILES AND MILES and will take an hour or so to get through the mess. We actually found some nice restaurants over in North Vancouver along Marine Drive. If you are traveling to Vancouver from the U.S., fly, do not drive across the border. We spent at least 3-4 HOURS both driving into and leaving Canada at the border crossing. It was ridiculous. Don't waste two days stuck in traffic as we did. Also, the drive up to Whistler was very scenic, but road construction in preparation for the Olympics was going on the entire length of this route. Not very fun stopping every 5 miles for a flag man. Vancouver is very nice, I would definitely go back and the location of this hotel makes it a desirable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mewa19
Reviews.Content: I was worried at first when we discovered that our room was in the South Tower after reading reviews on here but I was pleasantly suprised. The room was large and had a king size bed which was incredibly comfortable. The shower was gorgeous as it had just about the right amount of power to relax. The view was good even though we were only on the 8th floor. The staff could not have done more, nothing was too much trouble and the check-in desk staff were exceptionally efficent. There are some great restaurants near the hotel, if you like Thai food I would suggest going to a place called Salai Thai about 5 minutes walk from the hotel, the food was lovely and very reasonably priced. Also, if you like steak and a good atmosphere go to Moxies and I really suggest going to Earls on Robson Street for lunch. To sum up we really enjoyed our stay and this hotel is so near to everything you would want to do. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Nice Rooms, Poor Dining Opions, Security Concerns”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again for a conference. Stayed in the North Tower, which is the more modern, more recently renovated tower and has slightly better rooms than the South Tower. Beware also that the SPG floors are generally in the older South Tower so be sure to ask for North Tower rooms. If you can be upgraded for yoru Starwood status, try to get one of the corner rooms that have wrap around glass and incredible views. Location is nice too. Very little option for eating on premises. The restaurant in the north tower is basically only open for breakfast. The Lobby bar serves light food at night if you are desperate. Room service was very expensive and food quality was poor. Free bottled water in the room daily for Starwood preferred guests. No mini bars - but they do have refirgerators which you can stock yourself. Be mindful of your valuables - while at the conference, my best friend had her room broken into and her credit cards were stolen and used for local purchases. One of the conference planners also found her room door partly ajar when she returned in the late afternoon after it had been serviced/cleaned. Make sure you lock your valuables, wallets and passports in the in-room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: cas22
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and I stayed at the Sheraton Vancouver - Wall Centre Hotel from the 11th to the21st November 2007, it was the most comfortable and friendly hotel I have stayed in for a while, the staff went out there way to help you nothing was too much trouble. The rooms are large with two queen size beds, we were on the 24th floor and the views we could see from our window of the snow covered mountains and English bay / Pacific and most of Downtown Vancouver, were breathtaking, I would defiantly stay there again. The Restaurants I would recommend are Cloud 9 off Robinson St (rotating Restaurant) the views are amazing, most of all the food is tops a good variety menu, need to book your table as it can get very busy later in the evening. Also for a change try the Tapas bar :-BIN 941 in Davie Street, they do not take bookings, but its well worth the visit. It was our first visit to Vancouver, overall we fell in love with the city, friendly people great shops and we used the Sea bus ,sky train and Taxis to get around and found them all reasonable, as two woman travelling on our own around Vancouver we felt very safe, even on the evenings, no need to take fancy clothes they all seem to prefer casual dress.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: katemart
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is not that great. I think the location is pretty good, in the heart of Downtown, with a short walk to all the shops and the wonderful public market at Granvilles Island. The staff were also extremly helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble for them. The food in the hotel was very expensive, especially given the sheer number of restaurants in the city. We had a standard room on the 26th floor of North Tower. The bed was very comfortable but the room seemed poorly arranged, with the TV table blocking the wardrobe and so far away from the bed that I was worried about my neighbours being disturbed by it at night. The loo in the en-suite was right next to the bathroom door and the bath was very small, with a low overflow - more like a large showertray than a bath. You certainly couldn't lie down in it. The complementary toiletries were low quality. There was a large double door which, I think, led directly into next door's room (to turn them into a suite???) but we were able to see the light underneath it and, again, I wondered whether the person next door could hear us. I was surprised to have to pay $10 a day for internet access. I was also concerned about privacy - we had a city view and kept the net curtains open in order to enjoy it but there was an office block and I had a weird phone call on our last morning. All in all, the hotel was OK, but not brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: CanadaGalOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at this hotel, based on the pictures on the website. What a disappointment! There are two towers at this hotel and I was dropped off at the South tower. As it turns out, my room was in the North Tower. Kind of a pain when one arrives late and it's dark. The rooms were very small and the bathroom opened up right into the bedroom. No hallway, so no privacy whatsoever! There was only one chair in the room, even though this was a double room. The walls were incredibly thin and we could hear every sound coming from next door. We could even hear the person hanging up their clothes! Had friends who stayed in the South Tower and they agreed that the rooms were noisey. They were kept awake until 4:00 am by the people talking in the room below them. This was no party -- just normal conversation. Elevators were sluggish and a room card had to be used for all floors in the North Tower. Room service was pricey and food was just fair. I would NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An average place”
Reviews.Author: FromSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. As we're starwood preferred guests, we expected something more. Everything was quite average. Parking is US30,00 a day and they take a long time to get your car: one day we waited for half an hour. The location could be better: at least 2 blocks closer to Robson St. The room was clean and bathroom was of a good size. There's a Starbucks at the hotel, so we had our breakfast there. We noticed that everybody did the same, as the buffet breakfast at their dinning room was very expensive. If I return to Vancouver, I don't think i'd stay at the Sheraton. I'd look for some place closer to the nice restaurants and shops.One or two blocks can be a lot when it's cold and rainy!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Cherimoya
Reviews.Content: I am writing from this hotel now. I am staying in the South Tower. The safe in my first room was the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel and I could not fit my laptop computer into it. I have never seen a safe this small in other hotels (including in developing countries) and did not even think to ask. I would expect that a hotel that charges such inflated rates would at least offer standard sized in room safes. I would not have brought my computer with me if I had known that I could not lock it in the safe. I complained to the concierge and was told that I could leave the computer with them and it would be safe. When I got my computer back, there was a big dent in one corner of the case. I can't prove that they dropped it, because I did not see them do it, but I have never dropped my computer and the dent is new. When I complained to the concierge he was dismissive. I then asked to speak to the manager. He stated that there was little that he could do since it could not be proven that the computer had been damaged in their care. They also make you sign a liability waiver when you drop off your computer. He offered to cut $20 per night from my bill as well as the cost of internet. I insisted that I needed a proper safe for my computer as well and I got moved to a dingy room on a lower floor. There was a problem with ++ heat in the new room and maintenance has just come by and fixed it. I am glad that the manager tried to do something to make up for the damage to my computer (and I accept that I did sign a liability waiver), but I am not really happy with the resolution and I would not stay here in future. I expect better rooms and service for the amount that they charge. Also, the water pressure in the room was really bad. The concierge was helpful with respect to restaurant recommendations and directions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Nice Location.”
Reviews.Author: Rocco2006
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre on July 2007, it was a very good experience, the hotel isn't old, well located, rooms were clean, the staff was very kind. Rooms in the highest floors are better because you have a very nice sight of the city. Breakfast was poor and expensive. The hotel is located very near to all the most important streets of the city, so you can get easily to tourist points. A very good option if you're planning a visit to this Beautiful City.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Fat32blue
Reviews.Content: My wife and i had a wonderful 6 day stay at the Wall Centre. (10-10/10-16) I'd read plenty of reviews prior to departure and the 2 that concerned me the most were: cleanliness and comfort. Five stars for both!!. We were on the 15th floor over-looking the courtyard. The staff was busy but courteous--The food at the hotel is insanely priced but we bypassed that by getting out in the neighborhood and getting some local dining tips from the hotel staff. We decided to stay in one night and called the desk to help us track down a pizza place that delivered. They did it without blinking. Now, the hotel phone system was a bit whacky..from time to time,our calls were being forwarded to the wrong place but that was minor. Overall, a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for us...”
Reviews.Author: rob_n_deb_worldwide
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the beginning of a trip across BC so when we arrived it was straight off the back of a 10 hour flight. When we checked in we were given a room on the 7th floor of the south tower. As soon as we got out of the lift on the 7th floor it stank of stale smoke. When we opened the room to the door, it got worse... As non smokers, this was not pleasant. Our window also overlooked the ER of the hospital and the thought of hearing ambulance sirens at all hours didnt go down too well. We had also looked at this hotel on the internet before coming and were looking forward to the view from the floor to ceiling window in the tallest building in downtown vancouver... So we went to reception and asked for a different room and were allocated a new non smoking one on the 18th floor of the north tower with no problems at all. it was almost as if they were expecting us to complain about the smoke smell. So we check in to the new room and now we're talking... The room was large, clean, smelt a heck of a lot better and the view was a lot better. We didnt eat or drink in the hotel as we only had 2 days and wanted to see as much of Vancouver as possible. We also checked out expressly so didnt really have any dealings with front desk / concierge at all. Overall the hotel was very good for what we wanted and provided a good base for to days, but if Id spent any more money I probably would have expected more. Our only other gripe was with the lifts. The north tower was 40 odd stories high, god knows how many rooms were in there, yet they only had 3 lifts available. One of which was out of action for both days we were there. And one evening, so was one of the others, so you can imagine the carnage of one lift catering for guests on 40 floors of the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Conventry
Reviews.Content: I had thoroughly enjoyable stay at this hotel in early September 2007. Since I was travelling on my own without a car, I was looking for somewhere in a safe and central area, with easy access to fun things to do in the evening. This hotel is a couple of minutes walk from Robson Street - the main shopping street where the shops and restaurants are open late. The hotel is also close to a cinema (useful during Vancouver rain), and a short walk from the main art gallery and other downtown attractions. My room, on the 27th floor of the North tower, was great, with a truly impressive view of the city, harbour and surrounding hills. I found the hotel staff helpful and my requests regarding the room were dealt with very efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “generally good..but....”
Reviews.Author: ilovehawaii
Reviews.Content: Upon check in we had to wait because there was only one person working ...I went to the concierge and asked if this was the only place to check in and was told "yes" and that was it. No "sorry" or an explanation or anything. And of course the people in front of us had a problem and it took quite awhile to sort out. And when we checked out we had someone else's parking bill attached to our statement and once again had to wait while the lone employee dealt with another guest. Having said that the rest of our brief stay was very pleasant...the beds are fabulously comfortable and the room was very quiet. The location is good but I prefer the Four Season or Sutton Place as being just that little bit closer to the heart of downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Macrihanish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week before setting off for a tour of the Canadian Rockies. The hotel was very imposing, in a high tower made of glass. We were on the 15th floor and had beautiful views of the mountains and across the city. Our room was on the small side for a Sheraton but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was lovely with a powerful shower. We didn't eat here as it was very expensive. There are lots of good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Probably a good bet amongst mediocre competition”
Reviews.Author: IncaWalnut
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, our room spacious with a good view. Sheraton do beds very well but bathroom was small and meagre. Vancouver hotels all seem to suffer from coach tours. If you are like me and hate to see baggage piled up in the lobby and check in staff fighting to give yet another anonymous new guest a welcoming smile, you wont be so impressed. Oh...... and what hotel doesn't have a proper bar and boasts Starbucks as an amenity in their in house information!!

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel for you trust me”
Reviews.Author: TheSassyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hello fellow trip advisor travelers. I just returned from my stay at the Sheraton Wall Centre. I travel for a living and my company aranges the accomendations. Therefore while on vacation I do my best to choose wonderful hotels for my travels. Vancouver is a very expensive place but it is soo worth it and hotels are very expensive also so when I looked at the hotels and the cost I felt really lost to say the least. I usually like to stay under 200 a night but in vancouver this is a problem if you want a quality hotel in a good location. We booked through expedia for $208.00. I read the reviews and felt confident in my choice. The hotel was in a wonderful location. If you want shopping, entertainment, museums, starbucks coffee, restaurants this is your place. The hotel is about three blocks from Robson street which is the main shopping/restaurant drag in Vancouver. Really everything is at your finger tips even a 7-eleven across the street for midnight snacking. The room was a standard sheraton room with a wet bar, fridge, safe. Im ok with the four stars for this hotel . The bed was very comfortable with white linen, the room had alot of space. We had a city view on the 11th floor we could have waited for a higher floor but with this room we were able to check in early around noon. The room was clean and modern, and believe me I checked. I even wipe down the entire room with sanitizing wipes. So a clean room is very important to me. I called down for a couple of things and they were there ASAP. Taxis are always there and the three towers of the hotel are beautiful. The conceige was very helpeful and polite. The conceige even gave us VIP passes to get into a blues club. The only thing that was concerning was the plumbing. It's not what you think but every time the hot water in the shower was turned on a loud noise started to sound throughout the entire room. So overall our experience was great. Also please give yourself at least four to five days to explore Vancouver. This was a weekend getaway and we really needed four days. The tours can take up an entire day and your so tired you really need a rest day or a bad weather day in there somewhere. We usually hate to waste a day staying in the hotel but this hotel was so nice we really enjoyed laying in bed for one day. Oh there is one other thing they really should have a jacuzzi in the hotel. They only have a indoor pool. FYI tours to the other islands and the whale watching tours take up an entire day and your very tired after your exploring. So dress very warm (layer) and stay a day or two at a different island a day tour is too much drama and time. We went from a bus at 7am to a boat to the island to a 2nd bus to a ferrie and then a #rd bus ride all in one day only to get back at 9pm. This was our travel plans for a whale watching tour to Victoria. Stay in Vancouver it will take you a week just to cover it. Travel to the other islands only if you have alot of time, because it takes so much time to get back and forth. Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “nice view, but nickel & diming opportunities galore”
Reviews.Author: MichaelInSF
Reviews.Content: I did a three night combination business / leisure stay at the Sheraton Wall Centre in downtown Vancouver. Because I wanted to explore outside Vancouver a bit, I rented a car at the airport and drove to the hotel. The valet guys can park your car or you can park it in the self-park parking deck below the towers (either way, your car ends up in the same place... the only difference is the price, $30 CAD for valet versus $26 CAD for self-park). The self-park entrance is on Hornby street. At check-in time, there was no extra recognition or any extra amenities involved for being a SPG Gold Member. The one SPG Gold perk I did receive was that they did extend my checkout time to 3 p.m. on my last day. I landed in a regular room in the North tower, 15th floor. The floor to ceiling windows gave a spectacular view of the cityscape (I wasn't aimed towards any water at all). Outside the building, it looks to me like some of the windows in the building are openable so you can get some fresh air, but this wasn't the case in my room. There were basic soap bars, shampoo (Pantene) and conditioner bottles in the bathroom. I was annoyed when looking at the half height shower head (i.e. the highest it would adjust was up to my chest), but when I noticed the 2nd peephole at half height in the door, I realized I was in a handicapped accessible room. Indeed, the grips in the bathroom (around the bathtub, around the toilet) were very sturdy and I'd say this room is great for differently abled folks. By the way, this handicapped room had a bathtub and not an accessible shower (with a sit down seat, which I've seen in other handicapped rooms at other hotels), so a differently abled person may require assistance in order to get maneuvered into the tub. The room had a cabinet that hides a room safe (wide enough to put my laptop into) and an empty fridge. The door on this cabinet was broken, the shower curtain bar was barely hanging on, and one of the "down" arrow lights on the elevators in the hallway was burned out; I'd say ongoing maintenance is an issue at this hotel. The closet has a motion sensor so stepping into it turns on a light, which turns off after 5 seconds (too short!) Local & toll-free calls are $1.60 to start with, plus 10 cents per minute after an hour. Room service is $2.75 + 15% service charge PLUS gratuities are expected. Internet is $12.37 for 24 hours access. Breakfast buffet ($22 CAD) didn't taste very fresh when I ate it at 10 a.m. my first morning there. Sundays the Sheraton offers "brunch", which is a later-running ('til 2 p.m.), slightly more elaborate, more expensive ($30 CAD) version of the buffet (Cesar salads, carved roasts, etc.). I picked off the menu for another breakfast and had the Orange Ricotta Pancakes, which was so rich my wife accused me of indulging in "breakfast cake". The portion size of the breakfast items off the menu were huge (i.e. to encourage sharing?) Did you notice I listed the prices for everything in my review? That seemed to be the overwhelming theme of my hotel stay. Every little hotel-related goods & services that a price tag could be slapped on, it sure felt like there was one there. If I stay here again, I'll make sure to get a rate that includes breakfast and I'll just taxi it into town.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View!”
Reviews.Author: momtravelswith3
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here 1 night prior to an Alaska Cruise. We actually redeemed Starpoints for this stay and did not pay any money. The front desk staff was very friendly and treated us just as well as any paying customer. We were assigned a King Bed Room on the 27th floor of the North Tower. The windows went from floor to ceiling and the view was incredible, especially at night. The room was spacious and nicely appointed with a large closet, nice bathroom with amenities ie: shampoo, body wash etc. There were robes in the room for use. The parking cost $25 night which is really outrageous, but you are in downtown Vancouver so what are you going to do? I printed off the driving directions form the hotel website and we had no trouble finding the property. Very simple and a good central location for downtown sights, Stanley Park and the cruise terminals. We used the CruisePark Service while on our cruise and this was easy to get to from the hotel as well. The area seemed safe and lots of tourists were walking around in the evening. Just don't stray too many blocks over or you will see the wrath of east Hastings and it was scary enough just driving past. Wish Vancouver could clean up this part of their beautiful city. There is a Starbucks downstairs, we did not use the restaurant(s) or lounge. In the morning we walked a couple of blocks south to a Sobey's grocery store and purchased pastries and milk etc for breakfast. Would certainly stay again and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm what a sleep!”
Reviews.Author: DiJohnson
Reviews.Content: I am one of those who pours over hotel reviews prior to a trip. Even if it is only to get over to the mainland from Vancouver Island.The Wall was certainly not a letdown. A couple of blocks to Robson Street Shopping and a 1 km walk to GM place the location was perfect. Underground parking was well lit and felt safe. Hotel has wonderful ambience within and the courtyard is elegantly lit at night providing a romantic backdrop. The staff were polite , sincere sounding and accomodating. We were early and our room was not quite ready. The desk pre-checked us in and took our bags for later delivery leaving us free to shop. Arriving back we had a fast ride up the elevator to our 20th floor North Tower corner king room. Floor to ceiling windows on two sides provide a fabulous view. The room was air conditioned upon arrival and easily adjusted. The comfort of the bed made it worth every penny. The room kept out most of the sounds of the city and we did not hear a peep from our naighbors. One night is definetly not enough time to sample all the amenities. Next time we will hit the pool and the Spa services. I have stayed in both higher end and economy hotels in the city and not been beckoned back, however I will be staying at the Sheraton Wall the next time we make it to the mainland!

Reviews.Title: “Plumbing disaster”
Reviews.Author: SheratonWallHotel
Reviews.Content: Check in staff had no personality. Changed room as first room too small for family of 4 and on low floor and noisy. Swapped to north tower, better room but toilet flooded the bathroom and carpet. Changed to another room a few doors along and that toilet also flooded. Cleaner said there is a known problem with plumbing in the north tower. Don't we know it. Eventually on last night given a suite back in south tower,after all the packing up each time, we wondered if it was all worth it. Room decor depressing, brown stained carpet,better in the suite, but as it was our last night we couldn't appreciate it. Fortune to park too. you would think as paying guests it would be nominal, only the Sheratons in Canada charges so much, we were stung in Calgary too.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: countrybird
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 12 th floor, view was not that good, but the room was clean, i would not say this was anything special for the money we had paid. The airconditioning was extremley noisey and on the second night the fan dropped of the cealing in the bathroom, when reported,the staff seemed none too bothered. Location is excellent right in the middle of town, short walk to Robson St.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hardrock360
Reviews.Content: Great views from Deluxe corner room north tower 22nd floor. excellent bedding, floor to ceiling wall to wall glass gives killer view and you can open vent windows for some fresh air. Desk staff was very helpful with directions, restaurant info and travel . CRT TV should have been flat screen; minor item--weren't in this great city to watch TV. Room was quiet and esthetically pleasing. Great location. When checking in, go directly to the north tower desk for the best room selections; don't bother with the main lobby desk at the south tower. Will stay here again; exc value for the money especially when compared to the Met and other pricier offerings. Get as high as possible and the deluxe corner room; only four of these per floor tho.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were terrific; upgraded to penthouse; loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LVinWA
Reviews.Content: Originally booked the 17th floor but at counter, staff was happy to upgrade upon request to the 27th floor in the North Tower overlooking city & harbor. Since the trip was a birthday surprise for myself, I was ecstatic. The Indigo restaurant in main lobby was personable and helpful with local tips; the concierge & bellhops approachable and professional. Go to the Deli-O next door just outside the hotel's main drive in entry on the quiet sidestreet: great breakfast & coffees for reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: heypaula717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights prior to leaving on a cruise to Alaska. We had a room on the 20th floor in the North Tower, and were very pleased with it. The view of the city was great from the floor-to-ceiling windows! The room was clean and well- appointed, with a mini-fridge and in-room coffeemaker, as well as above-average bathroom amenities. Also, the bed was the most comfortable I have encountered in a hotel! However, watch out for the phone charges - even local and toll-free calls incur a hefty fee! The hotel itself is conveniently located in the downtown area - in walking distance to shopping and numerous restaurants. We drove to Vancouver, and I regret that we didn't use the valet parking at the hotel, as the parking area was cramped and difficult to maneuver. So just a suggestion - use the valet! The staff was courteous and efficient, but rather impersonal, if that's important to you. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, impersonal, but decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler33
Reviews.Content: We just stayed a few nights at this hotel in Vancouver with our teenage sons. The family suite works out quite nicely. We had a small bedroom with a king-size bed and the kids each had a bed in the living room. The rooms were clean and the hotel was very well-located for touristing around Vancouver. The staff varied wildly in friendliness. We checked in twice because we went to Victoria in the middle. First check-in really nice front desk and bellman. Second time very impersonal and cold. The hotel gets crowded with conventions and cruise ship passengers. Overall, nice set-up for a family. I think if I were traveling alone I might try a smaller, friendlier place.

Reviews.Title: “So Impersonal.”
Reviews.Author: spitz2
Reviews.Content: The hotel check-in was so impersonal and cold. I felt like she did not even know I was a customer. I was probably speaking entire time except when she said my room number. It was so not welcoming and ruined the entire hotel impression. The room was nice without any characters. It was clean so I did not have much to complain. I prepaid my hotel online ($220) but needed to have a receipt to get business expense back later. A night before, I requested the bill to be printed for express checkout. But in the morning, I found the bill was not delivered. I went to the hotel front desk to ask for the receipt. Again, coldly, without any greetings, the lady just told me to "wait for a moment" then brought the receipt few minutes later, without any thank you or greetings.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: GamecockFan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four-day stay at the Sheraton. Stayed on the 27th floor of the North Tower. What a fabulous view! The bed was top-notch and the view of the city was UNBELIEVABLE. Loved it! The location was good, although we spent a lot of time in Sydney Park, so we probably would've enjoyed being a little closer. But, then, we wouldn't've had that wonderful view each evening when we returned to our room. The concierge was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ADeckerCampbell
Reviews.Content: I thought the Sheraton was a very nice hotel. The rooms were very updated and very clean. The only issue I had was the front desk gal had no personality. There was no warm welcome there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Service!”
Reviews.Author: rclimbing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre for 3 nights in July. The hotel is centrally located especially if you're planning to get on a cruise ship. We stayed in the North Tower and the rooms were large enough to accomodate 4 people comfortably. Good value for the money. In addition, we had great service while we were there. While at the hotel we were looking for a microwave to heat up some pastries and could not find one. We asked at the front desk and 10 minutes later a microwave was sent to our room! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: elmoj25
Reviews.Content: By far the best place I have stayed at in Vancouver! I am from Vancouver Island in Nanaimo and my friend and I came over for a weeked in April after her Grandma died, just to get away. We arrived at the hotel and greeted by our valet who unloaded our car and was very polite and welcoming. Took our bags to the lobby. Our check in person at the front desk was first class. We arrived early and our guy checke us in with no problem. Our origanal reservation was for a $139 room with two double beds and a bathroom on like the 10th floor. However our guy upgraded us for free to the 27th floor!! Our room was a two bedroom, two bathroom, kitchen, living room, dining room, floor to ceiling glass windows, three flat screen TV's one in each room and in the living room. Our butler guy came right up with our luggage and was very nice. Helped us out with everything we needed. The pool/gym was awesome except the walk was not all that great but still worth it. The restraunt there called Indigo was amazing food. So good. Our view from our room was amazing every point of view of Vancouver was seen. We really enjoyed our stay. We our heading back in September and plan to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Too big and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ace31
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the North Tower. The rooms were VERY small, but had a great view. The room refrigerator did not work and staff was unaccomodating to repair or replace. Hotel service was impersonal and unattentive.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Wall Centre - Fantastic Hotel, Excellent Amenities”
Reviews.Author: SpaPampered
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Wall - this beautiful hotel with it's fantastic view of the ocean and N. Vancouver provided us with all the exclusive comforts we enjoy in a fine hotel. The staff was very friendly, the spa and healthclub facilities are excellent and well maintained. We especially enjoyed the infinite edge pool and healthclub included with our stay. The hotel restaurant provided excellent food and service as well. If you're looking to be pampered in Vancouver with an outstanding location, the Sheraton Wall is the total solution.

Reviews.Title: “The Return Of The Police”
Reviews.Author: vegasScotland
Reviews.Content: My wife and i travelled to Vancouver on 25th May,and stayed at The Sheraton Wall Centre for 6 nights. We travelled over specially for 3 concerts by The Police. The service and warmth of the staff was exceptional,as were The Police. I will certainly stay there again when back in Vancouver. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We give this wonderful hotel 5 out of 5. To sum it up in one word S U P E R B. A traveller from Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: just-for-the-ride
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vancouver. I thought the location of the hotel was perfect. Walking distance to shopping, dining, and local park. I usually stay with Starwood hotels. Although pricey, the hotels never dissappoint. Staff was friendly and attenitive. I stayed in the North Tower which I recommend. I can't comment on the food because I eat off the property. You can't go wrong staying here if you like convienience. This city is a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Father's Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: havanahipster
Reviews.Content: Let me qualify my comments by saying I am a Platinum Starwood member, and I can only comment on the rooms in the NORTH tower of this hotel. There is a South tower, too, so read below for my comments on the rooms in that tower. I stayed on the 25th floor of the NORTH tower, and I was rewarded with floor to ceiling windows and a complete panorama view of the mountains, water, and city. The room decor was more along the lines of a Park Hyatt, (flat screen TV, blonde wood, updated bathrooms) and I have to say I was shocked this was a Sheraton because it was so nice. I did see the inside of the rooms in South tower--ick. These are the standard, run-of-the-mill Sheraton rooms with the marroon bed spreads, worn carpets, and 1990s Zenith TV. The location is killer--steps away from great shopping on Robson and eateries are right around the corner. Be nice to the front desk person and maybe they'll give you a NORTH TOWER room. You won't be disappointed. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Way to go, Starwood. If only they would make all U.S. Sheratons look like the North tower rooms of this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: creamslacks
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the sheraton wall centre for the third time and it just gets better. I stayed in the North tower this time, in a corner deluxe room whic was stunning and only $20 more than the basic room. Worth the upgrade. Unfortunately i lost my passport whilst in Canada and the staff couldnt have been more helpful. Is the only hotel to stay in and the location is great

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: torrihoward
Reviews.Content: My husband along with our two teenage daughters took a mini vacation to Vancouver BC over Easter weekend and we stayed at the Sheraton. We arrived late on Friday evening and had no trouble checking in. My husband elected to park the car in the garage - which we had a difficult time finding parking, but valet service was available. The front desk staff was very courteous and promptly got us checked in. We did not request a room on a high floor (my fault) and ended up on the 7th floor which was fine. We had a junior suite - which was like walking into our own little apartment. The main area had a nice flat screen tv and two double beds. There was a bedroom with a king size bed and a closet. The room was very comfortable and warm and nicely decorated. Our girls had a little trouble sleeping as the hospital was directly across the street and they heard the ambulances during the night, but noise is to be expected when you are staying downtown. The hotel itself was very quiet. The shower had nice water pressure and the beds and pillows were the best! The hotel had a couple of restuarants but the line to the Cafe was way too long for us to go in. We stopped at Starbucks our first morning and then went to Denny's the next morning, which was a short walk down the street. The movie theatre is also a short walk as is everything around there. We drove to the aquarium at Stanley Park and up to Capilano Bridge, which was a quick drive to both attractions. We also drove to Metropolis mall which was on the Eastside of Vancouver - about a 30 minute drive. The pool/workout facilities were nice although the pool is not very deep. Parking was not always great - the garage was too confusing, but we found that to be the case everywhere. Not very well designed. Checkout was a breeze and once again the staff was very courteous. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiCalgary
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Wall Center in Downtown Vancouver is definitely what I would recommend. Myself and a girlfriend (age 25) stayed for our girl's shopping weekend and it was perfect. Check in was very quick, we requested a high-up room and got the 24th floor, the view was awesome! Complimentary bottled water, a little fridge, very comfortable beds, nice bathroom, a TV. everything we needed. we could walk to Robson Street for shopping and Granville Street also. There is an IGA Market right there, Starbucks in the hotel, a movie theater close by. We also walked to Granville Island. It is very very clean, the staff do a wonderful job. Upon arriving, there was an unsightly stain on one of the comforters, it was about 10 minutes before a new one was brought up. Very nice. All in all, our experience was perfect, I would definitely recommend the Sheraton to anyone. The only thing to watch out for is that all local calls are $1.70! It wasn't made clear to us, and we had a calling card even, but were still charged that each time we dialed out. The front desk was kind enough to take half the charges off....but keep that in mind! our cell phones would have been cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, bad first impression”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelCalgary
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vancouver quite a lot in the past staying at different hotels in Vancouver or Richmond. Sheraton Wall Centre is quite a new building I believe, it looks great on the outside and the room which we had. This is our first time staying at this location, thinking the guest service level would be just as good as the outside of the building. But no we were so wrong. The check in person did not do much of a guide nor direction when we check in. Considering there are 2 towers where all the guest rooms are located. She did not protray a friendly welcome nor even a smile was the first thing we notice. As soon as she gave us our key card, while I was signing the form and pointed to the north tower without making sure that I knew which north tower was. No directions given on how to get there nor a map or guide. We had to gone to a residentail tower(located between the North and South) by mistake, and we had to run back and forth to find out which is the correct tower to go to. Not very helpful at all and first impression of this hotel is not good. Nice hotel does not mean good service. Also, what on earth is a residential tower doing in between the hotels where guest can easily mistaken that it's the North Tower or the South tower

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and amazing Property!!”
Reviews.Author: innharmony
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wall Centre for 2 nights in early February!! Terrific Views from our floor. Great Front desk and Concierge services. Were told about some Great places to eat nearby (WEST) & (Rain City Grill) Both very good and nice locations, Did some heavy shopping and then back to the hotel, the rooms are nicely appointed and the Bed was very comfortable. Will stay here again in the Future!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaResident
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the wall centre this past weekend and loved every minute of it! I have stayed at many hotels in Vancouver and this is one of my new favs! The location is perfect! Very safe, quiet area, did not see one street person! The hotel was very easy to find and a very quick walk from Robson Street. The valet staff were very fast and efficicent as were the check in staff. The hotel room was beautiful! We had a two bedroom suite and the views were amazing!!! The suite was very clean and modern. The bedding was divine I had the best sleep ever! Nice ammenities, a great shower. I could not believe how quiet it was, very rare for Vancouver... The living room had a flat screen TV and lots of seating for visiting with friends. The suite also had a full kitchen, also very handy. I will be back for sure, you can't go wrong with the Sheraton Wall Centre!!

Reviews.Title: “Much staff training required”
Reviews.Author: foogirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 5 days and overall found it to be an excellent hotel in terms of comfort, maintenance and location, however, it was really let down by the staff and facilities. The check in staff need to learn how to give a friendly welcome, the portering staff watched us struggle across the plaza in torrential rain with 4 heavy bags and only offered help when we got to the covered door area. On arriving in our room, the dirty towels from the previous occupant were still there and on calling for it to be dealt with, the housekeeper seemed to have problems with the sentence "please re-clean the bathroom and leave us fresh towels" Three attempts later, we had fresh towels. We went to order room service and were immediately confused as there is a North Tower number and a South Tower number, but nowhere did it tell us which tower we were in. Once ordered (from disinterested and abrubt staff) it arrived quickly and was very tasty, and reasonably priced. I highly recommend the French Onion Soup Gratin. The menu is limited though, and could do with some lighter lunch options such as sandwiches. Day two our towels were removed and not replaced. Again housekeeping seemed to have problem with the request "Can we have fresh towels please" Throughout our stay, we made several requests of the concierge, most of which had to be followed up with a second call an hour or so later. There is no option for internet use for short term users. We were looking for internet use for an hour or so but would have to pay the $14 daily charge to use the business centre. The restaurant options on site are also very limited. Laundry service is extortionate at $3.50 to launder a pair of socks. Luckily we found a laundrette close by. There was also a lack of local information for tourists and visitors alike. Overall we enjoyed our stay but the Sheraton needs to train their staff in the basic art of customer service and provide more local information for their visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Canada”
Reviews.Author: Vinzeph
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited Canada, Mainland US and Hawaii last February 2006 and our stay at the Sheraton Wall Centre in Vancouver was the highlight of our trip. We were given a very lovely room in one of the higher floors. Though the room is a bit smallish, it was adequate to our needs and the room was absolutely wonderful with soft comfortable bed. Staff are very polite and helpful and are always willing to answer your queries regarding the area (e.g., where to dine, shop, get a bargain, etc.) The location of the hotel is very central and is within walking distance to major attractions in Vancouver. And at the end of the day, after an exhausting sightseeing and shopping, it is always nice to come back and relax at the Sheraton Wall Centre... Would definitely stay there the next I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: alixd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre over the US Thanksgiving vacation, and it was wonderful. I had read some of the picky reviews on this site, and was kind of apprehensive about actually staying in the hotel, but my experience was quite good. I called the night before I went, and requested a room on a high floor, which they gave me. The room I requested, however, was not a king room like I had originally booked, but that was fine for one night (in fact I kind of wish I'd stayed with the two queens the entire trip. The room was bigger and on a higher floor). I requested that night though, that if a king bed on a high floor were to open up the next day, please give me a call. Which the next morning they did. I had to move down two floors (to the 21st floor), but the direction it was facing was much better and I had a nice bay view. Absolutely stunning. In the morning when the sun was shining through the clouds, I could have stayed there forever. Although the hotel is not highly rated for couples, I came here with my boyfriend, and we both thought it was fine. The only slight problem was that the room service was a little slow. We ordered water due to the fact that tap water was undrinkable (Vancouver had had a deluge of rain, so sediment was mixed in with the drinking water everywhere in the city), and it came about an hour and a half later. This hotel has great rates, clean, bright rooms, comfortable beds, nice showers, and friendly staff. It's definitely not a five-star hotel, but for a four-star, I'd say it does extremely well.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps Getting Better”
Reviews.Author: fortq
Reviews.Content: Great view in many rooms . High standards of maintenence and close to the reasonable restaurants of Davie St. All of downtown is accessible from the hotel. Good parking

Reviews.Title: “Sort of average with some great views”
Reviews.Author: imagine71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre before and remembered it somewhat better than I found it to be this time. The room was in the North Tower with great views of downtown Vancouver and was in good condition with a comfortable bed. The location of the Sheraton Wall Centre is very good - pretty much in the heart of Vancouver. What disappointed me was the pretty unattentive and uncaring attitude of the staff. The moment I arrived the bellmen watched me getting my luggage out of the taxi, barely taking the time to point me towards the front desk in the South Tower. After a fast and effecient check-in I had to carry my bags across the courtyard to the North Tower with anybody ever asking whether they could offer any assistance. I didn't care too much, but this is something that never happened to me before in a four star hotel. As said the room quality and location are good, it's just lacking service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful at night”
Reviews.Author: sheratonreview
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice, once in 2003 and once this year, in 2006. There are two towers, North and South. I've stayed in both. I personally think the view is nicer from the South tower but the North tower is newer so the room is more modern. And, it's more spacious. The entrance to the hotel is beautiful, very romantic with the tree lights and water fountain. I reccommend this hotel if you want a romantic stay. The one thing I didnt like was the cleaning staff moved my things when they were cleaning my room. I appreciate the fact that they wanted to tidy it up but I dont really like people touching my things. They placed my carry-on in the closet and even folded the clothes that were laying on the bed! And in the morning, there was a knock on the door around 9am? I was still sleeping. But I had a nice stay at this hotel. Staff could be friendlier tho. Oh, tip: if you want to save money, dont book a room on the hotel's website, choose a different website. I find the rates to always be higher at the hotel's website.

Reviews.Title: “Superb views + comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: nath100
Reviews.Content: This is a luxurious hotel - we stayed here on our very last night in Vancouver. Our room was on the 28th floor and we had a great view out over the city looking towards the harbour. The windows are from floor to ceiling! The hotel is in a central location just round the corner from shops, bars and restaurants. The beds are the most comfortable I’ve ever slept in - you can even buy them! A great hotel right in the middle of the city - a great way to finish a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Average Business Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Wall Centre is composed of two towers. The one we stayed in (North Tower) is the newer of the two. The location is fantastic right in the center of town. There is an excellent health club and a spa attached to the property. The hotel is suitable for business travel and caters to conventions. There is very limited soundproofing and the rooms are very noisy. Starting at 5am you hear the traffic. Lackluster toiletries, average room finishes. This hotel is nothing special and I would only stay here again if it was a bargain rate.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rugbytrisha
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the sheraton last month and found the rooms very comfortable, the staff very friendly and helpful. The only downside was the fact the hotel was made up of two buildings the north & the south towers with some facilities in each.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience at the Sheraton Wall Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: B-Lynd
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the Sheraton Wall Centre Hotel in late August for 2 nights and again for 3 nights at the beginning of Sept. 2006. Our experience was good both stays. I had tried to book on line but their web site kept not allowing me to complete the transaction with a message that the site was temporarily down. I called the reservation line and explained my problem and tried to book a room. I was eventually able to get the rate promised on the website even though I booked through the reservation line. We requested and got the North Tower, king room. We were very happy our room was ready when we arrived at a little after 12 noon but we were a bit disappointed that the room was small for a 4 star hotel. We were offered an ungrade to a larger room for $30. more but decided we could manage with the smaller room. On our first stay we had a view of the city from the 24th floor which was impressive. The floor to ceiling windows were great. (It was also possible to open 2 small windows for fresh air.) Our room was very hot when we arrived and the A.C. seemed to not be working. We reported this to the front desk and went out to do some sight seeing and it was fixed when we returned. The bathroom had pretty decent lighting though the shower pressure was a bit weak, we surmised it was because of the high floor. Staff was helpful. Housekeeping called us back to check to see the extra luggage rack we had requested had arrived. It hadn't, but within a few minutes of their call we had it. Out second stay we got the North Tower king room we had reserved, but were the 11th floor. Much less view and overlooking some ventilators, but we did apprciate the buildings effort to attempt to conceal some of the utilitarian machinery with decorative mesh screening. The shower pressure was much better than the room on the 24th floor. We liked the local a lot. It is away from the cruise line area and quieter. We also found a delightful coffee shop for breakfast called Joe's on Davie Street near Thurlow Street, a couple of blocks away from the hotel. A bit farther on Davie St. we found a shoe repair store (curtesy of the staff at Joe's who looked it up in the phone book when we asked about a repair store. They really went above and beyond!) It felt like a real neighborhood up there. (There were a few people down on their luck in a doorway or two, but they were just sitting and not begging) We found the least expensive postcards for our entire trip at a novelty store we passed. Our best experience at this hotel was dining at one of the restaurants in the South Tower, "Indigo". We had gotten in late from the ferry from Victoria and arrived at about 9:40 pm, and they close at 10 pm. We were worried the staff would be grumpy at such late arrivals but the waitress could not have been more gracious. Out food was delicious, a surprise at a hotel restaurant, and we did not feel rushed by the staff at all. I would recommend this hotel and plan to stay there again if I return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Dave'n'Rach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of our 3 week vacation in Canada, and enjoyed it so much we stayed here again for 1 night before flying home to UK. The bed was EXTREMELY comfortable. Hotel was very convenient for all locations. Stayed in the south tower. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would have no hesitation before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PC2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the North Tower for 5 days in August 2006. Initially we had a high room overlooking Burard Street which turned out to have a nice view but was incredibly noisy from the traffic. We asked to move to the other side of the hotel which the staff did and although the view was not as good at least we could sleep at night. All in all I would stay here again as the location is good with easy access to Robson Street and a small supermarket located just down Burard

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: Dimu
Reviews.Content: We ( my husband, 7 month old son, and myself) stayed in the Sheraton for 5 days in August and had a family size room- South tower- with a bedroom that had a double bed and then a king size bed in the sitting area. Check in was fast, but no crib was put in the room as I had requested. I had first put the request in writing on the booking page, and then when I called the hotel to add an extra night to our booking I told the reservations clerk that we need a crib and she curtly responded to me that " yes, I know as you already stated it in your on line reservation". I told her that I was just making sure as we needed it for the extra night too. We had to call the front desk 3 times to get the crib to our room and it was very late already when we arrived and my baby needed to sleep. Our room layout was nice as we had a bedroom for our baby to sleep in and we could watch TV or talk without disturbing him. The furnishings were a little worn, but the bed was comfortable. The walls were very thin, and we could hear the people above us cough, and could hear their TV. The room key needed to be used for the elevator and maybe worked half the time. We were not the only guests that were frustrated by this, and had to wait many times for someone else to use their key so we could get to our room, and had to use our key to help others get to their room. The key then would not work in the room either and we would need to get it activated again. We went down twice to use the hot tub ( they actually have two) but never got to use it as one was empty for our whole stay, and the other was having water added to it one night meaning that the temperature was only warm, and then the next night it was closed for chemical reasons. They should wait until the health club is closed to do this maintenance or make sure that at least one of the tubs is working. I found that most of the staff were only lukewarm, and not too friendly. We travel to Vancouver often for my husband's work and have stayed in some of the nicer hotels. We will not be returning to the Sheraton as we found the service and rooms to be much better at other hotels in Vancouver, especially since it is comparable in price to many of the nicer hotels. It was nice to have a one bedroom suite, but many other hotels can provide that too for the same price, and with better service. I would book again at the Four Seasons as even though the rooms were a bit dated too, everyone there was very courteous and friendly and we never had any problems with our room key, or having our baby stay with us.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Slenderbiscuits
Reviews.Content: As I had read in other reviews the rooms are pretty small but it's like the Ikea geaks came in here and outfitted the place. They pack a lot of stuff into this small space. My wife, our 3 yr old, our newborn and I all fit into the room no problem (complete with all the attachments that go with kids) We stayed in the north tower (new tower) The location is very central, Robson street is very close and the shopping there is very good. You can cover all of the major attractions (stanley park, granville island....) in a cab at $10 a crack. My wife had a massage in the Vida spa in the hotel (very nice). I recommend taking the limo from the airport ($40) Cab is $30. Pool is pretty nice. Beds are fantastic! Overall it was pretty nice. I would also consider the Westin Bayshore, it is right on the water by the marina with lots to see.

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: capejoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre as part of the Rocky Mountaineer package and although it is very central, we wouldn't particularly want to stay there again. The check in process was pleasantly smooth but our room had a very strange layout with 2 beds diagonally opposite one another. The second bed was in a large window space and the area looked as if it would be more suited to a sitting or office area and the bathroom was very small. The little restaurant/cafe had a most opinionated manager who made you feel like he was doing you a real favour to let you sit in his little fiefdom. We didn't feel it lived up to its rather stunning external look and certainly wouldn't want to stay there for any length of time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: minirose
Reviews.Content: Our room had an overpowering smell of mildew and when I told the desk staff I was told "That is our Traditional Room". Fortunately we were only there one night. The desk clerk told me they were giving us a south tower room with a great view. Our "great view" was of the North Tower. Staff was unhelpful when we asked for directions and at times rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: schippk
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 17th floor of the north tower and liked our room very well. It was not immense, but the floor-to ceiling windows created an almost dizzying view and sense of space. Our room (1761) faced west, giving us views of the mountains to the north, a sliver of English Bay visible between two other high-rises, and Burrard Inlet. The furnishings were all in a sleek modern style, but a bit scuffed in places. The bed linens were luxurious and the mattress was the most comfortable I have ever slept on. The room had an iron and ironing board, plus extra blankets (but not pillows) in the closet. One annoyance was that all the lights are on a "master switch" located unobtrusively near the door, so I spent the first five minutes flicking the light switches on and off to no avail until I discovered that the master switch had to be turned on before anything else would work. The maid service was almost too attentive, as on the first afternoon we were there a maid opened our door without knocking. She was profusely apologetic and extremely polite, and I am sure it was an honest mistake, but it reminded me to close the deadbolt. The hotel's location is fairly convenient to the major sights in downtown Vancouver, but there are plenty of unsavory characters wandering around the neighborhood at night, as the area is not completely gentrified yet. Unless you are about 14 years old and heavily into body piercing, forget about Robson Street, whose reputation as a shopping and see-and-be-seen destination became undeserved about five years ago. The good clubs, shops and restaurants are in Yaletown a few blocks east of the Sheraton. The front desk staff were friendly and polite. We arrived very early in the day before the room was ready, and needed to change clothes to go to a formal luncheon. They kept our bags for us and let us change in the locker room of the health club. The parking garage is too small and infernally difficult to navigate. We actually "lost" our car at one point, because the markings on the garage wall didn't seem to correspond to those on the elevator buttons. Fortunately the front desk set us straight (it turns out that there are two level "P2s," and to get to one of them you press elevator button "B" instead of "P2,") but I think they could make that a little clearer. Anyway, it is a beautiful hotel and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Summer vacation”
Reviews.Author: SL.123
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here for our summer vacation. As noted with other reviews, I requested a room on the upper levels. This was done with my tour operator & also by email with the hotel. On arrival we were told that no upper rooms were available. A bit disappointing considering the amount of notice I'd given the hotel but once we were in our room we couldn't complain as the view was of downtown looking towards Stanley Park with the mountains in the background. The room itself was well finished with enough space for a family of four. The leisure club has a good size pool with a couple of hot tubs, steam room, sauna & fitness room. All the usual facilities like towels & lockers are supplied. The hotel is in a great central location in the heart of downtown within easy walking distance of Canada Place, Stanley Park, Granville Island & Kits Beach. It's a short walk to Robson Street with its shops & restaurants. The staff are very friendly & couldn't do enough for us, one of the bar staff was particularly friendly & gave us useful tips on places to visit & places to eat. Bar prices are what you'd expect from a city centre hotel, not bad though. We can't comment on the quality of restaurants apart from breakfast which we only had the once. This was perfectly fine & enjoyed what we had although a little pricey compared to local restaurants. If you're looking for good quality at reasonable prices I'd try out the White Spot, The Red Robin or Milestones, all within a 10 minute walk. Having the two towers is good as there's plenty of space but you feel that the restaurants are spread all over the place, as we didn't use them we can hardly complain. There's a Starbucks in the North Tower, lower level & a 7-11 round the corner. A great way to start your family holiday is to take a limo from the airport, Limo Jet Gold are outside the arrivals terminal & charge $41 to downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A View of Business Buildings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to a BC Lions game and Canada Place and thought that the Sheraton Vancouver - Wall Centre was a perfect location. It is a perfect location but definitely not all that I had hoped it would be. The view from our room was of business buildings - not the ocean or the mountains as I had thought was implied from a room with a view. The room was small and the cost was well beyond what it should have been. If you're looking to spend this amount of money then I would definitely recommend looking for a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Given the incorrect room”
Reviews.Author: tokyocitygirl
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room(as a SPG member)with a King-Sized Bed but was given a room with two beds. When I phoned down to the reservation desk, the lady told me that there were no more rooms with King sized beds left. It would've been nice to have received an apology up-front instead of having to make a complaint or being 'unpleasantly surprised.' Perhaps they didn't think I would complain?
