The next day, I was placed in the proper room but it was a hassle having to change rooms. I probably wouldn't stay there again just because of the experience mentioned above. However, the Hotel Spa was great.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel. Loved this place.”
Reviews.Author: mattdmccord
Reviews.Content: What a magnificent property. Stayed for three nights at the end of June 2006. Beautiful view with floor to ceiling windows, excellent location right in the heart of a lovely city, huge lobby with first class service. Starbucks inside on the lower lobby (which I very much enjoyed). Chose to pay $20 plus tax per day to valet my car, which I thought was a little steep. Otherwise this hotel was splendid... I'd return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: antnic1
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for two nights at the end of May. We had a suite on the 19th floor of the north tower. We would have had wonderful views of the ocean and mountains but for the cloud that seemed to hug the mountains the whole time we were in Vancouver. The room was very clean, spacious and modern. The only slight complaint we had was when we were checking out after picking our hire car up the lady on reception tried to charge us $20 just to park and put our luggage in the car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Place to visit”
Reviews.Author: Skiboy 20/20
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to Vancouver as part of a trip around the West of Canada, myself and my partner had the pleasure of staying at the Sheraton Wall Centre for 4 nights. Without a doubt, this hotel was one of the best hotels we've ever stayed, in fact the Sheraton Group hotels lived upto their name not only here but in Calgary Eau Clair Suites at the end of the trip aswell. The hotel is superb and it's rates were excellent. Yes you can find cheaper, but you simply pay for what you get in Canada and this hotel simply excelled in both comfort and service. The staff and front office reception were both friendly and helpful and the consierge offered a very efficient and professional service. The hotel is plush, clean and modern with excellent facilities including a great pool and Jacuzzi. The rooms are large and offer fantastic views over the high rise scrappers of downtown Vancouver with additional views over the mountains and bay area depending on the direction from your room. We stayed in a non smoking room on the 31st floor and simply couldn't complain. However, if you don't like heights, then maybe a lower floor would suite as the floor to ceilng windows offer a full wall panorama of the city and there's absolutely no doubt as to the height of the room! Rooms were clean promptly and on time and the room facilities and complimentaries are great. You receive a daily newspaper at no charge and each room has a safe in the cupboard for your valuables without additional charges. The beds are very comfortable and large with luxurious duvet and pillows. The room has cable television, internet access and movies on demand. Getting there from the airport is easy by cab or shuttle bus and costs around $25CDN. The shuttle to the airport leaves outside the door and so do all the sightseeing excursions which can be booked from reception. If you aim to take a late flight, the hotel will look after your cases and bags if you have to check out before you intend to leave Vancouver. Great Hotel and Great place to visit...Vancouver really is a lovely place to visit and the hotel made the stay even more special. We paid about $190 per night but it was truly worth it and would certainly return. My score 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: mjbogdanov
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel through Club Intrawest. Nice views--floor to ceiling windows. Not much to really criticize but not much to rave about either. The room (a one bedroom suit) was tiny. Teeny tiny. We are accustomed to an accomodation with at least a kitchen. Here we had a microwave but that is all. Also, internet access was only provided for a fee. The restaurant in the South Tower -- Indigo-- was very good with excellent service and delectible treats. Would more than likely look to alternate arrangements next time as overall I felt that I could surely do better dollar for dollar elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cinemascope windows in corner suite”
Reviews.Author: Rantin rover
Reviews.Content: We stopped off in Vancouver and stayed here for a couple of nights in April 06. Very impressive modern looking hotel quite close to the Art Gallery but located quite far from the harbour. We had no trouble checking in (despite fact that it was very early in the morning) and had assistance from bellboy to take luggage across from reception in one tower to the one we were staying in (sorry can't recall names). We had deluxe suite with corner location for all round views from the wall to ceiling windows. The view was of the surrounding cityscape - which was different for us in a good way - we live in a rural setting at home. Bed was luxurious and furnishings all modern and tasteful - good facilities incl tea/coffee making, iron & board, safe, etc. We used turn-down service one night which was first class. Maid went to detail of placing my wife's lucky brown bear toy on her pillow - I got the chocolates! - radio tuned to local station playing romantic tunes and dimmed lights. We had a drink in the bar which had quite a few people who I think were attending a conference but it was relaxing in any case. Breakfast in restaurant on ground floor was very good (large choice and well served by friendly waiter). We had dinner out in a small Italian restaurant very nearby - in direction of Art gallery - excellent food and service but very pricey too! We didn't get a chance to try out the leisure facilites so can't comment on them. In summary the hotel was very comfortable and the staff we had dealings with were all very helpful and friendly. Because of the location it is more likely that you will come across people on business but that's true of many city hotels throughout the world - and it didn't detract from our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view.”
Reviews.Author: AJBLONDON
Reviews.Content: We had requested a room on a high floor after reading other reviews of this hotel, upon check in we were told we had the choice of several rooms but if we didn't mind waiting 30 minutes that a room on the Eighteenth floor could be prepared, we were happy to do this and they managed a Twentieth floor room in the North tower. The room was furnished to a high standard in a modern contemporary style and had an incredible panaramic view from the curved glass window which constituted one wall of the room, the bed was possibly the most comfortable I have ever slept in. We ordered room service one evening which was prompt, delicious, good value and combined with the night time view of the city a memorable dining experience. If eating breakfast in the hotel instead of ordering a full breakfast have some eggs with a side order, exactly the same but cheaper. The hotel is in a good location and within easy walking distance of most attractions and shopping areas, some other cheaper hotels are in less salubrious areas. Despite what the Vancouver authorities promote, Gas town is not the tourist heaven you would think, Grotty and derelict are two words that spring to mind, put aside a maximum of Five minutes to admire the 1970's built steam clock and then move on to Granville Island. Do also visit the Cappelano suspension bridge and treetop adventure, it's a little expensive but great fun, kids will love it. Five minutes further is the Grouse mountain cable car which again is good fun however if you are touring the Rocky mountains Jasper and Banff both Offer better Cheaper alternatives. We really could not find any fault in the Sheraton wall hotel or the staff. we would definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tlcarlson
Reviews.Content: i stayed here during the 4th of July weekend in the summer of 2005. this location is great. i left my car parked all weekend. you can walk to everything, Chinatown, Yaletown, the water front. one of the best beds i have ever slept in, oh so cozy. it would also be very nice for business travelers

Reviews.Title: “Nice views - ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: starladear
Reviews.Content: We had a pretty good room, the view was beautiful - we could see english bay, the snow capped mountains and the city christmas lights all from our small room. I think you need to ask, ask and don't forget to ask! - for a higher floor with a view. Yes the rooms are small, but the beds are comfy and the room clean. We didn't try the room service or dining as ofcourse being the sheraton was a tad too expensive for us. Was internet capable, but expensive (again its the sheraton).

Reviews.Title: “I'm getting frustrated with this hotel, yet keep staying here”
Reviews.Author: occupier
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the past, and sometimes I like it and sometimes I don't. On this trip, I arrived at 1:00pm - and since the hotel was sold out the previous night, I had to wait until 3:00 before my room was ready. No big deal, I would use the fitness center and kill some time - what a great excuse to NOT plug in and work :) I found a change room and gave my luggage to the bell desk - not a personality among them. Oh well. The fitness center is small but I did my work outs - aside from the size and few equipment, bring water! There is a machine in the cardio room so you can BUY water, but the nearest fountain is through the bathrooms, past the saunas and near the pool. A bit ont the inconvient side - but still no big deal. Once checked into the room, I discovered that the blow dryer is one of those attached to the walls - and only spits out a maximum of 1200watts of of a warm breeze. Being a woman with long hair, I need a REAL dryer. I called downstairs for another, and they didn't have any. So, even if the one in your room breaks, they didn't have any at all! So, a small thing like a blow dryer gave me two days of wet/bad hair days. Guys - may not understand...women - I hope you are with me and bring your own blow dryer! Otherwise, the Sheraton is within walking distance (if it is not raining) of many things. Vancover is a fantastic walking city! So, the hotel had a nice bed, big room, good view of the bay - from what I could see from my room, large bathroom...but it is the small things that you miss.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A solid 3 star Sheraton. Stayed for 2 nights in mid-March. Check in was smooth, got an upper floor club level room as requested. The lobby is small & the doors open & close constantly. With the damp weather it made for a spot you definitely wouldn't spend any time in. The room was fine, comfortable bed & a sitting area divided by a full wall...made for 2 small rooms as opposed to one larger one. Agree with previous posts that internet access was impossible to navigate. Water pressure was great. Used the gym both mornings...need to arrive right at 6am if you hope to get access to cardio equipment - 6 treadmills, 2 elipticals, 2 bikes & 2 stairmasters. Pool looked ok & weight rooms were separate & not crowded. The restaurant for breakfast is in the North tower, as is the gym. Parking/check in is in the south tower...not the most convenient layout & the restaurant is rather small for a hotel of this size. One morning I waited for 20 minutes in line before going downstairs to Starbucks. All in all a fine choice for a 2-3 night stay...great location & clean...a solid 3 star. If you're looking for something more special & dont mind spending a bit more check out the Wedgewood.

Reviews.Title: “leave your computer at home”
Reviews.Author: godard17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre hotel, the site of an academic conference which I attended, on 1-4 March 2006. As soon as I arrived, I retired to my room to work on the paper that I was going to present the following day. I purchased a 24-hour internet access option from my room, sat on the bed, and looked for an outlet where I could plug in my notebook computer. There were none available, so I unplugged one of the plugged in plugs (specifically, the one that powers the "mock" refrigerator) and plugged the computer cable in. I saw a spark. I didn't think much of it, unplugged the cord and started working on battery. A couple of hours later, my battery ran out, so I proceded to recharge it using a different outlet, to avoid a second spark. I discovered at that point that the computer charger had become unusable. I ran downstairs to the front desk and explained the situation to the Guest Service Supervisor. He contacted tech support and they advised me to go to the Business Center, e-mail the document to myself, retrieve it on one of the computers there and continue to work. At that point, my battery only had a few more minutes of life left. I was greatly distressed, because I was risking being unable to work on a presentation that was the entire reason why I had travelled to Vancouver. I followed the tech support's advice and spent half the night in the Business Center, rather than in the comfort of my own room, which cost me almost 200 Canadian dollars a night. I asked the Supervisor whether Sheraton was going to take responsibility for what had happened on their property -- a short circuit -- and he said: "Absolutely not." He then claimed that once I discovered that there were no available outlets near the bed I should have called housekeeping and requested an extension. This is simply absurd. I would call housekeeping to fix a faulty toilet, but not to unplug something out of the wall and plug something else in its place. This accident caused me a significant amount of distress, both emotional and financial. I was seconds away from losing my work, the night before my presentation was due, I was unable to use my computer throughout my stay, and I had to replace the charger after I returned home. The Sheraton Wall Centre failed to live by the standards they claim to abide by in their "One Voice/One Vision" statement prominently displayed in every room: exceeding guests' expectations, excellence, high standards of service, integrity, fairness, and particularly responsibilty. I was extremely disappointed by my stay at the Sheraton Vancouver Wall Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Lucyspoileddog
Reviews.Content: I had booked my room at least 45 days in advance, and requested a king room on an upper floor. I was very disappointed that upon check in they issued me a room with 2 double beds on the 7th floor. Once I realized it was a double, I went back to the front desk and insisted on a king. The only king available was a room for disabled guests on an even lower floor. I took that one, since the bed was the most important factor. I really have no idea whether the views on the upper floors are so wonderful, since I never saw them. I do think they should change their room descriptions since they obviously don't describe them all. The bed was very, very comfortable (you can even purchase them) but overall, the rest of the experience was very average or even frustrating (the ATM in the lobby never worked, the gift shop was not open as late as they claimed, front desk gave wrong information, etc.). I would try another hotel next time I'm in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dux86
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. Rooms have breathtaking views from floor to ceiling windows, service is polite and efficient, room service was EXCELLENT. Location is good, not quite as convenient as some other hotels in the area but still a very easy walk to the harbor area and the major shopping drags. Overall, this hotel has a very "modern" feel to it and I highly recommend it to any potential travellers to Vancouver. A tip: this hotel is often on Hotwire (4.5 stars) for a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: christinern
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wall Center in Jan. 2006. When we went to check in at 5:30pm, we were told our room was having some maintenance done, and were given the option to wait approx. 10 minutes, or have another room on a lower floor in the other tower. We decided to wait for that room ( which was on the 27th floor in the north tower). It took an hour before the room was ready, and I had to go up to the check-in desk twice to inquire about it. Once the room was fixed, we never found out what the maintenance was for, we got to our room. What a view of the city, mountains adn ocean, loved the huge windows!! Only bad thing was we could hear all the traffic and buses on the street 27 floors below, and we could hear a baby crying on the floor below us, so the hotel is not very soundproof. The beds are great, shampoo and lotion etc. is luxurious. We loved the room service breakfast and the fast elevators. We enjoyed our stay, mainly because of the view and the well decorated rooms. Would definitely stay there again...as long as we could have another great view!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: flymo68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2005 Great location, great views from the room,(North Tower) Huge room, but bathroom was a tad small. Beds were very comfortable, everything very clean. Staff couldn't have been more helpful. Looking forward to the next visit. A pity that all Sheratons aren't as good as this!!

Reviews.Title: “great views from all rooms”
Reviews.Author: bailey07Brisbane
Reviews.Content: Staff are helpful and curtious, definately one of the best places I have stayed at and would definately recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... but”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. Yes, it looks like a great hotel, luxurious and all but it's a pain the butt! First, parking is a nighmare at this hotel. Gates close at odd times, entrances and exits are confusing. The parkade itself is a maze and extremely confusing. Even the hotels front desk admits it's a problem. The parking cost per day is also outrageous! Second, you would think a hotel of this magnitude would have sound proof exterior windows. It seemed like the entire city of Vancouver was coming into my window every morning, and I was on the 18th floor! This said, I didn't get any sleep during my visit. Thirdly, accessing the hotel lobby in the North Tower (Wall) is practically non-existant after hours from the lower main entrance. You have to walk completely around the complex to get to the lobby. Unaceptable! Also, your key does access any entrance doors throughout the complex. All in all, this hotel is simply a painful experience. You have to realize the "Wall" or North Tower as it is called, is not connected to the main hotel or any of the hotel facilities. They are all in another tower - very inconvenient! The rooms are nice, the price is right, the beds are way too soft (but apparently it's suppose to be that way). I rate a 3* on the rooms and a 2* on parking/access/facilties. I didn't eat at the hotel so I can't rate that. I can recommend Earl's a block north of the hotel. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Fun”
Reviews.Author: jayala2k
Reviews.Content: Better than average rooms and great suites with wonderful views of downtown. Many good sights, shopping and restaurants with in walking distance. Great indoor pool!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but don't expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: Denveresque
Reviews.Content: Had we paid the low rates many of the other reviewers had, our experience would have been more pleasant. But at $240 a night which we booked and fully prepaid 3 months before our arrival, we were underwhelmed. Our North Tower corner room was touted as having exquisite views. We'd requested the highest room available, but were given one on the 7th floor. Each side of our corner view room looked straight out onto a massive building. This is not what I would call a great view worthy of the premium we paid. The furnishings were modern and comfortable, and the bed was quite nice. The bathroom was also modern and nice, although a tad small and cramped. The only thing that was bothersome about the room itself was a damp mildew, wet rag odor that never went away, even with the windows opened. That was unfortunate, but we thought that perhaps it was a function of being in a wet and humid city. It wasn't a big deal, but it served as a reminder that we were not in a first tier hotel. If you are interested in a fitness center, do not look forward to the one at the hotel. It is old, cramped, ill-maintained, ill-equipped, and smells of chlorine from the pool. It's functional, but far from state of the art or pleasant. Service at the North Tower lobby bar was very good at times, and not so good at others, depending on who was tending. One evening we stopped at the bar for martinis, and I also requested a decaf coffee. The waitress responded "We don't serve any coffee here. This is a BAR." Wow. Not only was that condescension uncalled for, but the next night we saw coffee being served to a couple at the same bar. But that was the only instance of rudeness we encoutered anywhere in Vancouver, which has well earned its reputation as a genuinely friendly and hospitable city. Vancouver is beautiful beyond words, and the Sheraton is centrally located, within walking distance of many sites and neighborhoods. We never took a cab anywhere (other than the ferry cabs). So the Sheraton is a good, solid and convenient hotel to stay at, and a good base for exploring Vancouver. Just don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value, Loved this hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Janine6649
Reviews.Content: I sayed in the Sheraton in April 2005 and loved it. Booked through Lastminute a week befor I went. managed to get the room for just over £40 a night - splendid value. I had requested a room on the highest floor possible. Was put on 11th floor but when requested one higher, was given one on the 34th loor. Wonderful views, Clean and spacious room - I would highly reccomend this hotel at three times the price i paid as nthing was too much trouble. Central location and was able to walk to all local attractions - recomend lunch at Harbour point revolving restaurant. Not the cheapest but a wonderful experience and great food

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but under-staffed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice room, good view, decent bathroom, fair rate, handy location. Had to wait for 15 minutes at 06:45 to leave my bag with the bellman (who appeared to have deserted his desk), which is unacceptable for a hotel this size at this hour of the morning. Also no-one at the taxi-booking desk for 10 minutes at 18:30 when I was trying to get to the airport, which is unbelievable for a hotel like this at such a busy time of the day. I wouldn't stay here again, unless they get a few more staff.

Reviews.Title: “my favourite”
Reviews.Author: minnsha
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a couple of times and it's our favourite hotel in Vancouver. It's clean, comfortable, quiet and tastefully furnished. It has great views. My only complaint is that it is a long confusing walk to the pool. If you like a modern hotel then this one fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: CubbyandGman
Reviews.Content: There was a lot to like about the hotel, but there is room for improvement. The location is great for tourists and the view afforded by the floor to ceiling windows was very good (we were on the 24th floor of the North Tower). I followed the advice of some of the previous reviewers and had requested a room high in the North Tower prior to arrival and was glad I did. The rooms were very clean and the bed comfortable. We also liked and utilized the fridge and the in-room safe. We paid $109 a night through Priceline for a 4 star hotel. My experience has been that the rooms in four star hotels are generally no better than the ones in 3 star hotels. I guess 4 star hotels should have better service and amenities, but that isn't always the case either. At the Sheraton, everything cost extra (internet access at the business centre, parking ($20 per night), health club access, etc.). Service was average, although it was friendlier after you laid out a tip. Pool hours were way too limited.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Sheraton Vancouver Wall Centre in downtown Vancouver in Aug '05. This was a very spacious corner room, 17th floor in the North Tower which we understood was a newer building. The room was very clean, nice bathroom, extremely comfortable King bed, and a good view towards downtown. We totally enjoyed the location being a short walk from Robeson Street. Across the street, somewhat hidden from view because of its location at a lower level, we found Relish, to be a good restaurant and bar with an outdoor seating area. We thoroughly enjoyed Vancouver. Walked to English Bay (about 20 min) where we found a good Restaurant for lunch, English Bay Boathouse, with outdoor seating overlooking the Bay. We would definitely recommend staying at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Superb ...apart from noisy neighbors and badly soiled carpet”
Reviews.Author: john_d_Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in the North Tower and loved it. The first night was a bit alarming with guests arriving in neighboring room at 4am shouting and swearing. Security calmed them (but only for a little time) and we ended up being transferred to another room the next day. The room furnishings were very modern …the beds excellent. However, the room carpet was badly stained and very much in need of cleaning or replacement. The panoramic views across the city from the floor to ceiling, wall to wall window were quite something … but as a vertigo sufferer took me a few days to get used to. The location is first class ..definitely would return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got a deal from Priceline, $80/night 09/03/05-09/05/05. We checked in at North tower 12th floor, non smoking 1 king bed room. Room smaller than usual hotels, but it's not bad at all considering the hotel located in the middle of downtown Vancouver. Room and bathroom were very clean, bed was really comfortable after long day of walking around town. Hotel staff were very nice and friendly, even parking staff. Parking is quite expensive (CAN$22.80 tax inc) though. But over all, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, breathtaking views.”
Reviews.Author: ennl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in August 2005. We arrived at this hotel at midnight to find that the hotel was full, even though we had booked 9 months earlier and previously informed them of our late arrival. However, to compensate us, we were given a two bedroomed, two bathroomed suite for the evening and a complementary breakfast for the following day. Our suitcases were then transferred for us to our assigned room. The room was clean and well furnished and we had spectacular views over the city, the mountains and the bay. Ask for North tower for best views. The concierge was very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. There is a Starbucks in the lower lobby and there was a great convenience store a block and a half away. This hotel was excellent in every way, a great location near to the main shopping street, which was about two blocks away, and within walking distance to most other things.

Reviews.Title: “Super suite in a great but busy hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We originally won this hotel for $75 on Priceline. At check-in we paid an extra $50 CAD to upgrade to a non-smoking suite on the 27th floor of the South Tower. The room itself was pretty good - excellent wall to ceiling windows, good size sofa bed (which was only used as a sofa and was comfy), wet bar etc. For the money we paid we were delighted, although as others have noted the facilities of the north tower are a little trek away. This is an extremely busy hotel - although to be fair we received good standards of service from everyone. There was always a queue on the small south tower lobby with luggage piled ceiling high. Valet parking is the same as public parking $20 CAD and our car was brought around promptly. Excellent location within minutes of Robson Street and the Paramount cinema on Burrard Street. North Tower rooms are meant to be great too, but apparently suites and club rooms are all located in the South Tower. Ultimately we got a great suite at a great price in a great location. We were delighted.

Reviews.Title: “the "art of hotel" badly needs an art teacher”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price, we were quite disappointed. We stayed 3 nights, it was already booked. The room was small , no particular view.The smoke alarm went off whenever you took a shower. When we call down to see if we needed to evacuate, they knew the shower was the culprit and the desk staff suggested "just open your door and windows"( now theres a secure solution). The safe had problems, very nice woman came up to fix it but admitted they were replacing them all because" the combinations are just too sensitive.We requested an Ethernet cord in person at the very understaffed and over worked concierge desk, then called down 40 minutes later to remind them.Requested it again. Never did get one.So much for internet. The concierge staff were nice , but too few for the size of the hotel , and were young and under experienced. We never ate at the hotel resturants. Great little place for breakfast next door and 1/3 the price. All in all, Sheraton can and should do far better. We are even Starwood Members.I would not return , too many other nice choices. Stayed our last night in Vancouver at the Blue Horizon Hotel. The room was easily twice the size , we had a private balcony with 220 degree views of English Bay...and Ethernet was includes free! Similar price.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A hotel is usually just a place to sleep between activites but not the Wall. I loved the room on the 24th floor of north tower. It was clean, the bed extremely comfortable and the floor to ceiling windows made the room seem really large. The views were amazing and I really looked forward to getting back after a day out and about. It was very quiet and restful. We had an elevator outside our door that seemed seldom used. We never heard it and only once or twice did we share it with anyone during the entire six days. We never ate at any of the restaurants at the hotel because there are so many great places to eat in Vancouver so I can't comment on them. The bellman was terrific getting our luggage to us after having it lost on airline for two days. He and the maids are the only ones we had any interaction with and they were great. I will stay there again and strongly recommend it to anyone who wants a great hotel in the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Really Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: chickabey
Reviews.Content: My teen daughter and I stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre Hotel in downtown Vancouver for 4 nights and had a terrific time! I would definitely go there again. I read the reviews on tripadvisor and took one reviewers suggestion of emailing the hotel a week before arrival and asking for a "high floor in the north tower". I received an email back from the hotel saying "no problem". We stayed on the 24th floor which provided an outstanding view of the city with great floor to ceiling windows. We felt the rooms were very classy, clean and the beds and pillows were "oh so comfy". Location is central to walk nearly everywhere (restaurants, Robson street, small ferry to Granville island. The staff at the hotel were all terrific, except for the 2 of the front desk clerks - couldn't give us the time of day, but there were plenty of other helpful people. As others have said - parking is expensive, but i just took a "what the heck" attitude - we're on holiday - and didn't let it ruin the great trip. I'll go back!

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful When Making Reservations”
Reviews.Author: JWBCastroValley
Reviews.Content: Stayed from July 16-21. I had called a week before my arrival to make sure my reservation was correct. I even spoke to the manager. When I arrived at the hotel around 6 pm., I proceeded to check-in. To my surprise, I was told that the 2 non smoking family suites in the south tower that I reserved for my family and my sister's family were not held. What was held for me was a traditional room and a smoking family suite. Suffice to say, I was furious since I had just spoken with the manager 8 days before and customer service the night before to make sure my reservations were correct. The clerk at the desk did his best to find me accommodations to sleep 10 people. He ended up putting us in a 2 bedroom suite and a traditional room for the night. On the next day, I was given the option to view the two family suites and the traditional rooms in the north tower. (the north tower is newer and nicer than the south tower) After seeing the rooms in the north tower, I chose to stay in the north tower, but my sister and her family were ok staying in the family suite in the south tower. Upon meeting the manager, she apologized profusely for the errors. I told her I wanted to stay in the north tower, but needed a room large enough for 5 people. She was nice enough to offer me two adjoining rooms at the same price as a family suite. My sister and her family ended up moving to the north tower and staying in adjoining rooms as well for the same price. She also gave us both one complimentary night for all the trouble with the reservations. Other than the reservation problems, the North Tower was very nice and the hotel is located centrally to town. I would not walk around the area late at night as there are homeless teenagers that hang around the hotel corner. The north tower is much, much nicer than the south tower. Newer rooms and larger bathrooms. I would definitely stay there again, but only in the north tower. Because of the reservation problems, I was also given Club Level access. The club lounge has a nice view, but needs to be a nicer room. Didn't look that clean, and not very big.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST IN VANCOUVER!!”
Reviews.Author: RPKVancouver
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Vancouver for business and pleasure. This by far is one of the nicest. We stayed in the North Tower with views of the fountain below. The staff were very friendly. Rooms were very clean with a very comfortable bed, desk area, and nice bathroom. Hotel is quiet and clean and central to all things downtown. Restaurant on the main floor in the north tower was excellent. One of the nicest Sheratons around!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, better location”
Reviews.Author: cattleclass_traveler
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel as much for its location as anything. It's a couple of level blocks to Robson St. w/its eating and shopping possibilities. All of the West End and Downtown is within walking distance. In the Wall Centre complex there's a nice upscale wine & beer shop, a convenience store (which wouldn've been nicer if it had stayed open late - it was closed by 10pm during my visit), and a Subway sandwich shop (open til midnight) among other businesses. There's also a nice looking Chinese restaurant on the next block and an organic supermarket that's open late about a block away from the hotel. Self parking is indeed CAD$22 for 24 hours - not sure about valet rates. At least there's easy access to the hotel from the garage. This is a business/convention class hotel. You are quite anonymous here. My room was in the South Tower and it was fine but nothing to jump up and down about. The bed was comfortable but did seem smaller than in other Sheraton's. I think that may have been because the room was shaped like a "J" and was medium to small in size. There was no balcony in my room. The views looking west were fabulous and all of the appointments were nice. The mini-bar is empty upon check-in and if you want it stocked you fill out a request slip and call housekeeping - I like that because I'd rather put my stuff in the fridge than a bunch of overpriced bottles & snacks. For my next trip, and I will return, I will try to get a room in the North Tower which is newer and supposedly nicer with larger rooms. Still, the South Tower is just fine if that's all you can get. Also the side of the South Tower that faces West towards English Bay has a hospital with its emergency room directly across the street so be prepared for the occassional siren.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but service variable”
Reviews.Author: ChrisWendy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for Downtown Vancouver but rooms can vary. When we first checked in our room was smokey (despite being a non-smoking room) and facilities a little tired. On request we were moved to a much better standard of room on the 29th floor (it seems the higher you go in the South tower the better the rooms). Views great. The hotel seems to deal predominantly with tours so the facilities seem to be geared to this. There seems to be a lack of dining facilities for a hotel of this size and we would definitely recommend eating breakfast in one of the many restaurants nearby rather than in the hotel itself. Room service was good and efficient. Porters good. Reception poor and there can be long delays at check-in if you hit the time of a group arrival. We asked for (and were promised) a late check-out but on checking again on the morning of departure this was no longer possible, necessitating in a mad scramble to pack our bags and check out before beginning an organised trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: coconutgelato
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a night at the Sheraton Vancouver, and we absolutely loved it! We got a great deal online, and when we got there, were upgraded to a gorgeous room on the 27th floor in the North Tower. Definitely request a room in the North Tower if you go. We had floor to ceiling windows with a sweeping view of the mountains, water, and the city. They are all about customer service, and met all of our requests- you just have to ask for what you want! The health club's steam room and sauna are wonderful. It's in the perfect location, within walking distance to all the shopping and restaurants on Robson, etc. Our favorite dining spot: Cactus Club Cafe on Robson. Hip, great service, fresh and tasty food. We're very picky travellers, and will definitely stay at the Sheraton Vancouver again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific property - Excellent location - Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Sam
Reviews.Content: Despite the negative reviews on Tripadvisor, this Sheraton is definitely a 4+ star hotel. The problem I find with Sheraton's is that their quality level is not as consistent as say Westins are. In this case, the Sheraton Wall Centre is definitely a luxury hotel worthy, in fact, of the Westin name. I suspect that because Starwood already has two other Westin's in Vancouver, the Sheraton Wall Centre is left to carry the lesser name "Sheraton". I stayed in the North tower. I saw the South Tower lobby and like others on this site, the north lobby is better -- although, I didn't find myself hanging out in the lobby so I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. The rooms are VERY modern and, like I said above, reminded me of a Westin decor. The sleeper bed is very comfortable - not quite up to the Heavenly Bed experience because they still include that rather nasty brown fuzzy blanket -- not sure where hotels get that thing. The bathroom is a nice size and has Pantene shampoo products. Robe was also included in my room. The gym looked to probably be adequate for most. The sauna and steam room and pool are free. The "gym" equipment costs $10 a day for guests. Truth is that the gym equipment might be okay for most gym goers -- the hardcore gym goers might find it missing some machinery. I fell into the second category. No worries though because there's a gym called "World Fitness" that's only a few blocks away. They charged me $10 for a day visit. A MUCH BETTER option if you want a full gym -- although WF didn't have a steam room or sauna or pool. Parking at the Sheraton is VERY expensive -- $22 self parking. You are able to park at the meters on the street for free after 8PM and until 9AM. The phone calls are also expensive - $1.60 for a line. A lot of Westins now have a flat rate Communications Package -- not the Sheraton. Internet was $11. Location wise this is not a bad location. Although, I had the option to stay at the Westin Bay Shore and I regretted not staying there because it is right on the water and next to Stanley Park. I had to drive down there to go blading but if I'd stayed at the Westin I would have been able to lace up and go. Any way you slice it, the Sheraton Vancouver is a top notch property that is worth staying at. You won't regret it. Service is great and this is definitely a 4 or 5 star hotel. I would give it a 5 star b/c there's a Starbucks right in the hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel and rooms are very sleak and modern-looking and the Sheraton's "Sweet Sleeper" beds are definitely very comfortable. We had an AMAZING view on the 27th floor; especially one entire wall consisting of huge floor-to-ceiling glass. The hotel's location is very convenient to most everything. The best part is it's one of the tallest buildings in Vancouver so it's difficult to get lost from the hotel if you're downtown. On 2 of the nights, I was awaken by people talking in another room. However, I couldnt tell if it was coming from an adjacent room or one below or above. I'm not a light sleeper, so I went back to bed quickly. But, I shouldn't have been able to hear anything.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very dishonest. We had heard that international travelers could get a refund of Canadian GST taxes, but did not know how to get this refund. We asked the hotel about the tax refund when we were checking out, and they said they could do it right there at the hotel. After the lady processed the refund, she then informed me that they had charged me a fee of approximately 30% of my refund!! I did not dispute the fee because she had already finished processing the refund and because I did not know any better. When we left Canada, we stopped at the Canada/U.S. border and found out from the border people that they process GST refunds without any fee!! The hotel did not tell me that I could get a refund without any fee at the border. I also found out that you can get a refund without any fee at the International Airport. In addition, I could not get a refund of the GST taxes I had paid for all of my souvenirs because I did not meet the minimum dollar amount required without my hotel taxes. The hotel also had not informed me of this. Therefore, the hotel, in addition to charging me a hefty fee, also cost me my refund on all my other purchases. I am currently having to waste more time with the hotel because their refund of the taxes somehow did not go through to my credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Hotel just above average”
Reviews.Author: crysns
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. We were able to walk so many places even with a wheelchair and a baby stroller. It seemed like a nice area and we felt fine waling even at night. It was a cheap taxi ride (approx. $6) whenever we wanted to go somewhere further away. The rooms were nice, but nothing special. The view was good. We were in the South tower and only on the 18th floor. We did wish it had a nicer lobby like the North Tower does. Would definitely stay there again so that we have easy access to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed the Wall centre Sheraton twice in 1 week and got different results. The first time I stayed on the north tower wich was good but not what I expected, room was small and very noisy, I could hear all the plumbing from the other rooms beside me. Shower was terrible, no pressure and variable tempatures while you shower.Tried the restaurant,good but overpriced, $7.50 for a small draft beer. The second time I stayed on the south tower on the 27th floor, much nicer with a balcony and a view of the bay and the moutains. Room was bigger and the washroom was much better. Mini bar was empty and you had to call in what you wanted at room service type charges. So avoid the restaurant and the bar.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: cbrooke
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, but we had some issues. We booked a spa package which included free in-room movie, $100 towards Vida Wellness Spa, late check-out and superior accomodations. Check-in was fast and easy, however we were placed in the older South tower on the 33rd floor. We decided to check out the room and because of the FANTASTIC view decided to stay there. We had a panoramic view of all of English Bay, Kitsilano and North and West Vancouver. The North tower may be fresher and newer but I think the South tower would have better views. We moved the couch in front of the window to enjoy the view and found dried flower petals and a soiled towel on the floor. To the hotels credit they did come and clean the floor while we went out for dinner. We only had one bathrobe in the room and had to call for another. We couldn't use express check-out as they charged us for the movie even though it was supposed to be included. We looked at the room service menu....I can't believe the prices! Much cheaper and convient to walk to Robson to eat! Overall, the view and central location and the wonderful facial at the spa made up for any shortcomings of the hotel! The staff at the spa was alittle disorganized but still a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great view, great service, great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. We were in the north tower, which has a nicer lobby than the south tower. The south tower also seems nice and has the business office. The rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows with an awesome view. Ask for as high as floor as possible. We had a city, mountain and water view. I absolutely loved this hotel. The concierges weren't very knowledgeable, a letdown for a 4-star hotel. But they were damn cute. So were the bellhops. And they charge for the biz office and the gym. (They didn't tell me about the gym charge but I saw the $10.95 charge by checking the bill on the room's TV. We decided to switch beds so my friend could get a view by the window, and they actually had room service change the sheets for us at about 7 p.m. I was surprised and impressed they still had room service at that time. They have the best rates on their own Web site, and offer discounts with the Entertainment card.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel...no major complaints”
Reviews.Author: lunchtime
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided on the Sheraton Wall Centre because of the great rate we got as Entertainment card members. When we first checked in and asked for a room on a higher floor, they told us they could put us in the South tower on the 17th floor. I had been warned the South Tower is not as nice as the North Tower, but we agreed to check it out. The room was so SMALL! There was just enough room to walk around the bed and the room itself was very outdated. We insisted on a room in the North Tower and they accommodated our request. That room was much better (except for the dirty towel accidentally left in the hallway outside). The room was modern, clean, bed was comfortable, and it had a good sized bathroom. It was also nice to have a Starbucks downstairs in the lower lobby. Overall, service was fine.. nothing out of the ordinary, but we didn't expect that at a big hotel like this. I'd stay here again, if I could get a really good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2holiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Sheraton Wall in November 2004. We were attending a company Christmas Party at the hotel. We had decided to book a room instead of driving home afterwards..... and we were so glad we did. Our corner room in the North Tower was absolutely beautiful. It has the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in and the view was incredible from the floor to ceiling windows surrounding the outside walls of the room. After seeing our room, I just wanted to spend the nite there, w/o attending the party! Would definately book there again!

Reviews.Title: “just 'okay'”
Reviews.Author: Mike_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: I really do not see what everyone has been raving about. Due to this review, I passed on staying on some great hotels and oped for the Sheraton Wall. When I arrived, the lobby was non-existent and way too small. I am a SPG Plat member and they did NOT upgrade me during my check in. I checked in with the hotel manager named Shawn. Shawn told me there were no upgrades available because the hotel is booked solid. The Sheraton wall center is over 35 floors, he put me on the 10th floor. He said there were also no rooms avaible above 10th floor. I had a special request for high floors. After I checked in, I called SPG Plat services and they said there were lots of suites and 1 bedrooms available and Shawn should have upgraded me. So they called sheraton wall front desk and had me "taken care off". Needless to say, the problem was resolved and a 1 bedroom suite magically did appear and I was moved to the 27th floor. Beside all this hoopla, the exclusive club level is small. the food was good and service at the exclusive lounge was good. Keep in mind that anything below 20th floor you will NOT be able to see any views of Vancouver because they are blocke by tall residential and office buildings. The location was great. The hotel service was poor. The lobby was small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: deedle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November . Room was a little cramped for 3 adults but the we stayed on the 33rd floor so the views made up for it. Lift goes up v quickly so beware! Room service very good ( breakfast pancakes get the thumbs up !) Good location and great staff - would stay again

Reviews.Title: “terribly hard beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very nice one, but we didn't get an ounce of sleep all night because the beds were so hard and uncomfortable. It is also very noisy due to being in the center of town - cheap double glazing which isn't effective. The room was also not adequately heated so we either had to listen to a noisy heater all night or freeze. On top of that the service by one of the female cafe one managers was aweful. I got 50% of our money back but I will never stay there again! Nadine

Reviews.Title: “The greatest hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 7 nights at the Sheraton Wall Centre! We are so impressed with the hotel we will return again. The rooms are clean and well kept and the staff there are outstanding. We spent many hours in their health centre, enjoying the hot tubs, pool and steam room. We walked to the Canada centre and to many eating establishments. Loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Incredible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BC97
Reviews.Content: The Wall Centre is by far the best Starwood hotel I've visited besting the Sheraton Suites in Key West, Disney Swan by Westin, Sheraton Bal Harbour (N. Miami Beach), Sheraton Burlington, VT just to name a few. We stayed at the Wall Centre in late August 2003 (okay, so I'm getting caught up writing a bunch of reviews at one time). Room rate converted to about $140 USD/night at the time. Check-in was a breeze. We were able to choose from a lower or higher floor and stayed on the 27th floor of the north tower. The views were tremendous with the floor to ceiling windows. The Sleeper beds were awesome (my wife wants to return just for that). The room felt spacious with a small sitting area. Probably felt bigger because of that incredible view. The bellman was terrific quickly bringing up our luggage that was lost the day before by the airline (never have had my luggage show up on the same day when flying Delta) and helped us find our first watering hole and micro brews around town. Concierge was outgoing and went out of his way to take care of our requests. The indoor pool located in the north tower was average, but it was nice to be able to open the windows in there to catch a cool breeze and watch cars pass by on the downtown streets below. We took a shuttle from the airport, so we didn't have to worry about parking which I understand is costly. Certainly don't need a car to get around. Almost everything is within walking distance. Easy walk to False Creek, a short water taxi from there to the market, etc. Tons of shopping, bars, restaurants, hash cafe, etc. within walking distance. If you want to go to Grouse Mountain or the suspension bridge, just take a taxi. Cost was about $25 CAD or so each way if I remember correctly from last year. Share the cab with another couple and it's that much easier. Never bothered dining at the hotel. Why should we when there are so many terrific restaurants to choose from all within a few short blocks? I would love to go back to Vancouver and stay at this hotel. We stayed only 3 short nights before a cruise to Alaska. I enjoyed every minute of downtown Vancouver and this hotel was the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 9 night stay at the Sheraton Wall Centre. The staff were extremely friendly and accomodating from check in to leaving, our room was also very spacious with all the facilities needed. The room didn't have a view but it made up for it in size. The staff were considerably knowlegeable on all the attractions and sites to see in Vancouver and provided us with all the information needed. The only downside which is pretty minor considering, but there is only 1 restuarant in the whole hotel and it was very pricey, so most nights we headed to Robson Street for dinner. Overall we had a fantastic stay at the Sherton and would really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze considering the courteous front desk clerk, who welcomed and genuinely and confidently wished us a pleasant stay. Initially, my request for a "corner room" on an "upper floor" of the "north tower" was met. However, I soon realized that our assigned 18th floor room was not even halfway up the mammoth tower (it can be seen from all over the Vancouver Valley...I wonder if it is the tallest building in BC). The view, even from an 18th floor room, was inspiring! (It's a pity we can't post our photos on this website.) I could only imagine, though, that floors above 27 could see beyond the surrounding buildings and into the horizonal sunset. The room was modern, comfortable, and tastefully appointed. Most impressive was the decorative artwork that appeared to depict the surrounding neighborhood during autumn (I'm curious now, whether the artwork is rotated seasonally). The sleek sitting area and the dry bar with wine glasses and complimentary cork screw added a touch of elegance. The bed was like a cloud, on which I enjoyed some of the best slumber I'd had in a long time. On the downside (yes, this hotel does have a couble drawbacks), the cost to park under the hotel complex was more than the cost of my rental car ($23/day to park vs $17/day to rent a car). Even the seasoned directionalist would get lost in the maze of illmarked parking ramps, elevators, and staircases that seem to lead you through a hodgepodge of parking mayhem (not to mention the incautious vallet drivers barrelling around every corner). MOST FRUSTRATING, though, was the fact that the onsite swimming pool and fitness center closed at 8:30PM during the weekends. I'm not sure if this is a Canadian phenomenon or a Sheraton hotel policy, but it was very disappointing to not be able to take advantage of the relaxation and fitness facilities after enjoying the city during the day. All in all, I would choose this hotel again. But first, I would call around Vancouver to inquire about the other area hotels' parking and pool policies. If there is another luxury hotel that better accomodates the weekend tourister/relaxation-enthusiast with a rental car, I would give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: wafwil
Reviews.Content: We just returned from five days at the Sheraton Wall Center..and enjoyed every moment! When we arrived, the desk told us that they were putting us in a double room in the North Tower, but if we wanted, they would move us to a king the next day. Our bellboy told us to request a corner room (ending in 54 or 61)..we did and the room was fantastic. Ceiling to floor windows on two sides, a nice sitting area..nice bathroom and comfy bed. We fell asleep with the curtains wide open and enjoyed the view and the full moon every night. The staff was super, offering help at every turn. The hotel is a large business hotel, therefore it does not have some of the personal touches of a boutique hotel, but it is NOT impersonal and cold as some business locations can be. All in all, we loved Vancouver and our stay at the Sheraton added greatly to our enjoyment!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First rate service from a first rate hotel. Prime location, great views and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Highly recommended
